<color=#ffffff>You won't need to concern yourself with helping us with our problems any longer. We've cleaned up most of the damage, and left only a few scorchmarks so the inspectors don't get suspicious.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>It looks exactly like it was. A minor incident, and nothing more.</color>

Welcome to Arriake Technology. The leading manufacturer of Optronics and Advanced Electronics in the galaxy!\nI'm the secretary for the plant manager. I handle any and all service orders and supplies. So, what can I do for you?

Welcome to Arriake Technology. The leading manufacturer of Optronics and Advanced Electronics in the galaxy!\nI'm the secretary for the plant manager. I handle any and all service orders and supplies. You don't seem to be one of our regular suppliers, so i'm afraid you're not authorized to be here.

<color=#ffffff>Yes, you've passed muster.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>You're listed as a contractor and are authorized to supply us with raw materials.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Are you interested in a little contract work?</color>

Your order has been confirmed and received. Here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits and an official {RepCounter} Reputation Bonus with Polaris. We'll notify you if we need further supplies from you in future. Please take one of our products as a sample to distribute to potential clients.

One of our suppliers ran afoul of pirates and their delivery won't be coming. You'll be paid accordingly for bringing in the same shipment of:\nx750 Gold Ingots\nThat are used in almost all of our Electronics manufacture and you can guess why they were targeted by Pirates.

One of our regular suppliers has gone bankrupt, so we're still waiting for replacement. In the meantime, you could take over their regular contract of:\nx50 Xenon Bottles\nThey're used in many of our lasers and we'll have depleted our supplies soon. So the company is willing to pay 50% over market price for a shipment.

We've used up more coolant this month than the last and our regular supplier won't be sending a shipment for another three weeks. We need:\nx15 Coolant\nIn the meantime to tide over our stocks until it can arrive. I'm authorized to issue payments up to double the market price.

Platinum is in high demand with low supply. We haven't had a shipment in 4 months and our stocks are running low. Bring me: x750 Platinum Ingots And you'll be compensated with double market value for the shipment. That's more than anywhere else will pay.

As many of the procedures here are conducted using robotics, we need a steady supply of replacement parts. A service order has been in effect for a month with no word from our suppliers at Hostile Apparatus. If you can fill the order of x10 Robotics I'm authorized to pay double market price for the parts you deliver. You will likely need Transportation Boosters to bring them inside though.

<color=#ffffff>Your services are no longer required.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Feel free to browse our catalogue though. Normally we only sell to high-value customers, but your loyalty to the company is admirable so we've made an exception.</color>

Welcome to Non-Linear Productions or 'NLP' as we're most commonly known.\nI'm the foreman for the entire plant. As you can see: In this here place we handle the manufacturing of Warp Drives, Mining Equipment and Fusion Reactors.\nMake sure you've got a ship connected before you buy any of our oversized products. Not our problem if you drop it on your foot.

Welcome to Non-Linear Productions or 'NLP' as we're most commonly known. I'm the foreman for the entire plant. As you can see: In this place we handle the manufacturing of Warp Drives, Mining Equipment and Fusion Reactors.@p9 We're not taking any more orders at this time due to a material shortage. Sorry, pal. Pirates keep hitting our shipments.

<color=#ffffff>We're back on track for supplies thanks to you; We can handle a few new orders now but we're still short on supplies.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>If you can lend a hand, we'd be mighty appreciative.</color>
Sorry, but you're on your own

Great news! Your shipment's been taken to the boys around the back and they're bouncin' off the walls, now that the load's off their back. Here's a lil' something the boys and I put together. It's just {MoneyCounter} Credits and {RepCounter} Company Rep.@p9 We'll be fine from here on out, so don't you worry. As a little extra, we're giving you a couple of castoffs from the production line. We can't sell 'em ourselves because of some scratches in the finish, but they'll work fine if ya don't mind 'em looking a bit seedy.

We've been working our asses off day and night with the supply shortage requiring all hands on deck to make sure nothing gets wasted. The boys need a break so if'n ya can bring them:@p8 x48 Bottles of Beer x48 Bottles of Liquor x5 Pizzas That'll do. Doesn't take more than a few six-packs and a pizza to keep the boys happy for a shift.

We're missing a few shipments, so if'n you can make up the difference, we'll be able to cut back on the recycling processes we're currently running double-time to make up for the material shortages.@p9 What we're missing right now is mostly raw materials. x800 Sathium Ingots Will do us a load of good, and the boys'll help me chip in for a payout if you can manage it. You might need a Transportation Booster to carry all them ingots. Don't worry, well make back the difference in a few days.

Ai'ght, so we're down several shipments of parts for our Fusion Cores and we can't make any more until we've got a shipment of: x50 Superconductors Yes, you heard me right. I need 50 of them, and they're expensive and they're made mostly by those eggheads at Arriake Technology. I'll pay through the nose for them if you can get me a load.
<color=#0088ff>I have a shipment of Superconductors for you, boss.</color>

We had a shipment of Heat Exchangers on the way, but the pirates got 'em so now we're down a set for the Drive Core that's going in a freighter refit:\nx30 Heat Exchangers\nAre all we need to complete the order, but it's on the backburner while another shipment's on its way.
<color=#0088ff>I've brought you those Heat Exchangers, Boss</color>

Ai'ght, so we make big stuff here. We're not so good with the little things, so we get them shipped in. Problem is that we're running low on regulators and need a shipment or ten to keep working at the current pace.@p9 If you can work out a deal for: x400 Energy Regulators We can work out a reward for you. The boys are too busy to unload yer ship, so you'll be need Transportation Boosters to bring them inside yourself. They're pretty heavy.
<color=#0088ff>I've brought you those Energy Regulators you wanted.</color>

Great work, kiddo.\nThe boys can finally take a break and all our work schedules are coming together. We can put out the shipments we've been holding off on and go home tonight.\nCouldn't have done it without you!
Welcome to Zero Horizons. Where nothing can stop you.\nAs you can see, we're in space. And in space, we're specialized for zero-G construction and cold welding.\nWhat can I help you with today?

Welcome to Zero Horizons. Where nothing can stop you. ... Except import tax apparently. We've got 4 ships lined up outside the system awaiting clearance from the Zirax Sector Command under suspicion that the ships are actually pirates.@p9 What a load of crap! This is clearly targeted harassment by Rados for undercutting their market to the Imperial Shipyards!@w3 Say, do you wanna make some quick cash?

<color=#ffffff>We've still got those ships stuck outside the system under guard by Xenu Cruisers with our supplies on board.@w3</color>\n<color=#ffffff>You've helped us out, and I could sure use the help in sorting out this mess again. If we can hold out another few weeks, they'll be forced to let the ships go.</color>\n<color=#66ccff>Mind helping us out again?</color>

I knew I could count on you! You've helped us stay in the game another few days and given us the opportunity to one-up the Zirax border patrol. Here's {MoneyCounter} Credits and {RepCounter} Polaris Company Rep to make up for the trouble you had to go through.@p9 We can't get a number of our shipments out through the blockade either, so you can take some of the overflow. We'll make more when those goons give it up and traffic can flow again.

That's what I like o hear! Right, so the first order of business is food. It's not on the freighters out there, but because of the zirax blockade the regular deliveries aren't getting through to us OR the planets.@p8 We're already on short rations, so if you can bring us: x10 Dino Stew x10 Waffles x10 Fruit Pies x30 Coffee That should spice up our meals for a few days. Just make sure you get us COFFEE, not that herbal tea crap.

Great! What we need you to do is get get us the same orders as the freighter's they've got impounded out there. We'll pay you 50% above market price for anything you bring.@p9 One of the freighters out there is carrying a shipment of... x92 Bottles of Helium We need it for deep-space transports that use them in their thrusters as propellant. Old-fashioned, I know. But it's still the best way to stop in a hurry without a 2 week reverse burn after a long lead-up.@p9 You won't be able to move that much mass yourself, even in zero-G. Get yourself some good armor with Transportation Boosters and you'll be able to carry the bottles. I know you can buy them from Hostile Apparatus and maybe ServantCorp.

We line our thruster cones with graphite since they're the only things that can withstand the heat and force of a high-powered plasma thruster, but all our graphite is on one of those freighters being held by the Zirax authorities.@p9 If you can bring us a shipment of: x525 Graphite We can bring production back up, which will hopefully force those goons into reconsidering wasting credits holding freighters carrying spare supplies.

If we want to get those zirax authorities off our case, we need to show them that holding the freighters is only going to cost them credits. But bringing in a shipment under their nose and ramping up production, they'll realize they're wasting their time trying to starve us out.@p9 If you can bring in a shipment of: x750 Sathium Ingots We can stick it to those corrupt port authorities and get production back on track.

Great work, kiddo.\nThe boys can finally take a break and all our work schedules are coming together. We can put out the shipments we've been holding off on and go home tonight.\nCouldn't have done it without you!
Welcome to P3: Polaris Planetside Production.\nWe're only a small operation, but we're wide-spread across the galaxy, producing supplies and infrastructure for colonies and emergency shelters.

Welcome to P3: Polaris Planetside Production. We're only a small operation, but we're wide-spread across the galaxy, producing supplies and infrastructure for colonies and emergency shelters.@p8 It's the fact that we're so small that this factory is often overlooked by Polaris. So we never get the supplies we order, or when a shipment arrives it's bottom-of-the-pile stuff. It's making it hard to put our products on the market.@w3 You've got a ship right? Wanna make some extra cash getting supplies for us?

<color=#ffffff>You've done right by us here, and we're always looking for a dedicated bunch of suppliers that won't stiff us on the quality because we're small.</color>\n<color=#66ccff>Mind helping us out again?</color>

Your shipment was a welcome addition to our supplies! It's nice to have someone come through on bringing in good quality resources for our factory. You have no idea how much this'll put the guys in marketing at ease.@p8 Here's your agreed upon payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits and i've sent a memo to polaris for {RepCounter} Company Rep for your account. And just to show our gratitude, here's some of our products. I'm sure you can a colony that needs them.

Great news! We've been getting stiffed by our suppliers because of our size, so you helping us out might stimulate their competitive side. Wishful thinking probably, but there's no harm in it.@p8 What we normally get in our shipments is raw materials like: x400 Titanium Plates Which we use for our modules, but the ones we get are always dented, bent or scratched which means either we spend more resurfacing the plates or put out sub-standard products. Hopefully you can help us with that.
<color=#0088ff>The plates i've brought are pristine. Fresh out of the constructor.</color>

Oh, that's excellent! I'm tired of Ea-Nasir constantly supplying us with the wrong grade of copper to the point that i've filed numerous complaints with Polaris for having him on the registered trader list.@p9 If you can supply us with a shipment greater than his, we'll have a legitimate reason to break the contract with him. Let's say... x1250 Copper Ingots should give us reason enough to end our business with him.@p9 Get yourself some Transportation Boosters and you'll be able to move the Copper. I know, not ideal that you need to equip at least two of the things to carry the copper, but that's how it's done in high-volume trading.

One of the hardening process for some housing module variants require sulfur for vulcanization of the sealing for airtightness, but our suppliers never send us enough to do the process properly@p8 If you can bring us: x850 Sulfur We can put out more reliable products consistently, at least for a while. That should encourage our supplier that we can and will go somewhere else for the sulfur they won't provide enough.@p9 If you can't find a supplier or mining site that can get you sulfur; you can always get it yourself by mining magmatic rock. Set up your own mining facility and you can very likely find a good market for Sulfur. I know InterWeap's factories never have enough.
<color=#0088ff>I've got a steady supply of sulfur</color>

We're always getting off-cuts and low-quality plastic tubing that we use inside our prefab housing modules. These are vital to the people who live in them and poor insulation or a leak can be fatal. At least for the sake of those people, we need better quality materials.@p8 If you can supply the factory with: x265 Plastic Tubes We can all breathe a little bit easier knowing that our prefab housing won't suddenly implode in a high pressure environment.
<color=#0088ff>I've got you a shipment of plastic tubing.</color>

While some of our suppliers will at least send up materials, poor quality or not, they're at least sending them. We're locked in a contract with a third-party for tablet interfaces for a number of vital parts, and they won't even ship to any of our factories.@p9 If I could, i'd open a new contract to Chromium-Sierra Sciences, but head office won't allow it. If you can bring back: x400 Tablets We can actually finish one of the orders we've put on hold for 6 months and maybe force Polaris to authorize a trade agreement with CSS for all future sales.
<color=#0088ff>I've brought you a shipment of tablets</color>

<color=#ffffff>Thanks to your undercutting our current suppliers, a few of them have finally taken the initiative to start shipping us good quality materials. At least for a while...@w3</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Head office wasn't happy with you jeopardizing their contracts, but was far happier that you'd put profits up with no extra costs. So they've authorized contracts to new suppliers.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Looks like this'll be the end of our partnership. Thanks for all your help.</color>

We're in space. So we need a steady supply of oxygen, which we can get. The problem is that we're burning through it too fast since our Air Filters are starting to deteriorate with the increased up-time we're doing.@p9 If you can work out a deal for: x40 Filters We can work out a reward for you... or we'll all suffocate.
<color=#0088ff>I've got those Air Filters you need.</color>

The hell are you doing back here?\nThis isn't a sight-seeing tour or some kinda boutique shop on a trade station. This is a cloudmining factory. We skim the surface of Gas Giants and harvest the gases below, pull back up and process them.\nWe don't deal with customers; we ship our stuff out and that's it.
How about we cut out the middleman and you sell direct?

The hell are you doing here? This isn't a sight-seeing tour or some kinda boutique shop. This is a cloudmining factory. We skim the surface of Gas Giants and harvest the gases below, pull back up and process them.@p8 If you're looking to avoid getting stomped, you'll stay where you are and out of the way of my boys and the mechanoids. We're already operating at max capacity and I don't have the time to handhold you dirtdiggers.

<color=#ffffff>Don't go offering more help or might put you to actual work on the turbines. I just want you out of my way and off my station.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>As it happens, i've got a problem for an outsider that needs solving.</color>

I was wrong about you, kid!\nYou've got your head on straight an done me an' the boys a solid, so here's {MoneyCounter} Credits for the work you put in. No rep.\nI've thrown in a couple o' old tanks with some fresh gas, for the road.

Alright, you wanna play with the big boys? Well, we work hard and play harder. Go bring us back some booze. The good stuff, none of that TOP-brewery piss... Except Gerold, he likes those fruity cocktails.@p9 That'll be: x250 Liquor x5 Bloody Zirax x5 Promethium Blues x5 Dirty Legacy You can get those cocktails from most bars and restaurants. Liquor from a real distillery.

Well, we process gasses here. That means we go through Gas Filters at an insane rate. We have to clean them to make them last longer since the delays between shipments can put an end to work for a week or longer.@p9 You bring us a fresh load and you cut down on our workload. x100 Filters should do it, and once we're back at peak productivity, we'll accept as more shipments.

You see those big intake vents on the outside of the hull? Inside them are big graphite filters that suck all the radioactive gases out of the intake. They need replacing every week. You wanna help? Go get me: x500 Graphite That'll let me boys send out a mechanoid to replace the one we've got. Hop to it, kid.
<color=#0088ff>I've got your replacement graphite right here</color>

Your assistance in this matter is appreciated. Either way, you've accepted the task on your own recognizance. It won't affect the labs negatively either way, so do your best.@p9 I have a list of materials to replace here, and the one currently at the top of the list is: x500 Biological Specimens Uncommon growths that are used in antibacterial scrubs and injections. They can be artificially stimulated in any Medical Constructor, or even a food processor if you're desperate enough.

I'll make you regret offerin' to help out 'round here. Get in yer ship and go find me: x300 Zascosium Alloy Been needing to strip the cladding on the reaction chambers and just waiting on some new Zasc for the job an' here you are. Go on, get!
<color=#ffffff>Won't be needin' yer help from now on, I reckon.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>If you wanna give us a hand out, we'll take a few shipments of Filters if you got 'em.</color>

<color=#aaff00>Friend! Look at what my farms have produced! Have you not seen anything as glorious?</color>\n<color=#aaff00>Truly I cannot be outdone by any </color><color=#ffbb00>Polaris </color><color=#aaff00>farmer!</color>

Yes, i'm worried. My mushrooms are sensitive to changes in temperature and we've lately been getting many cold nights. Far colder than the previous cycles and it looks as though I may lose my entire crop if it drops to sharply.@p9 Ideally, I would like to cover my farm with beryllium nanofiber mesh, but the Zirax will likely burn it to ash to see such advanced materials in the hands of the Tal'on. Perhaps you can bring me 10 of your Thermal Regulators instead?
<color=#0088ff>I have brought you some Thermal Regulators</color>

My thanks to you, traveller.\nPlease take this token of my gratitude to repay you for the kindness you've shown me. It's only {MoneyCounter} Credits and my clan will be just as grateful.\nTake some of my products as a gift! Spiked Mushrooms can be consumed to treat serious injuries.

It is of little concern, traveller. If you would hear of my plight, then gladly will I share with you the problem that I face, aside from the wild temperatures.@p8 I grow my mushrooms in a crevasse outside the village that is well shadowed and damp, where my mushrooms will grow easily. The downside to this is that the wooden logs on which I grow the spores rots quickly, but I am forbidden from entering the forest to collect new logs.@p9 It is the duty of the woodcutters and hunters to enter the forests, not mine. The wood they give to me is not suitable. Twigs and sticks and no thick logs. I ask of you if you would be willing to bring me 25 Wood Logs in their stead away from Clan Territory?
<color=#0088ff>I've brought you some nice, thick wooden logs for you.</color>

I would like to avoid imposing on you further, traveller.@w4 It seems as though nothing I do is improving my current crop. Fresh logs, warmer temperatures, even using nutrient solution does nothing.@p7 I need the industrial fertilizer used in commercial farms that the Polaris and the Trade Federation operate on other planets, but we are forbidden by our Zirax overseers from conducting interstellar trade, even through Polaris proxies.@p9 You are not so restricted as my people. If you can bring me 5 Fertilizer from one of the Polaris' offworld factories, you could do much to help. If even that fails, then at least I can say that i've tried everything. What say you? One last job?
I'll see what I can do

Praise be to the spirits, my friend! You have done so much for me, and it's only fair that I return the favor. So here is the few {MoneyCounter} Credits I can offer you my chief is just as pleased with your generosity.@p9 We have together brought together a suitable reward that you will surely use well, since it is of less use to us. Take with you the products of my people, our art, our trade and our produce. Know that you have done more for me than any other.

<color=#aaff00>My mushrooms are growing healthy and strong again.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>Your generous gifts were much appreciated and as I did not use all the fertilizer, I shared it among my clan's farmers to spread on the fields.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>We will have a bountiful harvest next season, and it is thanks to you.</color>

<color=#aaff00>Hail, traveller.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>Welcome to my Tannery. I am devoted entirely to the production of leather.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>I am fortunate that it is one role in which our products are in high demand, even on planets we are forbidden to visit.</color>
<color=#0088ff>That's quite a smell you have here</color>

I give you my thanks for your gift, traveller.\nPlease take these {MoneyCounter} Credits to cover the costs. I was planning on buying some from the Polaris' Trade Station on my next visit there, though they always overcharge me, so this is preferrable.\nPlease take some of my products as a gift! At least I know they will be put to good use.

Indeed it is. Which is why I my Tannery is where it is, away from the others. I still receive regular complaints about the smell when the wind changes and I would certainly prefer an alternative method of tanning.@p9 Perhaps you would be willing to help me out by bringing me 15 Bottles of your Nutrient Solution? It should be able to achieve a similar effect without any of the odiferous side-effects.

Yes, the solution you provided has done much to alleviate the stench, but it has taken a toll on the tanning process; Producing lower quality leather. This could be improved with an infusion of salt.@p8 I ask of you if you would be willing to bring me 150 Salt? You can obtain it from digging up the sand and rock surrounding and under oceans and lakes. It appears as a fine crystalline powder.
I'll see what I can do

It's possible to improve my leather yield significantly if I could get some industrial chemicals from Polaris. But they're not willing to risk their profits with the zirax to accomodate our people. Such chemicals could be used to produce weapons.@p9 Since you are not of Polaris and no friend of the zirax, perhaps you can aid me where they will not by bringing me 5 Bottles of Chemicals from one of the Polaris' offworld factories. It would do much to improve my production.
I'll see what I can do

Praise be to the spirits, my friend! You have done so much for me, and it's only fair that I return the favor. So here is the few {MoneyCounter} Credits I can offer you my chief is just as pleased with your generosity.@p9 We have together brought together a suitable reward that you will surely use well, since it is of less use to us. I have received gifts from the other villagers for purging the stench, but these rightfully belong to you. Take them and go in peace, my friend.

<color=#aaff00>Indeed it is.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>I am producing more leather than before, at a higher quality and without the smells.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>It is thanks to you that the village now has more money to spare for the Polaris traders.</color>

Welcome to Vitalife Pharmaceuticals. The leading producer of medical ingredients and pharmaceuticals.\nI'm one of the researchers at this labs, probably the lead researcher. We... don't really deal with customers here. I am authorized to provide samples to drug reps, and negotiate supply contracts though.\nSo I guess I can help you.

Welcome to Vitalife Pharmaceuticals. The leading producer of medical ingredients and pharmaceuticals. I'm one of the researchers at this labs, probably the lead researcher. We... don't really deal with customers here. I am authorized to provide samples to drug reps, and negotiate supply contracts though.@p9 I'm currently juggling a half dozen issues so I don't have time for it. Refrigeration went down on half our supply cabinets so many of our supplies are ruined. Now i've got requests from Labs 2 and 3 for materials that we don't have!

<color=#ffffff>Your help is welcome, though some of the materials we bring in are quite exotic. I'm not sure if you can even bring in many of the parts on my list.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>If you're willing to try, that's fine by me.</color>

These all appear to be in order... You've brought all the materials I requested and faster than our regular suppliers. Here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits and i'll forward a request for {RepCounter} Reputation for your account with Polaris.@p9 I'm impressed enough with your performance that i've decided to include a sample of our products in your payment. Please be careful with what you do with them. They can be quite a problem in the wrong hands.

Your assistance in this matter is appreciated. Either way, you've accepted the task on your own recognizance. It won't affect the labs negatively either way, so do your best.@p9 I have a list of materials to replace here, and the one currently at the top of the list is: x4 Science Equipment It wasn't just refrigeration that cut out, a number of sensitive devices seized up and we've got a repair crew investigating the cause. You'll want to check with our supplier, Chromium-Sierra Sciences.

Your assistance in this matter is appreciated. Either way, you've accepted the task on your own recognizance. It won't affect the labs negatively either way, so do your best.@p9 I have a list of materials to replace here, and the one currently at the top of the list is: x60 Bottles of Xenon Gas A rare gas, primarily used in anesthetics and a variety of medical processes undertaken here. You'll not find it on trade stations, most likely at a gas harvester as a byproduct.

Your assistance in this matter is appreciated. Either way, you've accepted the task on your own recognizance. It won't affect the labs negatively either way, so do your best.@p9 I have a list of materials to replace here, and the one currently at the top of the list is: x750 Sulfur It's used in sulfide and sulfate-based medications and treatments. You can find a factory or supplier; but it's probably more cost-effective to mine it yourself on any Lava planet.

I've got all the lazy bums I need around here. You wanna work? You can hop in your ship and go find me: A new Fusion Reactor Core. I'll pay you double market price since our current one has been running dirty for the last month and no one wants to deliver one out here.@p9 Non-Linear Productions and Solaris-AMP makes 'em and they're perfect for a gas miner since we've got a limitless source of Hydrogen and Helium to run 'em on.

Your assistance in this matter is appreciated. Either way, you've accepted the task on your own recognizance. It won't affect the labs negatively either way, so do your best.@p9 I have a list of materials to replace here, and the one currently at the top of the list is: x10 Brafus Fungi They have tremendous recovery properties. Unfortunately, they cannot be grown in a lab and have to be imported through the Tal'on.
<color=#0088ff>I managed to track down some Brafus Fungi</color>

<color=#ffffff>You've managed to replace all of our missing stocks.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thank you for your assistance in such an important matter. We're all truly grateful here, I just wish we could show it properly.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>We're heavily scrutinized by Polaris here, so we have to act professional at all times.</color>

Civvy on deck! You lot! Watch your load so you don't turn our guest here into street pizza!@p4 And you, this is a work site. If ya don't want to get crushed under a couple of tonnes of ore, don't just walk on across the concourse without a care in the world, Aye? Now what do ya want?

This here's a Hematite mine. That's a kind of iron ore, got a little bit of Cobalt mixed in with this lot.\nWe're supplying iron to a half-dozen companies so we kin' always use help. I have a massive list of things I need help with, so be careful about volunteering help.\nI can't put in a good word with any of my buyers, but I will pay fer ya services.
Thanks be ta' ye, kid.\nYou've really helped me out here, an here's yer payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits.\nI'll even give ye a small shipment of ore fer ya trouble.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. What we need here right now is replacements fer our current mining equipment. They're fine fer now, but we don't got no replacements. x1 Mining Equipment Should be all we need fer now. P3 and NLP factories make 'em so should sell 'em too.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. What we need here right now is replacements fer our current mining equipment. They're fine fer now, but we don't got no replacements. x2 Mining Equipment Should be all we need fer now. P3 and NLP factories make 'em so should sell 'em too.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. Motor's burned out on our back-up drill and some of the conveyors and we need replacements. x65 Motors Should be all we need to get it all back up 'n running.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. What we need here right now is a new Subspace Transmitter. The last one got knocked down by one of the loading hovers. x10 Communication Equipment Only place ya can get 'em is Arriake Technology. It's an Electronics factory under Polaris.

Good ta hear! We're pretty good fer now, but the boys've been workin' for two days and need a break an' a lil' reward. You go bring us... x100 Bottles of Liquor Can buy the stuff all over. Try either Totally OP's Brewery or one o' the Tal'on breweries.

We've got patch jobs all over the place 'n we need new parts else we'll need a complete replacement soon. Think you can get me: x1500 Mechanical Components and x100 Steel Plates? Easy to make, but we don't have a dedicated Constructor here to do it ourselves.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. We've got two conveyor belts down and another half-dozen held together with duct tape. We can't do any more patch jobs. We need... x6 Spare Parts That'll be enough to fix the ones we've got for a while at least. Can get the parts from P3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories.

We've got problems comin' out our ears, but one of the major ones we got is that, well... look around. We're out in the open here and it gets mighty cold at night. What we be needin' is...\nx3 Prefab Housing Units\nWe can set 'em up nearby for the boys to take breaks in. Can only buy 'em from P3 Factories since there ain't much money in helpin' us poor folks.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. Our drills are using water for coolant, but it's not drawing enough heat away so we need to shut down every couple of ours to cool off. x15 Heat Exchangers Should do the trick, so's we don't need to cool down as often. Zero Horizons' and Thermal Interactions' factories make 'em so should sell 'em too.

Our old capacitors are pretty old and they've been losin' their charge faster 'n faster each time we charge 'em. We need replacements and the regulators to keep 'em in line. Think ya can get me: x12 Advanced Capacitors and x12 Energy Regulators? We can't have 'em shipped in ourselves since it's a pretty small order and they'll charge us a premium for it.

As you've been warned, this is a work site and we get a lot of injuries 'round here so if you can top up our First Aid kit with: x20 Bandages x3 Trauma Kits and x10 Adrenaline Shots We'll be a mite grateful.
I've topped up your first aid kit

A'ight, the boys here are sick of eatin' canned beans and meat, we want some real stuff but none of us are any good at cookin'. You bring us some good grub like: x7 Cheeseburgers x5 Pizza x3 Cakes And we'll be much better off. We'll even pay you double their value, 'cause we're sick of canned food.

Work's on hold while we rig up a temporary generator. If you can be gettin' us a replacement, it should solve all our problems. Just need: x1 Small Advanced Generator and x30 Electronics And we can get back to work without needin' to risk scorched buttcracks an' burnt eyebrows.
I've got a replacement generator and cables for you

We've hit a dense plate of Granite an' we can't get the drill through it before it overheats. We need to try blastin' the rocks out: x20 Explosive Charges and x40 Optical Fiber Should do. We'll lower the explosive bundle down and use a line o' optical fiber for remote detonation.

The local wildlife have been a problem lately. Think you can get us a few guns for the boys to take care of them? x3 Heavy Sniper Rifles and x200 7.62mm Rifle Rounds Will do, an' it'll keep the boys busy while they're off-duty and hopefully put a little fresh meat on the table.

Hey you! Watch where yer walkin' or else you're gonna get squashed!@p4 Now what's a flyboy like you doin' down here in the dirt? Not here for a shipment, an' not one of our client's agents, not with them guns. So what do you need with our lil' copper mine, huh?

You're standing next to a Copper Mine. We mine Chalcocite here. It's a mix of Copper an' Sulfur. There's some Enargite in there too, which is toxic to all hell so we've always got protesters complaining about arsenic in the runoff.\nI can't put in a good word with any of my buyers, but I will pay fer ya services.
Thanks be ta' ye, kid.\nYou've really helped me out here, an here's yer payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits.\nI'll even give ye a small shipment of ore fer ya trouble.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. What we need here right now is replacements fer our current mining equipment. They're fine fer now, but we don't got no replacements. x1 Mining Equipment Should be all we need fer now. P3 and NLP factories make 'em so should sell 'em too.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. What we need here right now is replacements fer our current mining equipment. They're fine fer now, but we don't got no replacements. x2 Mining Equipment Should be all we need fer now. P3 and NLP factories make 'em so should sell 'em too.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. We've been using solars as a backup fer years, but this latest vein has been throwing out finer dust that's been damaging our panels. x30 Solar Cells Is what we need to fix the panels, but the only place ya can get 'em is Solaris-AMP. It's an Electronics factory under Polaris.

Good ta hear! We're pretty good fer now, but the boys've been workin' for two days and need a break an' a lil' reward. You go bring us... x100 Bottles of Liquor Can buy the stuff all over. Try either Totally OP's Brewery or one o' the Tal'on breweries.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. We've got two conveyor belts down and another half-dozen held together with duct tape. We can't do any more patch jobs. We need... x6 Spare Parts That'll be enough to fix the ones we've got for a while at least. Can get the parts from P3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories.

We've got problems comin' out our ears, but one of the major ones we've got right now is that, the drills are kicking up a lot of dust. We've got extractors running constantly but the filters are getting clogged...\nx72 Air Filters\nIs all we need to be set for another month or two. Can buy 'em from Chromium-Sierra, Vitalife and Chemmix Factories. They're the bunch dealing in chemical treatments.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. Our drills are using water for coolant, but it's not drawing enough heat away so we need to shut down every couple of ours to cool off. x10 Coolant Should do the trick, so's we don't need to shut down as often. Hydroflux and Thermal Interactions' factories make the stuff.

We've got patch jobs all over the place 'n things've gone past the point of no return, so we need complete replacements for the drillheads and motors:\nx8 Mechanical Drill Modules (HV)\nShould do it. We'd make 'em ourselves, but our constructor can't make big stuff like that.

We've got a problem with the bore holes we're diggin' constantly filling with water an' dust and it's ruining the drills. We need that slurry pumped out now. x2 Water Extractors and x50 Plastic Pipes should be able to pull out all the water an' slurry and free up the drillheads.

Yer gonna be regretting yer choice to offer me this help. Motor's burned out on our back-up drill and some of the conveyors and we need replacements. x65 Motors Should be all we need to get it all back up 'n running.

As you've been warned, this is a work site and we get a lot of injuries 'round here so if you can top up our First Aid kit with: x20 Bandages x3 Detox Kits and x30 Antibiotic Ointment We'll be a mite grateful.
I've topped up your first aid kit

A'ight, the boys here are sick of eatin' canned beans and meat, we want some real stuff but none of us are any good at cookin'. You bring us some good grub like: x7 Waffles x5 Dino-Stew x3 Fruit Pies And we'll be much better off. We'll even pay you double their value, 'cause we're sick of canned food.

We've been patching the electrics on our rig for years, and it's finally died on us, so we're on hold while we're trying to rewire the rig but we'd be better with: x15 Computers and x100 Advanced Electronics And we can get back to work without needin' to risk scorched buttcracks an' burnt eyebrows.

We've hit a dense plate of Granite an' we can't get the drill through it before it overheats. We need to try blastin' the rocks out: x20 Explosive Charges and x40 Optical Fiber Should do. We'll lower the explosive bundle down and use a line o' optical fiber for remote detonation.

We get protesters around complaining about arsenic in the groundwater. They've smashed some of our equipment when they think they can. If the boys were armed, they'd think twice. x6 Advanced Submachine Guns and x1000 Pistol Rounds Them SMGs are good. Nice n' small an' won't get in their way while they work.

Watch your step, kid. The ground may look stable, but we're digging right beneath your feet.\nWhat we're digging out of the ground here is Quartz. We ship it off to be ground down into silicon powder and processed into industrial silicon boules.

Aye. We always need help here. You don't look like you'd be much use in the mine, so if you're serious about offering help. I'll put you on requisitions. You'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books. Is that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Our current problem is that we need replacement equipment for our larger drills. They're not the ones you use on a ship, so they need specialized parts. x1 Mining Equipment Is all we need at the moment. You can get them from P3 and NLP factories run by Polaris.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Our current problem is that we need replacement equipment for our larger drills. They're not the ones you use on a ship, so they need specialized parts. x2 Mining Equipment Is all we need at the moment. You can get them from P3 and NLP factories run by Polaris.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Our current problem is that we need replacement equipment for our larger drills. They're not the ones you use on a ship, so they need specialied parts. x3 Mining Equipment Is all we need at the moment. You can get them from P3 and NLP factories run by Polaris.

We have drinks here every friday, but the guy in charge of restocking the fridges fell into a borehole and broke his leg. He wasn't in much shape to remember to file an order so...@p9 I'll need you to restock the fridges with x300 Bottles of Beer Try Totally Overpowered for a good supply of beer. I'd recommend one of their breweries, not one of their stores. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since we need it before Friday.
I've finished your order and brought the beer

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Our loading equipment is welded into their frames and so we can't replace them, we have to replace the parts inside which is more expensive.@p9 As you can guess, the motors have finally ground down the drive train from being overburdened, so we need: x8 Spare Parts To replace the parts the drive train. You can get the parts from Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories.

You're in charge of sourcing replacement filters for the work crew's helmets. Cutting quartz throws up some really fine dust that causes all sorts of hell if it gets in your lungs. We've already had to send one of the boys to Ok'y for Silicosis from working with a clogged filter...@p9 So as you can guess, this is an important job. We need x100 Air Filters To cover both work crews for a couple of months. They're mostly made at Chromium-Sierra, Vitalife and Chemmix Factories. So they're fairly easy to get your hands on.

As you can see, we're at the edge of an open pit mine. It's a nice enough place to work, but there's not much cover. We need... \nx4 Prefab Housing Modules\nFor the boys to hang in when the weather packs in. The only place that produces them is P3 Factories which is always a problem.

A couple of the drills we've got on the lower tier have shorted their motors and now the flux coils have come unspooled. It's cheaper to just replace them than attempt to repair them:\nx40 Flux Coils\nIs all we need. Technically, we only need 30, but it's always good to have spares for next time it happens.

Okay, so quartz is susceptible to changes in temperature that causes it to crack. We don't use laser drills and beam cutters for that very reason. The problem is there's impurities of iron in the deposit we're working now and it's building up heat and is risking a collapse.@p9 What I need from you is to get: x25 Heat Exchangers From Zero Horizons or Thermal Interactions' factories so we can draw the heat out and prevent cracking around the drill site that could bring the entire wall down.

This is a pit mine, so falling is a real hazard. Unfortunately, we have wildlife that does fall in and we need an easy way to get it out. Most of the creatures that are likely to fall in can climb a ladder, so we'll set some of them up at each level.\nx100 Ladders\nShould be all we need to keep things from getting stuck in the bottom. The boys can use them too, so it's a win for everyone.

We've always got injuries around here, but our medical supplies are fairly well-stocked. The one thing we don't have enough of are painkillers. They're especially needed when someone gets a lungful of dust. That stuff burns like acid.@p9 You bring me: x20 Narcotics And i'll pay double. I don't care where you get them from, get them from a medical supplier or the black market, just as long as it spares my boys of going without.

There's a birthday coming up next week and we can't get any of the supplies in under the radar without him figuring out we're holding a surprise party. That's where you come in:@p9 x15 Veggie Burgers x10 Curry x5 Fruit Pies x2 Cakes Are what's on the list. You bring them to me without anyone seeing and i'll pay you double their market price. And NO meat. The guy's a vegetarian, and I don't want him getting sick.
I've got what you asked for. Don't worry, nobody saw me.

We've been adding more and more hardware to the site for faster automation, but it seems our old computer system has finally given up the ghost. There's not much we can do without: x1 Large Optronic Bridge and x30 Advanced Electronics To get the damned machine back up and running besides removing vital equipment from the grid.

We're looking at detonating charges at a lower depth to open up fissures from which we can start to work on a lower level of the mine. x20 Explosive Charges and x40 Optical Fiber Would help us with getting started on that, if you'd find us the supplies for the job.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Our current problem is that we need replacement equipment for our larger drills. They're not the ones you use on a ship, so they need specialized parts. x4 Mining Equipment Is all we need at the moment. You can get them from P3 and NLP factories run by Polaris.

You there! Check your suit seals! I don't want any visitors here getting killed on my watch.\nYou see that rock being loaded over there? That's Cobaltite. Nasty stuff, full of arsenic. You don't want it on you or in your suit's filters.\nIt's valuable though. So what brings you here?

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts, so I may have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've got a problem with the extractor feed getting jammed every 15 minutes. We've taken the entire assembly apart looking for the problem but can't seem to find it.@p9 We need a completely new assembly, which means we need: x3 Mining Equipment x20 Motors x400 Mechanical Components To overhaul the old extraction system. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've replaced the feed system twice, but it looks like the problem we've actually been getting is from a mixed signal from the computer system that's been grinding off the gears on the extractor when it should be idling. Now we're down an extractor and need to replace the computers that run it.@p9 That means we need another assembly replacement of: x5 Mining Equipment x10 Computers x20 Advanced Electronics To replace and rewire the feed system and rig up a new control computer. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've got this problem, but every time we think we've fixed it, it moves to another part of the rig and breaks something. I'm at the point of suspecting sabotage by some malicious AI. This time, the capacitors that run the packager blew when a transformer shorted.@p9 We've got the boys unloading the conveyors manually, but they can't keep that up for long, so we need: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Energy Regulators To get things back up and running normally. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We have drinks here every friday night, but the last supply ship left it out of our order, so we've used up our reserves last week and have nothing for this friday...@p9 I'll need you to restock the fridges with x300 Bottles of Liquor Try either Totally Overpowered's Brewery or one of the Tal'on Breweries if you can find one. I'd recommend one of TOP's breweries, not one of their stores. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since we need it before Friday.
I've finished your order and brought the beer

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've been losing charge from our main generators steadily over the last few months and now the charge is too low to even run the equipment for longer than an hour at a time.@p9 We can't shorten the distance between the two points, so we need to increase the efficiency with: x8 Spare Parts x25 Superconductors The problem with getting both of those is that Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories make one and Arriake Technology and Solaris-AMP make the other.

As i've probably explained to you, this ore we're mining here is toxic as hell due to the high arsenic content in it. We're in full hazmat gear the entire time we're near the drills, and those suits get HOT. We've already had 3 guys come down with heatstroke and there's nothing we can do until we pull them away and pry them out of the suits.@p9 We need temperature regulators inside our suits, but the best we can do requires: x20 Heat Exchangers x10 Coolant To cover both work crews for a couple of months. I know you can get Heat Exchangers at Thermal Interactions Ltd and Zero Horizons Manufacturing. They might have coolant too, or you can try a chemical plant.

We don't handle the ore directly, instead we have it loaded by robotic arms that sorts the cobalt from the rock the drills pull up. We've recently hit a snag since a radiation storm last week has caused the arms to seize up at random times.@p9 We're looking at getting replacements, but the only place that handles: x5 Robotics of the right size and quality is Hostile Apparatus' Main Factories which don't ship their products out here. If you can get them, i'll pay 75% over market price.

We've cracked another set of lenses in the laser drill. This is the third this week and we're on our last lens. The eggheads have narrowed it down to a spike in thermal temperatures, which should be fixable with: x10 Heat Exchangers x10 Laser Upgrade Kits I know InterWeap sells laser kits and Thermal Interactions sells Heat Exchangers. But there are probably cheaper ways to get both... I'll pay 75% above market price for both.
I've brought the new lenses and heatsinks

We're testing a new extraction method using an autominer, but none of us on the platform are authorized by Polaris to purchase a whole autominer and we don't have a constructor capable of assembling one even if we got all the parts.@p9 I need you to go around Polaris' chokehold and get me: x1 Basic Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

We use laser drills to extract the cobaltite from the ground, but there's a great deal of dust being kicked up from the process and it gets everywhere, including into the drills where it corrodes the power coils, meaning we need to replace them at least once a month.@p9 We're at that time of the month again when we need to replace the corroded coils with fresh ones. x20 Power Coils will cover replacements on all our drills, with a couple of spares if something else goes wrong with them. Think you can handle it?

We've always got injuries around here, but our medical supplies are fairly well-stocked. The one thing we don't have enough of are Antitoxic Injections. They're the best thing we've got when someone inhales a lungful of cobalt dust.@p9 You bring me: x80 Antitoxic Injections And i'll pay double their market price, since they're the only treatment we've got on hand to deal with acute arsenic poisoning.

We've been eating ration packs for the last week since we're pretty sure the food stores we had have been contaminated and we're pretty desperate for something much better at this point. We can't make it ourselves, and i'm pretty sure it's too complicated for a Food Processor.@p9 What we need is x10 Ziraxian Salad x10 Strawberry Milkshakes That's a proper salad, not just that wet green paper smothered in ranch dressing you terran eat. We're all chipping in to pay you more than they cost because we can't stand ration packs for one more night.

We're considering bringing a new drill online on the west edge of the digsite. We've got most of the parts to assemble a drill already, we're only missing a few components that i'd like you to go get for me: x3 Power Coils x50 Zascosium Alloy x1 Advanced Upgrade Kit and x24 Advanced Electronics And we'll be able to get started next week.

We've had serious problems with the drills when we've shut down at the end of the week. It gets very cold out here at night and a weekend in extremely cold temperatures causes stress fractures on some of the equipment when it's started up. We need a better way to keep the cold out and the heat in.@p9 It's for that reason that we've come up with the idea of adding insulation by gluing: x120 Aluminium Foil using x6 Bottles of Chemicals To the titanium shell of the drills to keep the sudden temperature drops from impacting the shock absorbers on the legs. We can't just order those things in, so it'll be up to you to track them down.
I've got the components for your... 'insulation' right here

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We're short on general supplies. Not very important, but we still need them to conduct basic repairs or alterations to equipment when we decide to move it further than the current infrastructure allows.@p9 I've got a list of parts I need from you: x175 Neodymium Ingots x65 Motors x140 Titanium Plates Not so hard, but very important to us if you can manage it.

Whoa there! Careful with that jetpack. We have exposed Magnesium here and if you get a spark on the wrong spot... 'boom'.\nAlways a problem with Magnesite mining, especially when the mineral is seamed with pure metal.\nNow that you've been warned. What are you looking for here?

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts, so I may have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've got a problem with the extractor feed getting jammed every 15 minutes. We've taken the entire assembly apart looking for the problem but can't seem to find it.@p9 We need a completely new assembly, which means we need: x3 Mining Equipment x20 Motors x400 Mechanical Components To overhaul the old extraction system. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

Now we're down an extractor and need to replace the computers that run it.@p9 That means we need another assembly replacement of: x5 Mining Equipment x10 Computers x20 Advanced Electronics To replace and rewire the feed system and rig up a new control computer. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've got this problem, but every time we think we've fixed it, it moves to another part of the rig and breaks something. I'm at the point of suspecting sabotage by some malicious AI. This time, the capacitors that run the packager blew when a transformer shorted.@p9 We've got the boys unloading the conveyors manually, but they can't keep that up for long, so we need: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Energy Regulators To get things back up and running normally. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We have drinks here every friday night, but the last supply ship left it out of our order, so we've used up our reserves last week and have nothing for this friday...@p9 I'll need you to restock the fridges with x300 Bottles of Liquor Try either Totally Overpowered's Brewery or one of the Tal'on Breweries if you can find one. I'd recommend one of TOP's breweries, not one of their stores. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since we need it before Friday.
I've finished your order and brought the beer

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've been losing charge from our main generators steadily over the last few months and now the charge is too low to even run the equipment for longer than an hour at a time.@p9 We can't shorten the distance between the two points, so we need to increase the efficiency with: x8 Spare Parts x25 Superconductors The problem with getting both of those is that Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories make one and Arriake Technology and Solaris-AMP make the other.

We've got to be careful about managing our temperatures here, since if the drills get too hot we risk igniting an exposed seam of Magnesium. I shouldn't need to warn you how disastrous that would be. You'd be looking at a blinding inferno that we can't put out. We'd have to relocate the entire site.@p9 The problem is that the best measure we can take is judicious use of Heat Exchangers to keep the heat away from the drill site: x120 Heat Exchangers are required for a full draw that pulls a good 95% of the heat away from the impact point. You can get them from Thermal Interactions Ltd and Zero Horizons Manufacturing.

We can't rely on a generator this close to an open seam of magnesium, especially since the ones we'd need to run all the equipment have are hot enough to ignite. We've been making do with Solar Panels, but they're not strong enough.@p9 We're looking at getting upgrades, but the only place that can make the: x35 Solar Cells we'd need is Solaris-AMP Manufacturing which don't ship their products out here. If you can get them, i'll pay 75% over market price.

We're having problems with both heat and sparks. It seems there are some iron impurities inside the magnesite around a seam of pure magnesium metal. We don't want to risk igniting the raw magnesium, so I want to try sheathing the drill heads in Zascosium to see if that keeps the sparks to a minimum.@p9 We can draw away any heat build-up using disposable Heat Sinks: x50 Heat Exchangers x200 Zascosium Ingots You should be able to mine one and build the other, so since you're taking on all the work for this I'll pay 75% above market price for both.
I've brought the new thermal sheathing materials

We're testing a new extraction method using an autominer, but none of us on the platform are authorized by Polaris to purchase a whole autominer and we don't have a constructor capable of assembling one even if we got all the parts.@p9 I need you to go around Polaris' chokehold and get me: x1 Basic Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

Magnesite is safe enough to mine, but the deposits we're mining have seams of pure Magnesium and an electrical arc is hot enough to ignite it. We have to take safety seriously here and reduce the amount of exposed ferrous materials and surfaces where we can.@p9 We'll need: x250 Titanium Plates x50 Platinum Plates To resurface many of the replacement parts we've already brought in. Especially the parts that come in contact with possible heat sources.

Our containers that we hold and ship the magnesium in needs extra insulation against heat and pressure in the event of an accident. The manufacturers won't include the extra processing that we need for transporting the shipments of pure magnesium and we don't have the technology on hand to refine it from thin shards into plates and ingots.@p9 As such, we need to sheath the containers in Graphite ourselves if we don't want to risk a shoddy freighter igniting on re-entry. That means we need constant shipments of Graphite. x500 Graphite Will do for a while and i'll even pay double market price. The boys'll will handle the fitting.
I've got a shipment of Graphite for you

We're running on a steady diet of ration packs and cold coffee like every other drilling rig out here. We need a fresh supply of coffee that wasn't made from a 50-year old food processor and something that goes with it.@p9 x500 Coffee x500 Pumpkin Cookies I know coffee comes in all kinds and they change whatever's available seasonally. I don't care if it's a Pumpkin-Spice Latte, anything's better than the hot bean water we get now. I'll even pay double if it's hot.

We're considering bringing a new drill online on the west edge of the digsite. We've got most of the parts to assemble a drill already, we're only missing a few components that i'd like you to go get for me: x3 Power Coils x50 Zascosium Alloy x1 Advanced Upgrade Kit and x24 Advanced Electronics And we'll be able to get started next week.

We've run low on the Helium used to pressurize the pure metal storage containers. It reduces the chance of accidental ignition from solar storms generating electrical arcs inside the silos.@p9 We don't need a lot of Helium, just: x65 Bottles of Helium You should be able to get them from a Gas Refinery or Harvester.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We're short on general supplies. Not very important, but we still need them to conduct basic repairs or alterations to equipment when we decide to move it further than the current infrastructure allows.@p9 I've got a list of parts I need from you: x175 Neodymium Ingots x65 Motors x140 Titanium Plates Not so hard, but very important to us if you can manage it.

We've got this problem, but every time we think we've fixed it, it moves to another part of the rig and breaks something. I'm at the point of suspecting sabotage by some malicious AI. This time, the capacitors that run the packager blew when a transformer shorted.@p9 We've got the boys unloading the conveyors manually, but they can't keep that up for long, so we need: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Energy Regulators To get things back up and running normally. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We have drinks here every friday night, but the last supply ship left it out of our order, so we've used up our reserves last week and have nothing for this friday...@p9 I'll need you to restock the fridges with x300 Bottles of Liquor Try either Totally Overpowered's Brewery or one of the Tal'on Breweries if you can find one. I'd recommend one of TOP's breweries, not one of their stores. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since we need it before Friday.
I've finished your order and brought the beer

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've been losing charge from our main generators steadily over the last few months and now the charge is too low to even run the equipment for longer than an hour at a time.@p9 We can't shorten the distance between the two points, so we need to increase the efficiency with: x8 Spare Parts x25 Superconductors The problem with getting both of those is that Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories make one and Arriake Technology and Solaris-AMP make the other.

We've been forced to switch from Laser Drills to mechanical ones since this deposit of Rutile is just too refractive. We kept damaging supports and getting nowhere on pulling out the deposit. Now our problems involve overheating from Kimberlite inclusions jamming the drill.@p9 We can solve the problem with: x15 Coolant x2 Handheld Laser Drills So the boys can manually get in there and free the kimberlite from the drill and the coolant to keep it from burning out the motors.

We need to replace the Density Scanner's lens after our initial attempts at mining this deposit with a laser drill bounced back and fried the scanner's head and let me tell you, those damned things are expensive. There's no chance in hell of repairing it, so we need a new one.@p9 Shouldn't be too difficult to find a supplier, since I believe Arriake Technology sells them from their factory. We only need: x3 Optronics If you can get them, i'll pay 75% over market price.

We lost our Subspace Transmitter last week when one of our freighters got caught in a crosswind and smashed the antenna into the mine. We need the parts to repair the stand and replace the transmitter itself. Not the daunting task it seems...@p9 What we need you to bring us here is: x10 Communication Equipment x10 Computers x30 Advanced Electronics x450 Optical Fiber You can get the Com Equipment from Arriake Technology. It's an Electronics factory under Polaris. The rest you'll have to source yourself.
I've got the parts for the transmitter

We're testing a new extraction method using an autominer, but none of us on the platform are authorized by Polaris to purchase a whole autominer and we don't have a constructor capable of assembling one even if we got all the parts.@p9 I need you to go around Polaris' chokehold and get me: x1 Basic Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

I have a small job for you. We have enough fuel to last us a week or so once solar's no longer an option. Soon the planet and moon will be changing their orientation that'll reduce solar efficiency and force us to rely solely on the generators.@p9 Naturally, we need to top up our fuel supplies so I need you to fill our reserve tanks with: x50 Promethium Hydrocells You should be able to make them yourself, we don't mine promethium so we can't do it ourselves.

We've always got injuries around here, but our medical supplies are fairly well-stocked. The one thing we don't have enough of are painkillers. We don't need them often. Titanium is a nice safe ore to mine, so they're only for the serious injuries.@p9 I don't need many, only... x25 Narcotics I'll even pay double, since we need licensing to carry high-strength painkillers like that. It's especially hard when we have to list that our workplace only mines Rutile. It's not toxic and lightweight, so we're often ignored.

We're running on a steady diet of ration packs and cold coffee like every other drilling rig out here. What the boys want right now is some REAL food.@p9 x250 Spare Ribs x125 Ziraxian Salad Some nice red meat and fresh vegetables will do the whole crew some good. I'll pay double if you can get it here fresh and hot.

We're considering bringing a new drill online on the west edge of the digsite. We've got most of the parts to assemble a drill already, we're only missing a few components that i'd like you to go get for me: x3 Power Coils x50 Zascosium Alloy x1 Advanced Upgrade Kit and x24 Advanced Electronics And we'll be able to get started next week.

Our conveyors have just collectively blown all their motors. We're pretty sure something unexpected fell into the back of the belt line and was dragged through each motor, destroying it in the process. We've switched out half the motors and are making do, but we need to fit the rest of them and restock our reserves.@p9 We simply weren't prepared for this to happen to all the motors on the conveyor system all at once and we weren't prepared. x160 Motors Is what we need to get the line back up and restock the reserves. We'll also need to invest in preventing the problem from happening again.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We're short on general supplies. Not very important, but we still need them to conduct basic repairs or alterations to equipment when we decide to move it further than the current infrastructure allows.@p9 I've got a list of parts I need from you: x350 Cobalt Alloy x60 Energy Regulators x20 Advanced Capacitors Not so hard, but very important to us if you can manage it.

Hey there, newbie! You here for a pick-up or a drop-off? I'm Avritaz, the foreman on this operation. If you don't know what me an' the boys do here, it's Bauxite.\nYep, Bauxite. That'll be made into Aluminium soon enough and used in everything from spacecrafts to toasters.

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I may have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've got a problem with the extractor feed getting jammed every 15 minutes. We've taken the entire assembly apart looking for the problem but can't seem to find it.@p9 We need a completely new assembly, which means we need: x3 Mining Equipment x20 Motors x400 Mechanical Components To overhaul the old extraction system. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've replaced the feed system twice, but it looks like the problem we've actually been getting is from a mixed signal from the computer system that's been grinding off the gears on the extractor when it should be idling. Now we're down an extractor and need to replace the computers that run it.@p9 That means we need another assembly replacement of: x5 Mining Equipment x10 Computers x20 Advanced Electronics To replace and rewire the feed system and rig up a new control computer. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've got this problem, but every time we think we've fixed it, it moves to another part of the rig and breaks something. I'm at the point of suspecting sabotage by some malicious AI. This time, the capacitors that run the packager blew when a transformer shorted.@p9 We've got the boys unloading the conveyors manually, but they can't keep that up for long, so we need: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Energy Regulators To get things back up and running normally. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We have drinks here every friday night, but the last supply ship left it out of our order, so we've used up our reserves last week and have nothing for this friday...@p9 I'll need you to restock the fridges with x300 Bottles of Liquor Try either Totally Overpowered's Brewery or one of the Tal'on Breweries if you can find one. I'd recommend one of TOP's breweries, not one of their stores. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since we need it before Friday.
I've finished your order and brought the beer

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Bauxite throws up a lot of dust, it's not too bad but we still go through filters quickly, so we need replacements on a regular basis.@p9 Our last shipment was waylaid, so we need you to go out and get: x8 Spare Parts x30 Filters The problem with getting both of those is that Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories make one and Chemmix, CSS and Vitalife make the other.

Solar output is higher this season, so we've been thinking about adding some new solar panels that can handle the power load of the new laser drills. Standard panels are supplimental devices, so we need some commercial grade cells to ensure we're not wasting our time.@p9 We can handle the refit with: x30 Solar Cells x60 Energy Regulators They don't ship out cells to places like this, we're too small an operation to bother with, so we need to go through a third-party.

We'll be setting up a fresh mine nearby soon, but the density scanner we used for the first mine has been left uncovered for months and naturally, it's taken some damage and need repairs.@p9 Shouldn't be too difficult to find a supplier, since I believe Arriake Technology sells what we need at their factory. We only need: x3 Optronics x12 Computers If you can get them, i'll pay 75% over market price.

One of our loaders collided with Generator-02's transformer while backing up yesterday and somehow caused it to burn out all the wiring on the packaging rig along with all the displays on every machine on the site. The crews are looking over processes manually now.@p9 What we need you to bring us here is: x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Computers x150 Tablets x300 Electronics You can get the Tablets from Chromium-Sierra Sciences or Hostile Apparatus Factories. I'm not sure one the rest of the parts, but we need them quickly before someone loses a hand.
I've got the parts for the transmitter

We're testing a new extraction method using an autominer, but none of us on the platform are authorized by Polaris to purchase a whole autominer and we don't have a constructor capable of assembling one even if we got all the parts.@p9 I need you to go around Polaris' chokehold and get me: x1 Basic Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

We've reached our annual maintenance cycle; which means we need need to replace most of the wiring and control systems on our rigs. We've seen what happens if we don't rewire in this kind of environment. We can't afford accidents here, so we make sure maintenance is performed on schedule.@p9 We examine and evaluate the old stuff from the last cycle and reuse the stuff that's in good condition to keep costs down. That still means we need at least: x185 Advanced Electronics x5 Computers For the parts we can't reuse. I'll leave those to you.

You there! Check your seals and stay behind the radiation shields at all times! I won't be responsible for anyone getting cooked today.\nTake a look around. You're look at the infrastructure that powers the entire galaxy. Promethium mining!

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I'll have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've got a problem with the extractor feed getting jammed every 15 minutes. We've taken the entire assembly apart looking for the problem but can't seem to find it.@p9 We need a completely new assembly, which means we need: x3 Mining Equipment x20 Motors x400 Mechanical Components To overhaul the old extraction system. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've replaced the feed system twice, but it looks like the problem we've actually been getting is from a mixed signal from the computer system that's been grinding off the gears on the extractor when it should be idling. Now we're down an extractor and need to replace the computers that run it.@p9 That means we need another assembly replacement of: x5 Mining Equipment x10 Computers x20 Advanced Electronics To replace and rewire the feed system and rig up a new control computer. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've got this problem, but every time we think we've fixed it, it moves to another part of the rig and breaks something. I'm at the point of suspecting sabotage by some malicious AI. This time, the capacitors that run the packager blew when a transformer shorted.@p9 We've got the boys unloading the conveyors manually, but they can't keep that up for long, so we need: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Energy Regulators To get things back up and running normally. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We have drinks here every friday night, but the last supply ship left it out of our order, so we've used up our reserves last week and have nothing for this friday...@p9 I'll need you to restock the fridges with x300 Bottles of Liquor Try either Totally Overpowered's Brewery or one of the Tal'on Breweries if you can find one. I'd recommend one of TOP's breweries, not one of their stores. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since we need it before Friday.
I've finished your order and brought the beer

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need.
