Promethium in it's raw form is radioactive and toxic, so you need to keep suit seals on at all times and radiation shielding on everything on the site.@p9 We've already expanded the dig another 30 meters west, so we need more radiation shielding: x4 Spare Parts x10 Radiation Shielding The problem with getting both of those is that Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories make one and Thermal Interactions and NLP make the other.

With all the promethium we need available, we can run our generators at a higher output than usual. But in order to maintain the conversion rate of fuel to energy we need regular infusions of Hydrogen to purge impurities from the reaction chambers. We don't need to do it often, so once a week we shut down to clean the feed lines.@p9 I need you to head on out to a factory like Chemmix Industrial for the chemicals and hydrogen: x20 Bottles of Chemicals x15 Bottles of Hydrogen I'd normally send someone else, but our ships are out doing a delivery.

We need a fresh supply of Graphite to sheath the storage containers in or else we risk irradiating the containers without anyone noticing. The problem is that we need people to go into the containers to do it and there's enough residue to cause serious organ damage.@p9 To meet health and safety standards, I need: x3 Radiation Boosters x500 Graphite So a crew can get in there without being in any danger and spray on a graphite mixture to block out stray gamma radiation from the cargo. That's up to you.
I've brought you the shielding and boosters

Our generators run at higher yield than usual, which means an excess of heat. We want to avoid shutting them down every day, which means a surplus of Heat Exchangers to divert the heat into radiators.@p9 That shouldn't be too hard for you to do. We only need the heat exchangers and a surfacing material for the radiator fins. x40 Heat Exchangers x500 Copper Ingots Should do it. Copper's conductive enough and the heat exchangers can be bought from either Zero Horizons or Thermal Interactions' factories.
I've got the parts for your generator

As you can see, we deal with a toxic and highly radioactive material here. It's nowhere near as bad as dealing with Pentaxid, but we've got our fair share of problems. Not a week goes by without someone getting a Radiation Burn, so we're always in need of anti-rad meds.@p9 See if you can top up our first aid kit with: x50 Anti-Radiation Pills x50 Radiation Immunity Shots Buy it or make it yourself. It doesn't matter to me, but we need to top up all supplies before next week. I'll pay double, since I hate forking over money to Ok'y Medical.

I don't want to have to ask you to do this, but the boys have been nagging my ears off about the living conditions here. What they're after are some Posters to hang up around the place. Stupid, I know. But they won't give up.@p9 They don't want just any posters, they've given me a list: Biker Poster Poster Trader New World Poster Boyband Poster I'll pay FIVE times their value if you can get them. Anything to stop their complaining! Most of them can be bought on from luxury goods shops.

Welcome to Pentaxium Unlimited's mining operations!\nI'm sure you'd love to take a look around, but please stay the hell out of our operation. You have just walked onto the most dangerous place on this entire planet and if you're not careful, you'll die.\nGot it?

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I'll have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. We've got a problem with the extractor feed getting jammed every 15 minutes. We've taken the entire assembly apart looking for the problem but can't seem to find it.@p9 We need a completely new assembly, which means we need: x3 Mining Equipment x20 Motors x400 Mechanical Components To overhaul the old extraction system. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've replaced the feed system twice, but it looks like the problem we've actually been getting is from a mixed signal from the computer system that's been grinding off the gears on the extractor when it should be idling. Now we're down an extractor and need to replace the computers that run it.@p9 That means we need another assembly replacement of: x5 Mining Equipment x10 Computers x20 Advanced Electronics To replace and rewire the feed system and rig up a new control computer. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've got this problem, but every time we think we've fixed it, it moves to another part of the rig and breaks something. I'm at the point of suspecting sabotage by some malicious AI. This time, the capacitors that run the packager blew when a transformer shorted.@p9 We've got the boys unloading the conveyors manually, but they can't keep that up for long, so we need: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Energy Regulators To get things back up and running normally. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We're working with Pentaxid here. This stuff is not only radioactive but toxic. We burn through air filters like they're coffee filters, so we need regular replacements. That's only a minor problem compared to the constant abrasions to the hazard suits the crews wear. It's one of the things no one tells you about pentaxid mining: Those crystals have razor-sharp edges.@p9 As i'm sure you can guess what I need from you: x100 Air Filters and x5 Armor Boosters To deal with the abrasions. You can get Air filters from any chemical or science factory in civilized space. Boosters you can probably get from ServantCorp.
I've brought your filters and armor boosters

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Pentaxid mining is one of the most dangerous professions in the galaxy. We have to deal with super-critical ignitions within unstable crystals that release a shockwave of gamma radiation.@p9 We've already lost a dozen piece of equipment that were inadequately shielded. We need those things back up and running, and that's where you come in. I'll need x20 Radiation Shielding You'll definitely need a Transportation Booster to carry the stuff.@p9 I'm paying double, what any other operation will pay for that shielding. You can get them from the factory floor of eitherThermal Interactions Ltd or Non-Linear Productions. They're in high demand on reactors and starship drives, so they're pretty cheap.

We've got a serious problem on site 3, with a very large and unstable crystal. I can't risk people pulling those things out by hand, so we use a robotic arm to pull them up. The problem? A nearby crystal flared up and cooked the control circuits in the arm and we don't have a replacement.@p9 I need you to head out to a Hostile Apparatus Robotics Factory for a replacement for the robotics and a new interface: x6 Robotics x24 Tablets I need this now, i'll pay extra since we can't do any work on site 3 until that troublemaking crystal has been safely removed..

We go through a hazard suit at least once a month, except this week when a flare up on Site 2 cooked the electronics on team-12's suit so they can't regulate temperature. We need a full replacement set with hardened electronics to boot.@p9 I can't afford the exorbitant prices ServantCorp expects for a hazard suit and they won't offer use anything similar. But I bet: x3 Heavy Armor x3 Radiation Boosters x6 Radiation Shielding would do just as well, if not better for less than half the price.@p9 I know you can get Radiation Shielding from both Thermal Interactions and Non-Linear Productions since we order from them regularly. You may have to turn to ServantCorp for the armor or boosters though. Don't worry, you'll be reimbursed.
I've brought you the shielding and boosters

Extracting the raw and unstable Pentaxid crystals is challenge enough, but storage and transport is another serious problem we face every day. If this job didn't pay more than even Zascosium mining, even we would be here.@p9 So what I need from you is: x30 Nitrogen x30 Heat Exchangers x5 Spare Parts What they're for is storage. The natural radioactive decay of the elements in the crystals output enough heat to eventually melt steel.@p9 That's obviously not good. We need to pressurize the containers with nitrogen to keep it from reacting and act as a coolant and heat exchangers to shunt the build-up of heat to heat sinks on the outside. The parts can be found each in a different factory. I'll pay you over double for this shipment since it's gonna be a lot of trouble to fulfill.

As you can see, we deal with a toxic and highly radioactive material here. Not a week goes by without someone getting a Radiation Burn, so we're always in need of anti-rad meds. What's worse is when the radiation dose is just too high to cure and all we can do is watch them fall apart from the inside.@p9 That's why i'm asking you to help me out by bringing me: x50 Anti-Radiation Pills x40 Radiation Immunity Shots x30 Decontamination Kits We can't fix what's already been done, but we can at least prevent it in future.

Once we've extracted the Pentaxid crystals, we need to harden them against suddenly fracturing. If that happens in the wrong place and time, it's possible to trigger a spontaneous fusion reaction and wipe out an entire freighter. Sounds unlikely right? Wrong. It's happened twice in the past, so now we're extra careful.@p9 What we use here is X-05 Chemicals from Chemmix Industrial mixed with Salt that's used to remove particulates from the crystal and form a hard, non-reactive coating: x25 Chemicals x130 Salt Will do the current shipment, and i'll find someone else to handle the next one if you're not available.

Another slow day working a Monazite rig... \nHey there, don't usually get visitors around here. Not much to see or do on a rig like this.\nI'm Berone, i'm the foreman of this rig. I handle overseeing that nothing explodes.

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I may have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. There's not many of us on this rig, so we're always needing replacement parts since there's not enough time to repair some of the larger devices.@p9 Right now we need a new Separator that will keep the Monazite Sand and dump the rocks, grass and critters: x5 Mining Equipment x15 Computers x1 Optronics You should be able to find the parts at Polaris' P-3, Chromium-Sierra and NLP factories.

We've needed an overhaul of the drills' gearbox for about a year. The constant abrasion from sand and rocks has worn down some of the higher speed gears and ruined half the capacitors that power the motors. You're an independent, right? You can do it.@p9 What we need is: x7 Mining Equipment x21 Advanced Capacitors x35 Energy Regulator To replace and rewire the drive system so we can increase our speed back to the normal rate. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.@p9 One of the concerns of the other transports is the sheer bulk. You'll probably need at least 2 Transportation Boosters to even carry it here. Well, I leave it to you. You'll be paid well for bringing us the parts.

The rig's transmitter isn't much good these days. Too much hard living, ya know? What we need is a complete refit with boosted range and gain so we can reach the ships in orbit like we used to. It's not a hard job, but will have to do a bit of travelling to find the parts we need.@p9 Lemme see... I believe we'll need: x10 Communication Equipment x10 Computers x20 Superconductors x50 Tablets x75 Advanced Electronics@p9 Like I said, it'll require a bit of travelling since the parts are made by different companies, and only sent from their factories. I'll pay double for this shipment. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

This place is a bit on the dreary side. We don't have any personalization restrictions like other mining rigs do. We're free to customize what the interior looks like as much as we want. The problem? We have nothing to decorate with.@p9 I know, not an important job. But we can't dig up surface rock for Monazite day in and day out with nothing to keep us sane. That's why I need you to go out and bring back some luxury goods to spruce up the living quarters of this ol' tub and breathe some life back into the job.@p9 Let's see... How about? x20 Civilian Furniture x4 Tribal Furnishings x1 Taking a break Poster x1 A rest Poster@p9 You can probably buy the stuff from those Luxury Trader snobs, but i'm sure you can find the stuff cheaper somewhere else. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since my sanity is on the line here and it's pretty out-of-the-way.

Monazite is a reliable source of Neodymium as well as a variety of rare-earth elements. One of the things included in that bunch is Thorium. We sell the byproducts, and thorium sells well enough to the right market but we get more than we'd like. It's radioactive you see, and our storage bins aren't lead-lined.@p9 So what I need you to get me this time is: x5 Spare Parts x15 Radiation Shielding The problem with getting both of those is that Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories make one and Thermal Interactions and NLP make the other.

Solar output is high this time of year, so we can cut back on generator use and switch to retractable solar panels. The only issue is that many of the panels have been chipped and scratched from sand and dust and need to be repaired.@p9 We can handle the refit with: x50 Solar Cells x25 Energy Regulators They don't ship out cells to places like this, we're too small an operation to bother with, so we need to go through a third-party like you.

We're preparing a move to a new field with a higher quality of Monazite next month. The problem is that it's mixed with other minerals and at a deeper depth. We'll need an improved scanner and deeper drilling modules.@p9 I should be able to cannibalize an Autominer Core for the depth and Optronics for the scanning. That leaves only an increase in power requirements... x8 Power Coils x3 Optronics x1 Autominer Core Will hopefully work. I'll even pay 75% over market price.

We've got heat build-up in one of the rear generators. We're not sure what the cause is, but it's always the same generator on every Monazite rig i've worked. It must have something to do with the placement of the generator. As before, we'll need to redistribute the heat to the outer hull.@p9 What we need you to bring us here is: x75 Aluminium Foil x65 Heat Exchangers That should deal with the build-up. You can get the Heat Exchangers from either Thermal Interactions' or Zero Horizons' Factories.
I've got the parts for the heat sink

We've been meaning to run a test on a different extraction method. We can't get the parts from Polaris since we'd be an industrial entity, but as a private citizen you can get the parts we need without Polaris' restrictions.@p9 What I need from you is: x1 Improved Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

You know what I could go for right now? A burger. Actually, the pantry's looking a bit bare as it is. Do you mind doing a grocery run for me?@p9 x25 Cheeseburgers x25 Ice Cream x100 Cheese x100 Bread Yeah, i'm a cheap date.

Ahoy there! Keep clear of the drills or you'll get fried and watch your footing. We have bore holes all over the place. \nThis operation handles the mining of Sathylite, NOT 'Satellite' from deep underground for export to a refinery to be made into starship hulls.

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I'll have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. Which if there's one thing we need, it's drill replacements. We burn through them faster than anything else here owing to the hardness of the ore. Sometimes I think we'd be better off just strapping the ore to ships as armor.@p9 What I need you to get is: x5 Mining Equipment x10 Coolant x15 Motors You should be able to find the parts at Polaris' P-3, Thermal Interactions and Chemmix Industrial Factories.

We're running out of charge in our capacitors before we can crack the deposit, and once we've recharged the damned rock is cold again and so we waste half our time simply cooking stone. We can't even work at night since it loses heat twice as fast!@p9 What we need is: x7 Mining Equipment x21 Advanced Capacitors x35 Energy Regulator To hold charge longer and keep the power flow even. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.@p9 One of the concerns of the other transports is the sheer bulk. You'll probably need at least 2 Transportation Boosters to even carry it here. Well, I leave it to you. You'll be paid well for bringing us the parts.

We've burned out another laser drill today trying to get out this one node. The bastard must have an occlusion of Platinum or something! Sathium doesn't take that kind of heat without cracking. We'll need to try something different...@p9 I'll need: x9 Mining Equipment x3 Laser Kits x12 Bottles of Xenon@p9 The first two to repair the drill, and the last one to boost the laser's effectiveness enough to bore right through the node.@p9 This will require a bit of travelling since the parts are made by different companies, and only sent from their factories. I'll pay 75% above market for this shipment. You'll probably need to pick up a pair of Transportation Boosters too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We've been running at about 70% drill output for the last few months on one of the drills. One of the techs was finally able to track down the problem as energy bleed-off from poor quality power conduits. We need a new set of cables from a reliable source and i'd rather not risk our previous supplier.@p9 Think you can handle: x35 Superconductors x10 Power Coils x10 Advanced Capacitors?@p9 You can probably find those Superconductors at Arriake Technology or Solaris-AMP's factories. They're not the kind of thing they sell at Trade Stations.

We're in the process of testing different gas mediums for the laser drill in an attempt to get a stronger beam with less diffusion. We've exhausted a dozen gas mixes and need more raw gases for our tests.@p9 So what I need you to get me this time is: x10 Bottles of Helium x10 Bottles of Nitrogen x10 Bottles of Xenon x3 Scientific Equipment I know you can get the Equipment from Chromium-Sierra Sciences, but i'm not sure about the gases.

We get an unusual build-up of heat in the drill casing around mid-day and so far we've been unable to find the source. We're not sure if it's the sun or simply because of how long we've been running the drills. So far the only fix has been to shut down while it cools off.@p9 We need a fix, even a temporary one. So I need: x250 Zascosium Alloy x100 Graphite x20 Heat Exchangers To dump the heat into heat sinks and vent it so we'll be able to run the drills for an entire day.

We're already on short rations and need someone to do a food run for us before we run out of food. Our last delivery only brought half our order so we'll have to shut down while the crews go get the food themselves.@p9 We're happy to eat ration packs at this point, but something a bit nicer wouldn't hurt... x65 Dino Stew x65 Pizzas x65 Fruit Pies Since it will save time, effort and money i'll pay 75% above market price.

Impurities of Sperrylite are in the latest haul of Sathylite and it's a pain in the ass to remove. It's fine when it's a large chunk of the stuff, we can crack that off and sell it. When it's tiny nodules like this, we have to use acids to remove it.@p9 What we need you to bring us here is: x250 Sulfur x20 Bottles of Chemicals You can get the chemicals from Chemmix Industrial or Chromium-Sierra Sciences. We'll mix the stuff ourselves here.

We've been meaning to run a test on a different extraction method. We can't get the parts from Polaris since we'd be an industrial entity, but as a private citizen you can get the parts we need without Polaris' restrictions.@p9 What I need from you is: x1 Improved Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

Our system calibrations are completely off. We've been meaning to replace the control system so we can use more equipment. The last time we tried, we overloaded the CPU and it seems to have had lasting effects.@p9 What I need you to get me is: x3 Large Optronic Bridges x30 Computers And we should be able to bring the control system back up to spec.

Congratulations on stepping into hell. This here is a Zascovite mine, the closest thing to hell anyone can come without being dead! \nWe are NOT responsible for loss of life or limb of any sightseers that decide to visit us.\nWhat are you even doing here?

Like i've said, this place is hell. Mining Zascovite under the bedrock is like trying to dig up a landmine with a baseball bat. It pays better than anything, and if you die, it'll probably be quick. Quicker than pulling pentax.@p9 So yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier. You'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books. Is that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I'll have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

I hope you've got Transportation Boosters on hand, because we need supplies in huge numbers and we can't risk unloading ships. What we need is mining equipment. We melt our drills daily, and unlike those civilian mining operations I don't have time to tell you where to get the parts!@p9 What I need you to get is: x16 Mining Equipment Yeah, 16 of 'em. You'll need a full set of Transportation Boosters to lug those big boys out here. But I don't skimp on pay, so it'll be worth it.

I hope you've got Transportation Boosters on hand, because we need supplies in huge numbers and we can't risk unloading ships. What we need is mining equipment. We melt our drills daily, and unlike those civilian mining operations I don't have time to tell you where to get the parts!@p9 What I need you to get is: x10 Mining Equipment x10 Spare Parts x50 Motors Doesn't matter what they're for. I just need them for repairs.

Alright, this is a big job and a well-paying one! We run on Fusion in this place! Doesn't look it, right? Well, we do. And our Fusion Reactor's ready for a replacement but no one will ship out to this hellhole.@p9 What I need you to get is: x1 Reactor Core x15 Radiation Shielding x20 Superconductors This is a complete replacement, so you're going to be carrying the bulk of the parts. That will require FOUR Transportation Boosters on your armor.

Heat's a massive problem here. We go through coolant at an insane rate and we're always looking for more efficiency in diverting the heat away from the critical systems. Think you can handle: x100 Heat Exchangers x35 Coolant?

The work crews down here need to be armored and insulated against the high temperatures in the mine. The real problem is air supply. We go through air filters fast and suits don't withstand the wear-and-tear of a Zascovite mine particularly well.@p9 What I need you to get is: x200 Filters x3 Heavy Armor x3 Oxygen Tank Boosters Don't act tough, you'll need Transportation Boosters on your armor if you want to carry all those things.

We're almost at the end of the work day. I need something to reward the boys, and the rig needs a top-up of water if you can manage that too. You'll need Transportation Boosters to carry the stuff, so i'll pay extra.@p9 Here's the list of what I need you to get: x50 Water Containers x50 Ration Packs x250 Bottles of Beer

We've been having trouble with pirates and raiders the last few weeks. We were able to drive them off last time, but there's a good chance they'll be back with more men and more guns next time. We don't have anyone with a license to buy heavy weapons, so we need an outsider to do it for us.@p9 What we need is: x5 LS-45 Laser Rifles x5 Interweapon Assault Rifles x3 Guided Rocket Launchers Make sure they don't catch onto you bringing these to us or they might hit us earlier.

Impurities of Sperrylite are in the latest haul of Sathylite and it's a pain in the ass to remove. It's fine when it's a large chunk of the stuff, we can crack that off and sell it. When it's tiny nodules like this, we have to use acids to remove it.@p9 What we need you to bring us here is: x250 Sulfur x20 Bottles of Chemicals You can get the chemicals from Chemmix Industrial or Chromium-Sierra Sciences. We'll mix the stuff ourselves here.

We've been meaning to run a test on a different extraction method. We can't get the parts from Polaris since we'd be an industrial entity, but as a private citizen you can get the parts we need without Polaris' restrictions.@p9 What I need from you is: x1 Advanced Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

Our feedline computers are completely overloaded. We've had to shut down the drilling in the west tunnel in order to keep the rest of the site operational. We need a complete replacement of our Control System. Repairs won't do it this time.@p9 What I need is: x1 Advanced CPU Extender for a Base These things are so big that you'll need 4 Transportation Boosters to even carry it. We can't unload it from your ship, so you're on your own.

Welcome to one of the Miravella Mining Company's operations. We do the hard job of mining Pyrestrum for use in plasma generators, coils and weapons.\nNow that the official greeting is over with: We're not equipped to have visitors, so would you kindly uhhh... go away? We have enough problems to deal with.

Gods yes, we need help. We've had four guys sent to Andromedical with chemical burns after one of them did a stupid stunt with a shale barrel. What I really need is someone to fill in for our courier who took the four idiots away. You'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books. Is that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payoutsover 100k, so I'll have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

I hope you've got Transportation Boosters on hand, because we need supplies in huge numbers and we can't risk unloading ships. What we need is mining equipment. We melt our drills daily, and unlike those civilian mining operations I don't have time to tell you where to get the parts!@p9 What I need you to get is: x12 Mining Equipment Yeah, 12 of 'em. You'll need a full set of Transportation Boosters to lug those big boys out here. But I don't skimp on pay, so it'll be worth it.

I hope you've got Transportation Boosters on hand, because we need supplies in huge numbers and we can't risk unloading ships. What we need is mining equipment. We melt our drills daily, and unlike those civilian mining operations I don't have time to tell you where to get the parts!@p9 What I need you to get is: x14 Mining Equipment Doesn't matter what they're for. I just need them for repairs.

We've got corrosive dust kicked up by the drills inside the drill housing where we couldn't see it and now the frame is both rusted all to hell and too radioactive for anyone to get close enough to repair it.@p9 What I need you to get is: x16 Mining Equipment This is for a complete replacement, so you're going to be carrying the bulk of the parts. That will require FOUR Transportation Boosters on your armor.

Pyrestrum's an ore mix of Erestrum and Sulfur. The reaction between the two make the dust thrown up by the drills radioactive and corrosive. There ain't no worse combination for a work site.@p9 What I need to combat these two problems is: x20 Radiation Shielding x50 Oxygen Bottles The shielding to keep the radiation out of the personnel areas and the compressed air to clean the dust off everything.

We're getting beam diffusion in one of the drills and the techs have found that the reaction chamber is filled with Pyrestrum dust and it's obstructing the beam, but we can't don't have the materials to repressurize the chamber or protection for the work crew to do the work.@p9 What I need you to get is: x100 Bottles of Helium x3 Heavy Armor x3 Radiation Shielding Boosters Don't act tough, you'll need Transportation Boosters on your armor if you want to carry all those things.

We're almost at the end of the work day. I need something to reward the boys, and the rig needs a top-up of water if you can manage that too. You'll need Transportation Boosters to carry the stuff, so i'll pay extra.@p9 Here's the list of what I need you to get: x50 Water Containers x50 Ration Packs x250 Bottles of Beer

We've lost another walkway between sites and with it one of the crew. He'll live, but he'll out of commission for the rest of the season! We can't risk that again, so i'm sending you to get corrosion-resistant materials to armor up the rest of the site.@p9 It'll be costly, but worth it in the long run. x1000 Platinum Plates You WILL need Four Transportation Boosters as well in order to carry all those plates. That's 32 tonnes of platinum and it's going to be heavy.

We must've hit a patch of near-pure Erestrum metal in the current deposit. That can sometimes be a problem since the heat of the drill will melt it easily and it can flow into the electronics. Erestrum is a strong conductor, and that's exactly what happened. The motors and power coils melted into slag.@p9 We need a complete replacement of the extractor system now: x1 Advanced Upgrade Kit x20 Power Coils x50 Advanced Electronics x150 Motors You'll need at least Three Transportation Boosters to carry that order, so you'll be compensated accordingly.

We've been meaning to run a test on a different extraction method. We can't get the parts from Polaris since we'd be an industrial entity, but as a private citizen you can get the parts we need without Polaris' restrictions.@p9 What I need from you is: x1 Advanced Auto-Mining Device Buy it or construct it yourself and bring it to me. It's a little loophole I know a few prospectors use out in the field to get past Polaris monopoly on mining.

We've been having trouble with pirates and raiders the last few weeks. We were able to drive them off last time, but there's a good chance they'll be back with more men and more guns next time. We don't have anyone with a license to buy heavy weapons, so we need an outsider to do it for us.@p9 What we need is: x5 LS-45 Laser Rifles x5 Interweapon Scatterguns x3 Guided Rocket Launchers Make sure they don't catch onto you bringing these to us or they might hit us earlier.

Ahoy! What business do you have here at Salzach Mining?\nWe're here extracting salt from seawater. Doesn't look or sound like an exciting job, but it's always in demand so we make a fair amount of coin.

I don't need any help with the rig, but i'm not above getting help with supplies if you've got a ship.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of materials too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

Salt's a problem to mine. It gets everywhere and rusts machinery, so we always need replacement parts. Which is what I need you to get:\nx1 Mining Equipment\nP3 and NLP factories make 'em so should sell 'em too if you can find a factory.

Salt's a problem to mine. It gets everywhere and rusts machinery, so we always need replacement parts. Which is what I need you to get:\nx2 Mining Equipment\nP3 and NLP factories make 'em so should sell 'em too if you can find a factory.

We had a large granite rock get jammed in the excavator's axle that overstrained the motors and sheared off several struts and bent several frame parts. I need some new motors and parts. Not expensive, but hard to get sent out here.@p9 That's why I need you to go and get me: x50 Motors x500 Mechanical Components x100 Steel Plates I'll pay well for the parts if they're good quality.

Our computer systems are outdated and we need a set of new computers and the wiring to connect them up. Everything we've got is at least 10 years out of date and it causes trouble whenever one of those modern haulers comes to pick up a shipment.@p9 Shouldn't be a problem for you to get: x45 Computers x150 Electronics x300 Optical Fiber So we can upgrade our computers.

When we were swinging the excavator head around last week, we overburdened the communication array on the top and we've been restricted to bouncing com signals off the local stations to reach orbit.@p9 What I need you to get is: x10 Communication Equipment x10 Computers The only place you can get those Communication Equipment is Arriake Technology. It's an Electronics factory under Polaris.

We're running low on food and it's time for me to order supplies. Those guys overcharge us for delivery every time, so i'm assigning the job to you and at least i'll know the money is going somewhere worthwhile.@p9 Here's the list of what I need you to get: x50 Cheeseburgers x50 Canned Meat x50 Berry Juice

This site is pretty open and we'll be getting a couple of youngsters on board in a few weeks for training in the business but we've no place to put them. Even when I was starting out I had a place to sleep, so i'd like to have more than a tent waiting for when they arrive.@p9 It'll be costly, but worth it to give them some proper housing units. x5 Prefab Housing Modules Should do it. The only place that produces them are the P3 Factories under Polaris. They're pretty bulky though.
I've brought you those prefab housing modules

Every now and then, the excavator picks up a big chunk of granite that gets wedged somewhere important and I have to send one of the boys up to pull it out. The last one was too heavy to lift, so we all had to climb up their with drills and break it apart.@p9 I'd rather that didn't happen again, so I need you to get me: x1 Transportation Booster x1 Medium Armor x3 Handheld Laser Drills Which should make it easier to carry the pieces and failing that, easier to break it into smaller pieces.

While this isn't an exciting job, it's still fraught with aches and injuries, so we're always in need of medical supplies. Some of them we can get easily, others are harder or require special licensing to purchase.@p9 Do you think you can get us: x50 Bandages x50 Antibiotic Ointment x10 Adrenaline Shots That's all we need. We mostly have to deal with salt burns and the occasional broke toe.

The last couple of weeks have been wetter than usual and it's causing more than enough problems since it's soaking into the rocksalt and turning the ground into a quagmire of salty mud We need something to get rid of the water.@p9 That's where you come into it: x1 Water Extractor x10 Promethium Hydrocells x75 Plastic Tubes Are what I need to pump out the excess water. Shouldn't be too hard for you.
I've brought the pump and pipes you wanted
What can we do for you here? This is a privately-owned digsite. We dig for gold here.\nIf you're raiders, you're out of luck. Just because we mine gold here, doesn't mean we're rich.

Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. Not so much in the hard labor department. If you're looking for a job, we're in need of a fast, cheap courier.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I'll have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. There's not many of us on this rig, so we're always needing replacement parts since there's not enough time to repair some of the larger devices.@p9 Right now we need a new Separator that can identify and separate the gold from rock and other minerals: x5 Mining Equipment x15 Computers x1 Optronics You should be able to find the parts at Polaris' P-3, Chromium-Sierra and NLP factories.

Millenia of technological advancement in mining techniques and sometimes the oldest methods are still the best when it comes to separating the gold from the rubble and tailings. Water is still the best for gold mining, even here.@p9 What we need is: x7 Mining Equipment x20 Water Containers You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. but you'll probably need at least 2 Transportation Boosters to even carry it here.

We're having trouble with separating the Pyrite from the Gold in this latest digsite. I've just checked the tailings and there's gold in it along with the pyrite, which means the optical sensors are failing to tell the difference.@p9 It's a long shot, but I think: x30 Flux Coils x60 Energy Regulators x300 Titanium Ingots Should work as a sufficiently powerful electromagnet to pull out the iron pyrite from the gold.

The conveyor's slipped it's track and ripped out the supporting struts, so we're using a backup that really should've been scrapped years ago. We can't get a ship to bring replacements out here without an excessive payment. Just because we mine gold doesn't mean we're rich.@p9 What I need you to get me is: x5 Spare Parts x50 Zascosium Alloy x50 Motors You can find those Spare Parts at Polaris' P-3 and Hostile Apparatus' factories.

I need you to get me some mobility boosters and armor to put them in. The boys here need the added mobility to get around the rig when something goes wrong. Gods know it happens every day, and we're too slow to stop things from getting worse.@p9 What I need you to get is: x3 Mobility Boosters x3 Medium Armor You can make the armor. Though it's probably easier to buy it if you don't have a spare set lying around.

We need food here. We're not rich, despite all the gold and we're so busy we forget to eat half the time, so our reserves go bad before we get to them. We need something that'll last.@p9 Here's the list of what I need you to get: x20 Canned Vegetables x20 Ration Packs x20 Canned Meat

Right now I just need some standard repair materials, nothing major. Wiring and electrical parts mainly. x75 Glass Plates x125 Advanced Electronics x150 Optical Fiber Shouldn't be hard for you to get.

Fuel costs to keep the generators running are putting a dent in our productivity. We need a replacement, but the standard solar panels used in civilian construction don't provide enough juice to run our systems. We need the industrial grade solar cells if we want to see a better return.@p9 What we'll need it: x30 Solar Cells x10 Advanced Capacitors Solaris-AMP Manufacturing make the Solar Cells, but they won't ship out such a small order to a place like this.

I need medical supplies. We're short on painkillers and I can't get the licensing required to purchase more. x10 Health Pack x10 Trauma Kits x24 Narcotics I don't need to know where you get that last item, just as long as the quality is good.

We've been having trouble with pirates and raiders the last few weeks. We were able to drive them off last time, but there's a good chance they'll be back with more men and more guns next time. We don't have anyone with a license to buy heavy weapons, so we need an outsider to do it for us.@p9 What we need is: x5 Advanced Submachine Guns x5 Heavy Sniper Rifles x3 Plasma Cannons Make sure they don't catch onto you bringing these to us or they might hit us earlier.

This is one of the platinum mines set up by M.A Corp.\nWhat we pull out of the ground here is Sperrylite. It's toxic stuff that's hell to process. You're not one of our regular transports, so what are you after here?

We've had two guys sent to Andromedical after they got a strong whiff of dust out of the excavation. What I need is a freighter to replace the one that took them away.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I'll have to wire the money into your account.@p9 It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of ore too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. There's not many of us on this rig, so we're always needing replacement parts since there's not enough time to repair some of the larger devices.@p9 We've got a problem keeping the drills cool as they work at cracking the ore, which is some of the hardest in the business: x5 Mining Equipment x5 Coolant You should be able to find the parts at Polaris' P-3, Thermal Interactions and NLP factories.

We've overburdened the drill by drilling through the thickest part of the deposit and the drill's building heat faster than we can cool it. It's too late to reposition the drill, so we're stuck with this course. What we can do is fix the overheating problem.@p9 All we need is: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Heat Exchangers You can get the equipment from Polaris' P-3, Thermal Interactions and NLP factories.

Our drills need servicing and that means replacement lenses and a fresh set of power coils each. We also need to improve energy conductance, but that's a job for another time. One issue at a time.@p9 To conduct the servicing i'll need: x3 Laser Upgrade Kits x10 Power Coils x25 Advanced Capacitors You should have no trouble getting your hands on any of these parts.

We've hit a snag with the robotic arms that sort the sperrylite from the rock off the conveyors. Sperrylite is very heavy and it seems a chunk larger than normal was just too much for the arms and they've burst the valves on the hydraulics.@p9 I need replacement parts: x10 Spare Parts x4 Robotics You can find those Spare Parts at Polaris' P-3 and both at Hostile Apparatus' factories.

We've got a survey team coming next week and we're expected to have everything set up so they can evaluate the quality of the ore around here. We don't have any of the things they need and we can't get any of them in a hurry.@p9 That's where you come in. I need: x2 Optronics x5 Scientific Equipment x10 Bottles of Xenon Gas It's outside my area of expertise on where you can get those, so i'll pay 75% above market price for them.
I've got the things you need to set up a lab

We need food here. We're not rich, despite all the platinum and we're so busy we forget to eat half the time, so our reserves go bad before we get to them. We need something that'll last.@p9 Here's the list of what I need you to get: x20 Canned Vegetables x20 Ration Packs x20 Canned Meat

Right now I just need some standard repair materials, nothing major. Just parts we need for reinforcing the older hulls and electricals. x25 Advanced Electronics x250 Neodymium Ingots x500 Sathium Ingots Shouldn't be hard for you to get.

We were checking the cables running to the drills yesterday and noticed a number of them are badly corroded. Something in the atmosphere seems to be eating through cables. We need a stronger replacement that's corrosion resistant.@p9 I'm thinking that it might be worth getting: x40 Superconductors x160 Titanium Plates Arriake Technology and Solaris-AMP Manufacturing make superconducting cables, but they won't ship out such a small order to a place like this.

I need medical supplies. We're short on painkillers and I can't get the licensing required to purchase more. x10 Decontamination Kits x10 Detox Kits x24 Narcotics I don't need to know where you get that last item, just as long as the quality is good.

We've been having trouble with pirates and raiders the last few weeks. We were able to drive them off last time, but there's a good chance they'll be back with more men and more guns next time. We don't have anyone with a license to buy heavy weapons, so we need an outsider to do it for us.@p9 What we need is: x5 AAF-01 Blaster Rifles x5 Advanced Submachine Guns x5 Miniguns Make sure they don't catch onto you bringing these to us or they might hit us earlier.
I hope you're not here to pick up our latest sulfur shipment. We haven't even half-filled it.\nNo? Well then what do you need with us in this hellhole?

I don't need any help with the rig, but i'm not above getting help with supplies if you've got a ship.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of materials too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.

As you can see, we operate a excavator rig to pull up surface sulfur. The issue we've got right now is that we've thrown a bucket, so there's an empty slot in the chain:\nx1 Mining Equipment\nfrom P3 or NLP factories should fix the problem.

The excavator we run here digs up sulfur from the surface rock, where there's been recent volcanic activity. Problem is that we need: x2 Mining Equipment from P3 or NLP factories to fix a broken drive train on the excavator's left side.

We had a large granite rock get jammed in the excavator's axle that overstrained the motors and sheared off several struts and bent several frame parts. I need some new motors and parts. Not expensive, but hard to get sent out here.@p9 That's why I need you to go and get me: x50 Motors x500 Mechanical Components x100 Titanium Plates I'll pay well for the parts if they're good quality.

Our computer systems are outdated and we need a set of new computers and the wiring to connect them up. Everything we've got is at least 10 years out of date and it causes trouble whenever one of those modern haulers comes to pick up a shipment.@p9 Shouldn't be a problem for you to get: x45 Computers x150 Electronics x300 Optical Fiber So we can upgrade our computers.

When we were swinging the excavator head around last week, we overburdened the communication array on the top and we've been restricted to bouncing com signals off the local stations to reach orbit.@p9 What I need you to get is: x10 Communication Equipment x10 Computers The only place you can get those Communication Equipment is Arriake Technology. It's an Electronics factory under Polaris.

We're running low on food and it's time for me to order supplies. Those guys overcharge us for delivery every time, so i'm assigning the job to you and at least i'll know the money is going somewhere worthwhile.@p9 Here's the list of what I need you to get: x250 Flour x300 Meat x500 Vegetables

We've got pretty sparse quarters here and it'd be nice to have something to do in our downtime. We've got some extra expenses from the company, so i'd like some nice furniture for me and the crew.@p9 Should be an easy job for you. x15 Civilian Furniture x3 Tribal Furnishings x1 Foreign World Poster You should be able to buy them all from Luxury Goods Merchants on some Trade stations.

Every now and then, the excavator picks up a big chunk of granite that gets wedged somewhere important and I have to send one of the boys up to pull it out. The last one was too heavy to lift, so we all had to climb up their with drills and break it apart.@p9 I'd rather that didn't happen again, so I need you to get me: x1 Transportation Booster x1 Medium Armor x3 Handheld Laser Drills Which should make it easier to carry the pieces and failing that, easier to break it into smaller pieces.

We've got everything from chemical burns to actual burns. Heatstroke is common. This is no easy job, but the products are always in demand and so are medical supplies.@p9 I need you to get us: x10 Detox Kits x100 Antibiotic Ointment x20 Adrenaline Shots That's all we need. We mostly have to deal with sulfur burns and the occasional broke toe.

Oxygen quality is poor here and the sulfur dust in the air has a habit of turning into sulfuric acid when it gets damp, so we need to keep suited up with oxygen tanks and filters on most of the time we're outside.@p9 That's why I need: x25 Oxygen Bottles x50 Filters To top up our supplies.
I've brought the pump and pipes you wanted

Keep clear of the drills, civvy. I don't want to have to clean you out of the borehole because you got minced.\nYou don't look like any kind of bandit i've ever seen. So what brings you to our graphite mine?

You want to help? Well, sure I don't mind some extra help. But not with the drills, I need a courier to bring in supplies for me and the crew.\nYou'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But you'll be working off the books.\nIs that good for you?

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. It's more than you'd pay for the goods at a trade station, but still a good deal for me since there's no exorbitant shipping fees. Take this shipment of materials too. This is that bonus I told you I might throw in.
Like all mining rigs run by all the companies and factions, we're always in need of replacement parts for our drills.\nx2 Mining Equipment\nfrom P3 or NLP factories should fix the current problem.

If someone set up a shipping network that dealt exclusively in supplying mining equipment to digsites like ours, they'd probably make a killing. Since no one has done that, we need to rely on couriers like you to go out and bring us the parts we need.@p9 Today at least, we need: x4 Mining Equipment from P3 or NLP factories to fix a broken drive train.

I hope you can get some higher quality parts than the usual fare we deal with. We're on our third drill head this week and we're tired of replacing them, so I need some higher quality parts that won't wear out as fast.@p9 That's why I need you to go and get me: x10 Flux Coils x25 Motors x200 Sathium Plates I'll pay well for the parts if they're good quality.

Our power feed hasn't been what it used to ever since we got that shoddy generator from Polaris. The flow is irregular and there's nothing we can do to fix it, so we need a transformer to smooth the output so it doesn't keep straining our systems.@p9 Shouldn't be a problem for you to get: x50 Advanced Capacitors x50 Energy Regulators Which we can use to rig up a capacitor and transformer. We may still have to replace the generator again...

We've got a heat build-up in the drill frame around midday. We've not sure if it's because it's the middle of the day or because we've been running the drills constantly for several hours. We need them to cool off faster, which means better tech.@p9 What I need you to get is: x15 Heat Exchangers x20 Computers x200 Cobalt Alloy The heat exchangers can be bought from any Thermal Interactions Ltd's Factory. They're one of our major buyers.

We're running low on food and it's time for me to order supplies. Those guys overcharge us for delivery every time, so i'm assigning the job to you and at least i'll know the money is going somewhere worthwhile.@p9 Here's the list of what I need you to get: x100 Beer x150 Ham x200 Sandwiches

This site is pretty open and we'll be getting a couple of youngsters on board in a few weeks for training in the business but we've no place to put them. Even when I was starting out I had a place to sleep, so i'd like to have more than a tent waiting for when they arrive.@p9 It'll be costly, but worth it to give them some proper housing units. x5 Prefab Housing Modules Should do it. The only place that produces them are the P3 Factories under Polaris. They're pretty bulky though.

We've had problems recently with pests and other... wildlife, trying to get into the crew housing units and we need something that'll get rid of them and keep them out.@p9 You help us out by getting: x5 Flamethrowers x30 Ethanol Canisters To deal with the more problematic of the wildlife.

Graphite's not heavy or particularly hard, so we don't get a lot of physical injuries. What we do get a lot of is problems with inhalation of the dust that's on the crew's suit when they take them off.@p9 I need you to get us: x20 Health Packs x50 Adrenaline Shot That's for the occasional incident with high-volume dust inhalation.

Because of the graphite dust that gets everywhere, the crew needs to be suited up at all times while near the drills. That means they need an O2 supply and filters to keep the dust out of their lungs.@p9 That's why I need: x25 Oxygen Bottles x50 Filters To top up our supplies.
I've brought the pump and pipes you wanted
Welcome to QuantumSTAR!\nWe've got the best deals on high-end electronics and computer systems this side of the galaxy!\nNow, what can I do for you today?

Graphite is in high demand these days. Especially in electronics and engine parts.\nYou could probably make a killing selling to an electronics factory like Arriake Technology or Thermal Interactions Ltd.

I've heard that those snobs at Gold Standard Luxuries aren't allowed to sell a certain poster because the Zirax High Command didn't like the portrayal of their people.\nApparently they have crates of the things filling up their factory.
We've had a few people in here asking about Hacking Software.\nWe know about the stuff, but we don't sell it. We at QuantumSTAR strive to follow the letter of the law.

<color=#ffffff>Looking for work are you?</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I don't have anything for you in the shop. But you look like the capable sort.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>This is all under-the-table. So you keep this to yourself and you get paid, got it?</color>

We've been getting customers coming in and asking us about hacking software. We've had reports of this hacking software being passed around and it seems to be an auto-loading external drive that's burned out on use.@p9 I've been trying to track down one so I can crack it open and see how it works. Think you can get me a Hacking Software: Spam? I'll pay you 15,000 credits for one of those things.

We've been getting customers coming in and asking us about hacking software. We've had reports of this hacking software being passed around and it seems to be an auto-loading external drive that's burned out on use.@p9 I've been trying to track down one so I can crack it open and see how it works. Think you can get me a Hacking Software: Overclock? I'll pay you 50,000 credits for one of those things.

One of our suppliers has been developing communication equipment and selling it through another company in direct conflict with their contract with us. I need to prove to head office that they're violating their contract.@p9 What I need you to do is acquire 10 of Arriake Technology's new Communication Equipment and bring it here. I'll pay you 15,000 credits for proof they're undercutting our sales.
<color=#ffffff>Thank you for your help with my little problem.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Unfortunately, i'm all out of work for you to do now.</color>
Excellent!\nThank you for a job well done. Here's your payment.\nIt's been a pleasure having you work for me.
Welcome to Totally Overpowered!\nWe're well-known for having the best drinks this side of the Delphic Abyss! Come in, sit down, and have a pint.\nSo what can I get ya?

I'll let you in on a lil' secret about the beer our brewery makes...@w4\nThe stuff has more alcohol in it than most people would expect. You can even use it to treat Infected Wounds and Dermal Parasites.

While TOP does a good deal, we're having trouble lately with them Tal'on breweries putting out better quality booze than us at cheaper prices.\nThe only reason we ain't threatened is that they can't make more than a few small batches at a time.

You can get drunk off most of our Beers, Wines and Liquors.\nJust so you know, while you're drunk you won't feel much. You'll probably feel better than you do sober. Your health will go up the whole time, but that hangover's a real killer.
<color=#ffffff>I only have a single odd-job that needs taking care of. If you don't mind that is?</color>
I'm running low on ice back here behind the bar. Think you can get me 100 Ice Chunks? I'll pay you more than double their market price. That's around 7k, right?\nSound good.

If you haven't already taken a look at our drinks list, we use some exotic ingredients in a few of our cocktails. One of them is Helium, but it's proving to be hard to come by after sanctions against Cloud Miners on the local gas giant, so we have to import from out-system.\nThink you can bring me 50 bottles of Helium? I'll pay 2.5x market price if you can get me some this week.
I think I can help you there

We have snacks back here that are great with our drinks. Salted chips, nuts and other things that dry the mouth and go good with a beer. Only problem is that we've run out of salt and no one else is willing to share what they've got. Considering how easy it is to get, you'd expect us to never run short, but...@p9 What I need you to get me is... well, Salt. But I need a ton of it. A literal metric ton of salt... maybe a bit less. So let's say... 600 Salt. If you can find an Ocean Planet, there may be a Salt Extractor somewhere on the water that'll sell it to you cheap.
I've managed to find you some salt
<color=#ffffff>Thanks for your help, sir.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Please, have a drink. This one's on the house.</color>
<color=#ffffff>I'm all out of odd jobs, i'm afraid.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I'm sure if something else comes up, i'll contact you.</color>
Welcome to Bertram's Arms!\nI'm not the man himself, but I am his cousin! I can get you a pretty sweet deal on weapons and tech if that's your jam!\nSo what are you looking for today?
We sell a selection of entry-level weapons, armors and supplies here at Bertram's.\nWe can't compete with M.A Corp, InterWeapon or ServantCorp on their field so we generalize... and we do alright.
You should check out Shipyards if you're looking to make a quick buck in salvage. They're always in need of materials and components to fast-track their building.

Have you tried a Dirty Legacy yet?\nIt's a drink they make at Totally Overpowered. It's more radioactive than they claim it is, you'll probably end up glowing.\nYou won't feel heat or cold while it's in your system though. I'm not so sure that's a good thing...
<color=#ffffff>If you're looking for work, I may have something for you.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I've only got the one job, but it's kinda important. Interested?</color>

We pride ourselves on providing entry-level weapons and hunting equipment, so we aren't competing with InterWeapon. But they've just put out a line of new weapons for hunting big game. That's them picking a fight with us.@p9 The good news is that the weapons are terrible for hunting. They make a big mess of the target and ruin hides. Now we need to hit back at them with something unique that they won't expect.@p9 The Tal'on use Crossbows for their hunting and leather is one of their most valuable commodities. So i'm thinking we should start producing and selling Crossbows. If you can get me just 5 Hunting Crossbows i'm willing to pay 5,000 credits each.

ServantCorp has been on my ass for months for selling EVA Boosters. I want to show them up by offering higher quality armor, but it still has to be entry-level or else they'll take it as a challenge.\nI've seen some Improved Light Armors... around. Think you can get me three of them? I'll pay 15,000 credits per suit.
I have a few spare suits with me

I've got a regular customer who takes his ship out camping on different worlds. He's got that whole 'I'm gonna camp on every world in the galaxy' goal that you see in a lot of the younger idiots. The problem is that he's gonna get himself killed camping on some of the planets in just this system alone.@p9 So I need to pitch him something more sturdy than a Survival Tent that can withstand harsh climates and airless moons while being compact enough to haul around. I've heard about those Prefab Housing Modules that P3 makes that'll do the job. I just need a couple of them to pitch to him.@p9 If you can get me Two Prefab Housing Modules from P3 Productions, I can surely sell them to him, or at least dissuade him from his insane mission before he gets himself killed. I'll pay you 100,000 credits for the both of them if you can get them.
<color=#ffffff>Ah yes, this is exactly what I was after!</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I'll get them prepped for sale immediately. Thanks for your help.</color>
<color=#ffffff>I'm afraid you've put yourself out of a job.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>That was the only thing I needed help with and you're done.</color>
Welcome to Ok'Y Medical Care!\nI am doctor Su'oul and I am licensed to offer you medicines and injectors compatible with Terran physiology.\nHow may I help you today?
I've heard that there are Polaris Labs out there that handle all sorts of illegal research. I'd sure like to get a job in a place like that...\nI bet the pay is amazing.

Ok'y Medical is more widespread and primarily handle Vaccines, Injectors and Ointments since that's what most people need.\nAndromedical deals in Commercial medical supplies, medkits and pills.\nWe both cover different parts of the market, but that doesn't stop head office from competing with them.

I'm sure I don't need to warn you that lasers cause Dermal Burns. They're extremely painful and the worse it is, the more likely it is to get infected.\nPlasma on the other hand is radioactive and will cause Radiation Burns. Get those treated immediately before the damage becomes permanent.
Well, I don't need any help with preparing the medicines or behind the counter.\nI am waiting on a few late shipments, if you're interested in making a few credits.

One of the medical labs that supply Ok'y recently had a power failure that killed off their refrigeration and ruined half of their supplies. That included a shipment of Brafus Fungi intended for Ok'y.@p9 If you can, i'd like you to track down an alternative source of Brafus Fungi for me. I'll pay double, since it's rather urgently needed in several medications. I only need a small shipment of 50 Brafus Fungi to tide me over until my supplier can cultivate more.
I've brought you a shipment of Brafus Fungi

As you can see, Ok'y Medical is a distributor of medical treatments. Unfortunately, Pirates struck one of our cargo freighters and made off with a shipment of prescription painkillers. Extremely valuable.@p9 No, I don't want you to track down the pirates and get them back. Though it would be nice if you did. What I need is 25 boxes of Narcotics. You can get them from any Medical Supplier, but I need them urgently.
I've brought you a replacement for those Painkillers

We use Xenon as an anesthetic in Ok'y Medical's clinic. It's an effective treatment that works on Zirax, Tal'on, Praven, and even you Terrans. It is however, in short supply all across the galaxy and in even shorter supply in our own clinic.@p9 What I need from you is to track down a shipment of Xenon to replace our depleted reserves. Around 50 Tanks of Xenon should do.
I've found you some tanks of Xenon
You've saved a lot of lives with your help, my friend.\nPlease, take this prototype Regeneration Kit as thanks in addition to your payment.

<color=#ffffff>I don't wish to impose on you further.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>You've already done enough, and saved me from a headache would've been inevitable if i'd had to solve the problem myself.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>So thank you.</color>

One of the medical labs that supply Ok'y recently had a power failure that killed off their refrigeration and ruined half of their supplies. That included a shipment of Varon Root intended for Ok'y.@p9 If you can, i'd like you to track down an alternative source of Varon Root for me. I'll pay double, since it's rather urgently needed in several medications. I only need a small shipment of 75 Varon Root to tide me over until my supplier can cultivate more.
I've brought you a shipment of Varon Root

We use ingredients here to produce prescription medications for many of our regular customers here. Nothing exotic, just regular household diseases, colds, gout, that sort of thing.@p9\nUnfortunately, during a medical emergency here in the store, our machines used for combining the ingredients was knocked over by station staff assisting.\nI need 5 Scientific Equipment to replace the parts that were broken.
I've brought you that equipment you wanted

Welcome to AndroMedical Galactic!\nThe leading producers of medical supplies in the galaxy! All of our staff are trained medical professionals, ready to help with day-to-day afflictions and more serious surgery.\nHow may I help you today?

Although not official, it's known that Totally Overpowered's Beer has enough alcohol in it to disinfect Infected Wounds.\nThey don't put that on the bottle of course. We get drunks in here every day who misjudged how much alcohol is in their beer.

Do you have any Ablative Spray? It's good if you're expecting to be exposed to lasers or acid since it provides a protective barrier over the skin that prevents contact burns.\nIt doesn't treat the condition and has no effect on Radiation Burns though.

I'm sure you already know, but minor cuts and scratches don't appear on your suit's display. You'll only receive an 'Open Wound' warning if it's an injury to an artery beyond what your suit is capable of sealing.\nIf you don't treat it quickly, you'll lose too much blood and pass out. Then you'll be in real trouble.
Well, I don't need any help with preparing the medicines or behind the counter.\nI am waiting on a few late shipments, if you're interested in making a few credits.

We have an indoor plantation on a nearby desert world that supplies us with Spike Lemons which we use in mass-producing antitoxic medication. A recent sandstorm has buried the greenhouses and cut off their supply of solar power. They're still clearing away the sand from the panels, but have lost their entire crop.@p9 In the meantime, I need a new supply but there are no other suppliers anywhere nearby. The only people I know of that can even grow Spike Lemons are the Tal'on. If you can get them to part with 100 Alien Spike Lemons, i'll pay you double what you paid for them.

As you can see, AndroMedical is a distributor of medical treatments. Unfortunately, Pirates struck one of our cargo freighters and made off with a shipment of prescription painkillers. Extremely valuable.@p9 No, I don't want you to track down the pirates and get them back. Though it would be nice if you did. What I need is 25 boxes of Narcotics. You can get them from any Medical Supplier, but I need them urgently.
I've brought you a replacement for those Painkillers

There's a new brand of synthetic drug on the market from somewhere in pirate space that may have beneficial properties with further research.@p9 I'd really like to get my hands on some of those vials, find out what's in them and see if Andromedical can benefit from it somehow. But so far no one sells the stuff through regular channels. If you can bring me... 10 Zyme Vials, i'll pay 50,000 credits for the lot.
I've managed to find you those bug sprays.

There's a patient that's currently afflicted with an Alien Parasite that we can't remove and doesn't respond to any anti-parasitic treatment we know. This is a rather precarious situation since we know the parasite has been discovered, but all information regarding treatments has been sealed.@p9 The patient in question has offered a 100,000 credit reward for anyone that can provide any information on treating the parasite. I believe if you can 'obtain' Biological Data from a Science Satellite, we can both come out on top.@p9 We'll split the reward 80:20, since I still need to develop a treatment for the condition or else neither of us get paid. 80,000 credits is still a good deal for you, isn't it?
I've got my hands on that Biological Data
You've saved a lot of lives with your help, my friend.\nPlease, take this new Ablative Spray as thanks in addition to your payment.
<color=#ffffff>You've helped me enough, sir.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I couldn't ask you to do any more than you've already done.</color>

As you can see, AndroMedical is a distributor of medical treatments. Unfortunately, Pirates struck one of our cargo freighters and made off with a shipment of prescription painkillers. Extremely valuable.@p9 No, I don't want you to track down the pirates and get them back. Though it would be nice if you did. What I need is 50 boxes of Narcotics. You can get them from any Medical Supplier, but I need them urgently.@p9 I'm aware that 50 boxes is quite a bulky load to carry yourself, so I recommend getting yourself a couple of Transportation Boosters for your armor. I'll compensate you with an extra 15,000 credits for the trouble.
I've brought you a replacement for those Painkillers
Welcome to InterWeapon Armaments!\nWe supply industrial, commercial, private and even military with only the best quality weapons, mods and ammunition.\nWhat are you looking for today, buddy?

I've heard the old Elite Combat Pistols never caught on with the Zirax Captains they were made for. They've recently recalled them all and outfitted them as Heavy Pistols.\nI guess the Starhawk really impressed them. They want the new Elite Combat Pistols to be just like them.

Be careful handling a minigun. They're a good all-rounder with devastating firepower and a big magazine, but they have the worst accuracy at long range.\nThose things are really heavy and trying to fire them and keep them steady is a nightmare.
<color=#ffffff>I don't need any help with the store.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I have a special order I need filled that i'm having trouble with if you're interested.</color>

Alright, if you insist. You've seen those guns the Zirax Commanders were issued? The Heavy Pistols that they copied from those new aliens to the galaxy.@p9 Seems those Starhawks are really popular among the Xenu's commanders. Whoever those 'U-C-H-ers' are they apparently really know how to make a pistol.@w4 I want one.@p9 If they're good enough to impress the Zirax, then they're something I can sell. I just need to know how they're made. If you can bring me just one Starhawk Heavy Pistol, i'll pay you 50,000 credits for it.

Alright... I've heard rumors of some weapons being tested on a moon nearby, but I have no idea who's doing it or which moon. It could even be a different moon each time. The regular zirax patrols won't tell me anything and I need to know whether or not it's one of InterWeap's weapons being used.@p9 I need to avoid any tricky legal situations if it is. So I need you to go and hack one of those Security Satellites around the sun and bring me back their Weapons Signatures Report. Even if it's not one of ours, I can at least use the data to reconstruct the kind of weapon it is. I'll wire 150,000 credits into your account for the trouble, of course.

You're probably familiar with Heavy Turrets, right? Well, InterWeapon's been trying to get it's hands on the parts that the Zirax use on their turrets to see if we can reproduce them. We've managed to produce smaller upgrade kits, but nothing we can sell to freighters and warships.@p9 Needless to say, we need one of their Large Upgrade Kits and there's an open contract for a large upgrade kit for 150,000 Credits to any store manager that can get one. If you can bring me one, we can split the reward 90,000 for you and 60k for me. Sound good?
Deal. Wire the money into my account.

I have a repair order for a set of Particle Beam Rifles. These things are top of the line. Brand spankin' new, right out of the lab and i'm not even qualified to touch these things, letalone work on them. The coils overheat too fast, causing the heatsink to melt unevenly and eject prematurely.@p9 The only fix I can think of would require... Heat Exchangers, but I don't have that kind of thing on hand. They're usually used on drilling rigs and fusion reactors, not weapons. If you can track down 35 of them for these seven rifles, i'll pay you 95,000 credits.

I need to send one of my work crew out to repair the weapons system on a Skenya-Class Destroyer, but they didn't tell me that the damn thing is mounting a Lohengrin Positron Cannon. He's not qualified to work on it and I certainly don't have a clue to fix one of those things.@p9 What I need you to do is go behind Polaris' back and get your hands on their Maintenance Data. It shouldn't be too hard. You've seen those satellites they've got in orbit around the sun? They relay communication data between systems and keep backups of the things they send. That includes maintenance and technical data.@p9 If you can hack into one of those Common Satellites, you should be able to download the backups they keep of everything they've sent. That includes Maintenance Reports on the weapons system. I'll pay you 60,000 credits for that Data.
I've got my hands on those Maintenance Reports
Thanks for all your help! That's a load off my back.\nI've given you your payment, and I found these Plasma Blast Charges in storage that you can have as well.

I don't have any more work for you. You might want to try one of the other merchants.\nIf you've got spare time you might want to check out one of InterWeapon's Factories. They've always got a bunch of loose jobs and need supplies.

This should be standard knowledge for you military types. Rocket Launchers are the best handheld weapon for taking down Drones and Sentry Guns. Ain't nothing better for taking down an Assault Mech or a Drone Gunship than a well-placed rocket or two. Plasma's better for taking down groups of lightly-armored troops.
Welcome to SERVANT CORP OUTFITTERS!\nWhere we sell only the latest in suit enhancements and attachments. So if you need anything, I am your servant.

The typical humanoid armors we sell come in Light, Medium and Heavy variants.\nThere are also improved, reinforced and advanced versions of them. We stock some of them, but the Advanced Heavy Armor is custom-made for paramilitary groups and so not available for sale... ever.

Shield Capacitors increase the strength of your ship's shield at the cost of recharge speed, while Shield Chargers increase the recharge speed of your ship's shield at the cost of Shield Strength.\nFinding the right balance is what's key to a good ship.@w5\nSorry about the big lecture, but you did ask for something interesting.

Each type of armor is best for different situations. Light Armor is comfortable, easy to move around in and cheap. It's good for everyday use, but isn't the best for heavy combat.@w2 Meanwhile, Heavy Armor's protection is second to none but it's slow, so it's a trade-off.@p9 Medium Armor is a good all-rounders. Better protection than Light Armor, more mobile than Heavy Armor. But not really the best at anything.
<color=#ffffff>I don't need any help with the store.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I have a special order I need filled that i'm having trouble with if you're interested.</color>

I have a service order to repair an older model of Heavy Armor for a customer that has sentimental value. The parts for this model of armor haven't been produced in 10 years and the ones that were in circulation have either been bought up or scrapped. Which means i'll need to improvise...@p9 The problem with this particular suit is that the Radiation Shielding and Thermal Insulation is completely degraded and there's nothing on the market that can replace it. I'm sure I can make something work using 150 Graphite and 75 Aluminium Foil though. You bring me those and i'll pay you 50,000 credits.

I have a service order to repair a suit of X-01 Advanced Heavy Armor for a valuable customer. We don't typically handle the repairs on this kind of armor at a shop like this. This is the kind of thing you send to our factory to be refit, so i'm stuck on this one.@p9 There's a hole through the suit's oxygen filter and the radiation shielding on the left arm and shoulder has been completely melted.
