It needs a replacement, but I don't have any of the parts for this. What I need you to find for me is 10 Air Filters and 10 Radiation Shielding (not boosters). You bring me those parts and i'll pay you 70,000 credits on the spot.

I have a service order to repair a suit of X-01 Advanced Heavy Armor for a valuable customer. We don't typically handle the repairs on this kind of armor at a shop like this. This is the kind of thing you send to our factory to be refit, so i'm stuck on this one.@p9 The suit needs a new jetpack but none of the components in the standard armors are compatible with the armor. I need something stronger, and I think I know what. I need 4 Thruster Components, 10 Power Coils and 10 Advanced Capacitors. For those, i'll wire 100,000 credits to your account on the spot.
Deal. Wire the money into my account.

We get extreme sports types in here looking for the latest in high performance suits and boosters and wanting to do something stupid with them. I probably shouldn't talk bad about them since they make up half our profits...@p9 Anyway, this one guy wants to jump from orbit onto a certain ocean planet with some seriously bad weather. He'll end up dead if the weather's bad, so I need you to get Atmospheric Data for the planet.@p9 You can probably get it from an Exploration Satellite around one of the nearby stars. You'll have to hack it yourself, but the guys a big spender and will fork out 90,000 credits if you do this for him.

We've had a problem recently with hackers gaining access to people's suits and shutting down environmental controls. We haven't had a serious incident, but all it takes is someone to turn off radiation protection or open a visor and we'll have full-blown panic over our products.@p9 We know how they're getting in and we've put safety measures in place, but what we need is Anti-Hacking Software of our own. Something that'll boot them from the system automatically.@p9 Now, i've heard of some nasty hacking software used for brute-forcing security systems. Among these disposable software drives is one Hacking Software called 'Fortify' that the techs might be able to reverse-engineer into something we can install in every suit.@p9 I'm not sure where you'd even find something like that, and i'm sure they're very illegal, but this is for a good cause. If you can find me one, you'll save a lot of lives. And of course, i'll pay you 30,000 credits for it.
I managed to track down one of those Hacking Softwares for you

Thanks for all your help! That's a load off my mind.\nIn addition to your payment, please take these 5.56mm Rounds that we use for ballistic testing our products.\nIt's not much, but it's what the head office'll let me give you.
<color=#ffffff>You've done all the work I had, and i'm very thankful for it too.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Put those 5.8mm Rounds I gave you to good use will you?</color>
Welcome to Grocer's Grove!\nWe supply only the freshest produce! We're responsible for provisioning colonies, starships and everyday consumers like you!\nSo how many I assist you today?

One of major consumers are the Station Quartermasters you can find on many trade stations and habitats.\nThey always need Fruit, Vegetables and Meat and pay top credit for it. They don't buy a lot each time, but they're regulars.\nYou can make a real killing selling surplus crops to the outlying stations.

If you can find a Polaris or Trade Federation Waste Processing Plant you can get Fertilizer from them for cheaper than Grimgar's Garden.\nThey have Nitrogen as well, but it's so ridiculously overpriced that there's no profit from reselling it.
Food and Medicine always sell well, since they're constantly in demand everywhere. Not like mechanical components and machines that'll run for years before needing to be replaced.
Need work?\nWell... we probably have a job in the greenhouses, but not here.\nActually I think I might have something...

We've had problems with thieves breaking into our warehouses lately and stealing our best produce. We need some better security, but station services won't help us out.@p8\nCan you bring me 5 Sensor and Signal Blocks, 10 Spotlights and 2 Laser Upgrade Kits?\nI'll pay you 25,000 credits for your help. I'm not getting any help from anyone else around here, that's for sure!
I've brought you those parts you wanted

I'm sure you may have noticed, but we don't stock any mushrooms at Grocer's Grove. We've tried several times to get a reliable supplier out here, but no one can transport mushrooms without them going bad or dying.@p9\nI'm hoping you can find a good supply of nice, big, brown mushrooms for us to sell. They're vital for the production of some foods that many of our customers want but can't make themselves without the missing ingredients.\nWhat we need is a good supply of 500 mushrooms. I'll even pay 60 credits per mushroom.
I have a big box of mushrooms with me

I'm trying to branch out into some of the more exotic plants and crops and I want to see what kind of a market I have to work with. But without any examples for people to try, it's proving hard to get started. I've heard that the Opuntia Cactus Fruit is used as a medical ingredient, but i've also heard that the fruit is delicious, so it's got me wondering if I can sell it.@p9 If you can bring me... 90 Opuntia Cactus Fruit, i'll pay you 30,000 credits for the lot. I heard the Tal'on are fairly adept at harvesting the plant. You could start by asking them.
I've found you some Opuntia Cactus Fruit
Ah yes, this is exactly what I was after!\nYou have no idea how much you've helped me. Please, take these vegetables as a bonus.\nThey're too ugly to sell, but I can guarantee the quality!
<color=#ffffff>Oh no, i'm afraid I have no more jobs for you to do.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thanks again for your help!</color>
Welcome to Grimgar's Garden!\nWe're currently having a sale on seedlings, saplings, hydroponics units and everything for your very own garden! Get yours today!\nSo what can I get you today?

Be careful if you're growing Pentaxid Crystals!\nThey're not like regular plants, though they DO need a good supply of nutrients to form strong fusionable material, they also draw power from your ship's grid to accelerate their growth.\nMore than that, they're highly radioactive and will harm any regular plants around them.

Although Polaris and the Trade Federation both have greenhouses for growing and selling unique plants and crops for medicinal use, you should never overlook the Tal'on.\nThere are a lot of weird and wonderful plants that can't be grown, in which case it's up to the Tal'on to hunt them in the wild.

The scars left behind by The Legacy from the War of Silence are as fresh today as they were centuries ago.\nIrradiated places left where Infectors slammed into a planet's surface and corrupted everything they touched...@p9\nEven today, the plantlife in those places is warped beyond all recognition. Even with the controlling mind gone, they continue to spit out radioactive detritus that turns into storms of radioactive fallout.
Need work?\nWell... we probably have a job in the greenhouses, but not here.\nActually I think I might have something...

A number of the seedlings in the store aren't looking so good. I won't be able to sell them if they get any worse, but the problem seems to be poor soil quality. Can you fetch me 50 Bottles of Nitrogen? It should be enough to solve the problem. I'll pay you 20,000 credits for your help.

A number of the seedlings in the store aren't looking so good. I won't be able to sell them if they get any worse, but the problem seems to be poor soil quality. Can you fetch me 600 Sulfur? It should be enough to solve the problem. I'll pay you 35,000 credits for your help.

Some of our home greenhouses that supply us with fresh saplings, herbs and a variety of ornamental plants have suddenly been having trouble. They suspect the groundwater is being poisoned, but they don't have proof.@p9 Do you think you can check a number of factories for any sort of Toxic Waste that they can test against the water they're drawing up from below ground? If you can find a source of Toxic Waste. Preferrably 20 barrels of the stuff, they can see if there's a match.
I've brought you some Toxic Waste I found
You've really helped me out here!\nSo in addition to your payment for the job, please take this Fertilizer. I hope you'll put it to good use!
<color=#ffffff>Oh no, i'm afraid I have no more jobs for you to do.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thanks again for your help!</color>
Welcome to Market Cafe Bar and Grill!\nWe have everything from burgers to salads, even some unique in-store dishes that you can't get anywhere else!\nSo what can I get you today?

Don't just ignore what's on our menu! We've got a selection of high-quality foods not seen anywhere else! Each one has a unique status effect that could mean the difference between life and death!\nThere are other foods and drinks out there that have special abilities too.

High quality foods that are complex and difficult to make provide better nutrition and prolonged beneficial effects over poor quality foods.\nCheeseburgers, Pizza, Fruit Pie and Cake are all High-Quality Foods.

If you find a merchant offering you some weird plants or food you've never seen, it's worth buying some in case it's needed somewhere else or has some hidden health benefits.@p9\nI know that no one ever eats Varon Root, Spiky Mushrooms or Brafus Fungi, but have you seen what they do? Some of them are like instant-use medkits! They're amazing!

I'm afraid all positions in-house have been taken and we're accepting no employees at this time.\nI do have one small job I was going to get a freelancer to do, but I suppose I can give it to you instead.

We're running low on salt because no one has been shipping any to this station and it's absolutely vital for all our cooking!\nI'm offering better than the normal market prices for 660 salt.\nI'm ordering in excess because I don't want to be caught with my pants down next time our shipments don't come through.

We have a number of 'fine diners' that are always asking for rare ingredients and most of the time I have no idea where to get anything they ask for. If I don't cater to them, they'll ruin my shop's reputation!@p9 The latest one of their demands is slow-roasted Blue Pepper! Where would you even find a Blue Pepper? And the recipe calls for THREE of them! If by some miracle you can find them, i'll pay 13,000 credits each!
I managed to track down three Blue Peppers

I have a party of 'influencers' reserved for next week. I would've refused them if i'd known when they made the reservation since they've made some of the dumbest requests i've ever heard of! Gods of Empyrion, I hope they all die in a shuttle crash!@p9 Anyway, they're going to be a pain my ass unless I can get rid of them without issue, but they've made some ridiculous demands. Ahax Fruit Ice Cream for dessert? Where do you even GET ahax fruit?@p9 I thought they'd come from Ahax Plants, but no. It's a different Ahax plant. What I want from you is to track down where one can find the real Ahax Fruit and bring me hmmm... 30 of them. I'll pay you 15,000 credits for them if you can find them.
I've found some Ahax Fruit for you
You have no idea how much this helps! Trust me. You have no idea how bad the headache i've gotten from this problem's been.\nHere's take this Ziraxian Salad, on the house. You've earned it.
<color=#ffffff>Nope, you've taken care of the only job I needed your help with.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thanks again for that!</color>

Welcome to M.A Corp Industrial Supply.\nWe're a subsidiary of Polaris Megacorp, but don't hold that against us! We currently have deals on mining equipment and refined metals.. How may I assist you today?

We supply industrial mining rigs all across the galaxy.\nUnfortunately, Industrial Mining Equipment can't be sold over the counter. We can't stock it since it's just too big.@p9\nIt's one of those things you have to get from one of the manufacturers like P3: Polaris Planetside Production or Non-Linear Productions. They're always in demand since drills wear out fast.

There are a variety of odd resources out there that all have good markets in different places. But they're not the kind of thing you can find in ore deposits like Iron and Copper. I'm talking about commodity resources like Graphite, Sulfur and Salt.@p9 Graphite can be found in asteroids and some darker surface rocks on planets. Sulfur can be mined out of most volcanic rocks. Salt can be mined out of cliffs and beaches around oceans, as well as the ocean floor.

Salt is a big seller among food and chemical companies. Graphite is in high demand at electrical and thermal factories. Sulfur is used by pharmaceutical, agricultural and ammunition producers and factories.@p9 In fact, I believe InterWeapon Manufacturing has a standing offer to trade Sulfur for Nitrocellulose at a very good ratio. You might want to check that out...
<color=#ffffff>I'm afraid that we're not hiring any new employees at this time.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>If you're interested in a freelance job contract, I do have something that needs doing.</color>

M.A Corp operates it's own set of asteroid mining crafts but recently they've been striking out on asteroid surveys. Initially we thought it was bad luck, until we sent a mining craft to an already-surveyed site and the asteroids there were gone. Not mined out, gone. As though they'd been moved.@p9 This doesn't seem like the kind of thing that pirates would do, which means we have a third-party competition stealing asteroids instead of mining them, but we need proof that they're violating business practice before we can do anything.@p9 What I need you to do is find one of the common communication satellites in orbit around the sun and hack it's logs and bring the Communication Data back to me. Polaris has authorized me to pay you 64,000 credits for the data.

M.A Corp has recently lost track of one of it's mining crafts in a nearby system. They haven't reported in, but are continuing to receive their paychecks from Polaris.@p9 I've been tasked with finding out whether they're still working, gone rogue, or have been taken by pirates. The only way to find out whether or not they're working is to check their personal work shift logs recorded on all Polaris Ships.@p9 What I need you to do is find one of the common communication satellites in orbit around the sun and hack it's logs and bring the Work Shift Data back to me. Polaris has authorized me to pay you 60,000 credits for the data.

As you may know, M.A Corp is a subsidiary of Polaris Megacorp. Despite breaking away from the Trade Guild, both M.A Corp and Polaris are still subject to the Galactic Index of the Trade Guild. A bad year could spell disaster for us in the Index.@p9 That's why we need to get ahead of the competition and get our hands on the economic data before it makes it's way to The Prologue and is entered into the Index and find out our standing and maneuver ahead of potential disaster.@p9 What I need you to do is find one of the common communication satellites in orbit around the sun and hack it's logs and bring the Economic Data back to me. Polaris has authorized me to pay you 80,000 credits for the data.

We have dozens of company-owned mining rigs and facilities across the galaxy, but we're having trouble with a few of our newest mining rigs. It seems that the planets in this system formed with a layer of extremely dense granite not far below the surface and it's stopping the drills.@p9 What I need you to do is find one of the Exploration Satellites in orbit around the sun and hack it's system and bring the Geological Data back to me. Polaris has authorized me to pay you 100,000 credits for the data.

We have dozens of company-owned mining rigs and facilities across the galaxy, but we're having trouble with a few of our newest mining rigs. Most of these planets have been surveyed by independent surveyors, but these individuals refuse to sell the results of their exploits.@p9 They're not miners themselves. They sell their surveys to the highest bidder, but they're refusing all overtures from our parent company, Polaris Megacorp. We believe they're instead selling the rights to pirate companies.@p9 What I need you to do is find one of the Exploration Satellites in orbit around the sun and hack it's system and bring the Planetary Resource Data back to me. Polaris has authorized me to wire you 150,000 credits directly into your account for the data.

On behalf of Polaris Megacorp, and M.A Corp I offer you our heartfelt thanks for going above and beyond what many other contractors are willing to do for our company.\nAs such, I have added a 400 Reputation bonus with your Polaris Megacorp account.
I'm afraid M.A Corp is not accepting any new employees at this time and we have no more freelance contract jobs available.\nYou may want to try P3: Polaris Planetside Production.

Welcome honorable customer to the Gold Standard! Would you like to see our showroom or our catalogue? We have many great deals here, yes? If you've ordered one of the limited edition Boyband posters, I'm afraid we're no longer licensed to sell them. Now how may I assist you?

Our luxury goods are in high demand in many settlements and housing facilities. There's not much need for luxury on a dig site or a military base.\nIt's all about knowing where your products are wanted.
<color=#ffffff>Posters are a great way to cover an empty wall in an emptier room. It makes a good point of interest if you can't come up with anything to fill a room or blank space with.</color>

Not many people know this but many of those Decorative Consoles and Indoor Plants can be placed on small vessels and hover vehicles.\nI don't know why it hasn't caught on, considering it's a good way to spruce up their drab interiors.

I'm afraid all positions in-house have been taken and we're accepting no employees at this time.\nI do have one small job I was going to get a freelancer to do, but I suppose I can give it to you instead.

We have a constant demand of raw materials of high quality. Both here and at our factories. We can never get enough leather and it's driving head office up the wall when we have to explain that there's more demand than supply.@p9 What we need right now is a shipment of high-quality leather. None of that synthetic crap that Constructors make out of carbon composite. Just 50 bolts of supple, well-treated, high-quality Leather. I'll pay 25,000 credits for just one shipment.
I've brought you a shipment of leather

We at Gold Standard have been using gold in many of our highest quality products. This may have been a mistake as gold is soft and prone to deformation. We're thinking about using platinum in some of our goods that see wear and tear.@p9 We've been having trouble procuring enough platinum to make more than a cursory attempt at the gold standard refridgerators, which need platinum for the hinges. Bring me 250 Platinum Ingots and you will be paid accordingly.

We have a very exclusive clientele here at Gold Standard. One of our patrons has been very interested in getting his hands on some authetic ancient relics to put on display at his beach house.@p9 It's been rather difficult to acquire the necessary relics without them being seized by Ghy'st Security Forces. What I need from you is to find me 10 Ancient Relics and you'll be paid accordingly. Not in cash.
I've managed to dig up some ancient relics.
Yes, well. Your efforts are appreciated.\nPlease take your payment and a few bottles of our signature Gold Standard Whiskey.
<color=#ffffff>I'm afraid all positions in-house have been taken and we're accepting no employees at this time.</color>

This is Gold Standard's warehouse and workshop.\nWe don't typically do sales here except in bulk to furnish art shows and high class venues. Normally, you'd go through one of the Gold Standard Showrooms.\nI'll try my best, but it's not really my job.

This is Gold Standard's warehouse and workshop.\nWe don't typically do sales here except in bulk to furnish art shows and high class venues. Normally, you'd go through one of the Gold Standard Showrooms.\nUnfortunately, everyone's quit so I can't even open up.

<color=#ffffff>I've managed to bring in one of the guys, so we can open up the warehouse but we're still short on people and even shorter on materials and supplies.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>If you're serious about helping me out, I can't exactly turn you down.</color>

Thanks for all your help... It's not much but we keep an emergency fund for this kind of thing, so please accept this payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits and i'll forward a request for {RepCounter} Reputation for your account with Polaris.@p9 This is all Gold Standard's fault. So i'm throwing in some free merchandise, so they can foot some of the bill for once. Thanks again!

We've got only a couple of people actively working after most of them quit over the conditions. I can't get them back unless we can improve the conditions in the workshop and the warehouse.@p9 What I need from you is to get: x40 Filters x30 Heat Exchangers To make the temperatures and air quality bearable for the staff (and me) in here.

We've got only a couple of people actively working after most of them quit over the conditions. We have a few of our craftsment back in the workshop, but the ones who quit took most of the materials with them.@p9 We're still missing: x50 Leather x200 Gold Coins that are used in a dozen of Gold Standard's signature furniture pieces.

When the floor manager skipped town after everyone quit he locked all the warehouse's computers so we can't contact head office or access the warehouse's funds to pay for anything.@p9 I need you to find me some less than legal software that I can use to crack the security on his computer. x1 Hacking Software: Overclock Should do the job. I'll be able to pay you for helping me out and pay to get the conditions improved and the crew rehired.

When the conditions in the workshop became intolerable, a few of the staff sabotaged several of the machines. Even if we get the place fully staffed again, we can't produce anything without those machines up and running again.@p9 I'm just a warehouse worker, i'm not cut out for a management job. But I need the job, so I have to step up and get everything sorted out and running. I'm not sure where you can get them from, but what I do know we need is:@p9 x5 Spare Parts x5 Power Coils x30 Motors x250 Mechanical Components I'll use the company funds to pay you for everything you get me.

When the conditions in the workshop became intolerable, most of the staff eventually quit and took the food in the fridges with them. Those fridges were meant to supply all the workers at the warehouse and workshop and we it them back.@p9 I'll reimburse you double for it, but can you get me: x100 Coffee x100 Pumpkin Cookies x100 Sandwiches To keep us going and hopefully entice those still on the fence.
<color=#0088ff>I've brought some food for the fridges</color>

<color=#ffffff>You've really helped us out here!</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Everything is back to normal and running great! We're still short a couple of people, but they're not vital.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I'm sure we'll get a few new hires in the next couple of days.</color>

This is only a small spaceport, not much need for anything more than some maintenance equipment and replacement parts.\nDon't let the logo fool you, I was hired by the Trade Guild.\nSo what can I do ya for?

<color=#ffffff>This is only a small spaceport, not much need for anything more than some maintenance equipment and replacement parts.</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>After some idiot did a rough landing, we've had to shut down while we repair the platform and restock the supplies.</color>

<color=#ffffff>Okay, the Spaceport's open for business again.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I still need to replace the parts and supplies that were used, so I still need some help here if you're willing.</color>

This'll help get the platform back in shape.\nHere's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits for the materials and manpower. I've also credited your account with the head office with {RepCounter} Reputation.\nThanks for your help on this, pal.

I need to repair the platform itself. That's not gonna be cheap or easy, since not only do I need a strong material for resurfacing the platform, and I need to repair the lifter that was hammered into the ground.@p9 I should be able to do it with: x250 Sathium Plates x3 Spare Parts I know Hostile Apparatus sells the parts, P3 too. Though it's polaris.

In order to get that guy out of here, I had to use all my spare Large Plasma Thrusters to get him spaceworthy.\nI need replacements... I think 5 Large Plasma Thrusters (SV) will do it.\nThink you can resupply me?

When that guy crash landed onto the pad, he'd taken some serious damage to put him down here. The lifter on the pad took the brunt of the landing and was badly damaged. In order to reach the underside of the ship, I had to use the robotic arms to tilt the ship.@p9 Those arms weren't designed to lift an entire ship, so they're completely ruined and I need a complete replacement set. I need 4 Robotics that you can get from Hostile Apparatus Robotics. Don't worry about the cost, i'll pay you back and bill the crap out of that lunatic.

When that guy crash landed onto the pad, he'd taken some serious damage to put him down here. He wasn't going anywhere without a shield generator, so I fitted him with one I had in storage. Turns out that was the last one I had.@p9 I have no idea where the other one I had was, but now i'm short an emergency shield generator. Think you can get me a Standard Shield Generator (SV) to replace the emergency-use one? I'll pay 20,000 credits for the help.
I've got a shield generator for you

When that guy crash landed onto the pad, he'd taken some serious damage to put him down here. Seems he got shot down by pirates and they were hanging around for him to leave.\nHe ordered some anti-shield weaponry for his ship and I fitted it.@p9\nBut now i'm down a Pair of Medium Laser Cannons (SV) and can't get any more for at least six months. Think you can help me out with restocking?

<color=#ffffff>Everything's back in ship-shape!</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Pad's clean and ready for regular customers and the stores have all been restocked, so I don't need anything more.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thanks for your help!</color>

<color=#ffffff>Watch your step there, buddy.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>You're gonna get squashed or toasted by a ship if you're not careful. Are you here to load or unload cargo or for something else?</color>\n<color=#66ccff>Or does your ship need repairs or fuel?</color>

<color=#ffffff>You can't use this bay. We're not handling any services until we clean up the mess here.</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>A freighter cracked one of our fuel tanks open and spilled starship fuel all over the pad, so it's all hands on deck to get the mess cleaned up.</color>

Thanks for your help with this mess.\nHere's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits for the materials and manpower.\nI'll include a shipment of fuel as thanks too and pass along a recommendation to the main office.

<color=#ffffff>Okay, the Spaceport's open for business again.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I still need to replace the parts and supplies that were used, so I still need some help here if you're willing.</color>

We've got fuel on the ground and we need something that can soak it up that's not too expensive. A few of the hands suggested dumping Boron on it, but we don't have a supply of it.@p9\nSalt should do the same job, minus the neutron absorption. So I need you to get me 750 Salt that I can use to contain the fuel spill.

That assclown who smashed the fuel tank barrelled out of here at top speed and left the system. I'm going to make sure he gets billed for all the damages, but the name he gave on the station registry was fake.@p9\nI trust you know how to hack a satellite?\nI want you to go find a Security Satellite and pull the logs from it until you find a Warp Signatures Report and bring it back to me. I'll pay you 80,000 credits for it and tack the payment on top of his debt!

I've got freighter in orbit that wants down for a refit. We're still cleaning up this mess, which should be done by the time he needs to come down. But he's requesting an upgrade to his guns to deal with pirates.@p9 We don't stock the materials for fitting heavy weapons, so if you can manage it, I need you to bring me a Large Upgrade Kit so I can refit his ventral gun. I'll pay above market price for it.
I've got that ugprade kit you wanted

The fuel that leaked out when that freighter hit the tanks flowed through the grates on the floor into the basement level where we store our replacement parts. All our spare thruster components are completely ruined...@p9 We'll need a complete replacement of not only the thruster components but the heat exchangers used to mount them in older ships. We're talking 25 of both Thruster Components and Heat Exchangers. Thank you can find both?

We didn't notice it at the time, but the bastard who smashed the tanks must've hit the work arms on his way out too. They're completely non-responsive and the nanolathes aren't firing properly.@p9 If you're up to help, I need you to source 2 Industrial Multitools and 2 Robotics to repair and replace the parts that he broke. I'll be adding the repair bill to that dude when I catch up to him. Don't worry about the cost, you'll be compensated.

<color=#ffffff>Everything's back in ship-shape!</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Pad's clean and ready for regular customers and the stores have all been restocked, so I don't need anything more.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thanks for your help!</color>

Ah, A Customer! Welcome to Imperial Arms. We don't discriminate here, we provide standardized Imperial weapons at discount prices! Just as long as you know that these weapons, while very effective have a limited lifespan. Now then, what would you like?

What? Did you think that all zirax go into the military? Ha! While the military is considered the most honorable position in the Zirax Empire, many work the civilian sector or go into trade, exploration, law, even teaching!@p9 Just because you've only ever seen zirax soldiers doesn't mean that's all there is to our race. If anything, you've likely seen the worst the Empire has to offer.@p9 It saddens me greatly to see the state the empire is in... Divided by a civil war over the imperial throne. With one side backing the rightful heir: Empress Xylessia, and the other side backing her younger brother Prince Kantrix. Things will only end in tears...

Have you seen the Imperial capital on Xanthos? It's quite a sight.\nThough, it's probably fair to say that Xanthos is the capital since most of the homeworld's surface is given over to city as far as the eye can see.

Zirax Imperial weapons are some of the best available.\nThey're engineered to be disposable so they cannot be used against the empire, which makes them bad for long-term use but perfect for the cloned troops that the military use these days.@p9\nBefore the War of Silence there were no cloned troops, no clone technology, no ReLife-ing. Just... people.

While we don't discriminate when buying or selling to customers, we aren't allowed to hire any non-zirax staff, and certainly not any Terrans. You DO know your kind are listed as an Enemy Race, right? Do you know what would happen if I hired one of your kind? I'd lose my job!@p9 I do have a freelance contract available though. There's no rules against hiring Terrans for that though. It might improve your reputation with the empire if you're interested.
I found one of those Large Upgrade Kits...

I get open contracts from my military suppliers all the time, and most of the time they're small things, mostly to do with checking the status of the market or finding out if something illegal has gotten out of imperial hands.@p9 This time it's a bit odd. They want to see if anyone can provide Surveillance Data. I don't understand why, since the only way to obtain it would be to hack a military satellite.@p9 I have a feeling this has to do with the internal troubles within the empire. I don't expect you to complete it, especially since it'll be both difficult and illegal. The payment on the contract however is for 100,000 credits. So it's up to you...

I get open contracts from my military suppliers all the time, and most of the time they're small things, mostly to do with checking the status of the market or finding out if something illegal has gotten out of imperial hands.@p9 This current contract seems to be for some new hacking software that's recently hit the black market that Epsilon want to get their hands on.@p9 Seems they want both the Fortify and Overclock Hacking Software. I'm not sure where you could get it from, certainly not from around here. The contract's for an untraceable wire transfer of 120,000 credits though. So they're serious about it.
Ah, yes.\nYou've proven you Terrans aren't anywhere as hostile as the Kriel, and I hope the Empire appreciates your assistance on this.\nI'll post a commendation for 500 Reputation for you.
<color=#ffffff>You've taken my one contract job, and you're well aware we can't hire any non-zirax staff.</color>

I get open contracts from my military suppliers all the time, and most of the time they're small things, mostly to do with checking the status of the market or finding out if something illegal has gotten out of imperial hands.@p9\nRight, well the technology that's put into imperial turrets cannot be reproduced, but Rados are always worried that someone's gotten their hands on Zirax weapons technology.\nIf you find a Large Upgrade Kit anywhere, the kind that no one sells, you bring it back to me.
Hail, traveller.\nWelcome to the Brewery of the Clan! One of the few pleasures we can still share with the rest of the galaxy!\nMy wares are well known and favored among the Trade Guild and Polaris.

I give you my thanks for your gift, traveller.\nPlease take these {MoneyCounter} Credits to cover the costs. I was planning on buying some from the Polaris' Trade Station on my next visit there, though they always overcharge me, so this is preferrable.\nPlease take some of my products as a gift! At least I know they will be put to good use.

At this time, no. I'm afraid that my supply of ingredients is running low and is made worse by the lack of contact with my suppliers at Grocer's Grove. I fear something bad may have happened...@p9 There's nothing I can do about that situation, but I would ask you a favor, traveller.@w4 Are you able to help me by supplying me with some Purified Water? The well that i've used for many cycles has recently run dry and i'm in the middle of digging a new one. I need only 350 Bottles of Purified Water to fill the brewing vats. You will be paid for your help, traveller.

Not any better. I'm still needing vital ingredients for my next batch of brew and i've had no messengers from the local Traders that my supplies have arrived. Would you be willing to help me again?@p9 I need a supply of 50 Mushrooms, 100 Herbal Leaves and 100 Berries to form the base. It's a far cry from what's needed, but i'll worry about the next stage when I get to it.
I'll see what I can do

There's still been no word from my suppliers. I won't be able to complete this brew in time for next year. I suspect that this is the work of TOP Brewery in an attempt to keep my wares from reaching the galactic market.@p9 You possess a ship, do you not, traveller? Can you use it to find the nearest Grocer's Grove store and purchase from them the supplies I cannot obtain for myself. Namely, I need 150 Sugarcane in order to facilitate the brewing process. This will be the last thing I ask of you, my friend.
I'll see what I can do

Praise be to the spirits, my friend! You have done so much for me, and it's only fair that I return the favor. So here is the few {MoneyCounter} Credits I can offer you my chief is just as pleased with your generosity.@p9 We have together brought together a suitable reward that you will surely use well, since it is of less use to us. I have received gifts from the other villagers for they too receive a share of my wares. It is only fair that you receive a share in the rewards for all that you have done for me.

<color=#aaff00>Indeed it is.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>My brew is on it's way to being ready in time for sale next cycle and the plans of TOP Brewery have been thwarted.</color>\n<color=#aaff00>And it is thanks to you, traveller.</color>

Welcome to the factory floor of our brewery. I assure you we are NOT a distillery and I can't tell you how much I hate it when people call us one.\nThat's not to say that TOP doesn't have a distillery, because we do. But this isn't it. We stock their products though.

Welcome to the factory floor of our brewery. I assure you we are NOT a distillery and I can't tell you how much I hate it when people call us one. That's not to say that TOP doesn't have a distillery, because we do. But this isn't it. We stock their products though.@p9 None of it matters at this point anyway. Raiders got into the factory and took everything! Machines, Tanks, Booze, EVERYTHING! We don't even know how they got in!

<color=#ffffff>You've helped us with the most dire of our problems, but we still have dozens more that we need to fix before we can get back to full operation.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>If you're still serious about offering a hand in getting this place operational again, I won't look a gift horse in the mouth.</color>

Thanks for all your help...\nIt's not much but we keep an emergency fund for this kind of thing, so please accept this payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits and i'll forward a request for {RepCounter} Reputation for your account with Polaris.@p9\nPlease, take this 12-pack of beer as an extra thank you from the staff here. You've really pulled our butts out of the fire!

There's no sign of those bandits nearby, but no warp signatures have been detected leaving the system, which means they're still somewhere on this planet.@p9\nWhat I need from you is to find one of the old Exploration Satellites near the system's star and get me the Exploration Raw Data from the surveillance relay of the planets in this system.\nI'll put it to the tech division to find out where they went from it.

We've completely lost our stock of raw sugar that we use in the brewing process. We can't get anything done without more of it... Our suppliers won't have enough this early in the season either.@p9 I'll need you to do a shopping run to all the Grocer's Groves stores you can find and buy up all their Sugarcane. I think we should be able to get by on just 500 Sugarcane.

I can't believe that those raiders would take even our supply of Hops? What are they planning on doing with it? Opening their own brewery? I can't tell if they're well-coordinated or just plain stupid!@p9 Needless to say, until they're tracked down I need a fresh supply of Hops in order to produce any more Beer. Like everything else, it's only available seasonally so there's no way to get more except MAYBE from a medical ingredient supplier.@p9 That might be our best bet. Head on down to a medical ingredient supplier and bring back 350 Hops. You'll be paid more than double their worth, since we'll have to shut down if we can't produce any more beer.
<color=#0088ff>I managed to track down some Hops</color>

I have no idea why they did it, but they've ripped out several fermentation vats and took them with them. I'm not sure if it was because they were shiny, or because they had a legitimate reason to take them.@p9 In any case, they need to be replaced and they're not cheap. x50 Plastic Tubes x75 Aluminium Foil x100 Titanium Plates x150 Copper Ingots@p9 That's what i'll need to replace a couple of the vats enough to get us working again. Don't worry about the cost, you'll be paid above market price for the materials I need you to supply.

The computer systems we had installed into the factory have been either sabotaged or stolen. If I had to make a guess, i'd guess that these raiders were hired to disrupt our production and not out to steal from us. I'm not sure what company would want to put us out of commission though.@p9 In either case, the computer systems need replacing with: x40 Computers x40 Advanced Electronics x1 Optronics You'll be paid for your help in this trying time.
You've really helped us out here!\nWe should be back up to speed in a couple of days and it'll be like it never happened.\nThose raiders will wish it never happened when PolSec catches up to them...
You're not supposed to be in here!\nYou're not with one of our clients... Who are you? \nI'm Dell Kellum and this is MY shipyard. Now what are you here for?

Yeah, we definitely need supplies. Those clowns sent in reserves of ammunition and weapon upgrades and we don't need any of those things here. What we need are raw materials. Plates, components, and a few specific devices.@p9 Since none of those have turned up, we're operating at half speed until they do turn up. You've got a ship right? You wanna help? I'll pay.

Alright, let me sign for your delivery.\nAs agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits.@p9\nLooks like I was right to gamble on you for this. None of my people have turned up with supplies either, so there's plenty more work to go around.

First thing we need is Radiation Shielding for the ship in the dock. Lots of them, let's start out with 35 of them. It shouldn't be hard to find a factory that produces them. The real challenge will be carrying them to the docks.@p9 You're definitely going to need Transportation Boosters, since the boys aren't allowed to unload ships anymore. We had an incident a few too many times, so it's been ruled out. None of that wireless stuff.

We've got a ship in the dock that needs specialized thrusters designed for long haul burns in space. That means it needs top-tier thruster components and heat exchangers. I'd estimate 100 Thruster Components and 40 Heat Exchangers to start with.@p9 You're definitely going to need Transportation Boosters, since the boys aren't allowed to unload ships anymore. We had an incident a few too many times, so it's been ruled out. None of that wireless stuff.

You see that bird we're working on? It needs a new Fusion Reactor. We're tearing out the old generators to make room for it, but the feed lines aren't designed to take the kind of load a Reactor can output.@p9 What I need from you is to get a Reactor Core, 15 Radiation Shielding and 25 Superconductors so we can finish the job and rig up new superconducting cables to distribute the load. Find 'em, bring 'em back here to me. Get paid.@p9 You're definitely going to need Transportation Boosters, since the boys aren't allowed to unload ships anymore. We had an incident a few too many times, so it's been ruled out. None of that wireless stuff.

We used all our Air Filters on the last job we completed, now we only have thirty or so left. I need you to find a chemical or science factory that sells the things and buy up 250 of the things. You'll be compensated for the costs up to twice their market price.@p9 I need those things yesterday, so snap to it kiddo. Make sure you've got Transportation Boosters on your armor too, since you won't be able to carry them otherwise.

Got two supply problems that I need solved. The first is Helium. It's used as propellant and as fuel in the Fusion Reactor. I don't need much, just enough to run a test of the thrusters and the reactor.@p9 The second is that someone forgot to order interface tablets for all the living quarters, all the bridge computers, all the terminal interfaces and the client wants only the highest quality ones.@p9 So what I need is 100 Bottles of Helium and 400 Tablets. You'll have to empty out every electronics and science manufacturer in two systems to get enough tablets. But the pay will be good.
I've brought the helium and tablets you ordered

I've got the boys installing a new E-Warfare Suite into that ship and I need the output equipment for them to finish up and enough power coils to amplify the gain. That'll be expensive, but it's a job that pays well.@p9 What I need from you, is to go get 20 Communication Equipment and 20 Power Coils. Arriake Technology's where we usually get them. Make sure you've got Transportation Boosters when you come to deliver the parts.

The thruster's we'd initially been mounting on the ship we're building ended up burning out half their components when we started them up. They have as many Heat Exchangers as they can take, it's simply that the thruster cones can't support the heat and pressure.@p9 I've got an idea for a fix, but I need replacement parts for the thrusters first and materials to line the cones second. I've determined that I need 100 Thruster Components and 500 Graphite to solve the problem.@p9 You're definitely going to need Transportation Boosters, since the boys aren't allowed to unload ships anymore. We had an incident a few too many times, so it's been ruled out. None of that wireless stuff.

We've just finished loading the new ship here with new navigation equipment. The only problem is that the software is several years out of date and we can't get our hands on up-to-date information. No one wants to sell this stuff due to the civil war in the Zirax Empire.@p9 So what I need you to do isn't exactly 'legal'. I need you to hack a couple of Exploration and Security Satellites for the most recent Navigation and Astronomical Data to load up on the ship's computers.

Got two supply problems that I need solved. The first is that we're missing the arms for the Robotic Lifter for transferring cargo between the ship and the dock. They're pretty important to the rich ass who's paying for everything.@p9 The second is significantly worse. The ship doesn't have enough CPU after the balance adjustment in the recent update to the version. We need an aftermarket patch for the extenders to get them into working shape.@p9 So what I need is 4 Robotics, 4 Optronics, 8 Large Optronic Bridges and 4 Large Optronic Matrices. That'll be expensive, but it'll be the client who's footing the bill, so you should get every credit you spent back, with interest.
I've brought the optronics and robotic parts you needed

The ship we're building for our... 'unreasonably' rich client back there is more or less completely unfurnished at this time. We've got more shipments incoming, but it turns out it's not enough for our client. He made it clear that he wants 'more' of everything.@p9 So what I want you to do is find some Luxury Furniture to deck out the interior. You should only need 50 units or so of luxury furniture. Go see Gold Standard's showroom or factory for the stuff, i'll make sure the client is billed double whatever you spend.
I've brought the luxury goods for the client

<color=#ffffff>We at Lighthalzen Biolabs work on classified research and experiments. We don't get many... or any visitors here in this lab complex.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>That's quite the quandry, since we need samples and materials from the outside. That's the only reason i'm authorizing your entry into this lab.</color>
Here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits.\nWe've been after this for some time. We're now one step closer to our initial Quantum Engineering test.\nI hope you'll help us out with that, too.

We have a number of sample and equipment requests waiting to be handled since our regular supplier began to attract unwanted attention and so had to be reassigned to prevent suspicion.@p9\nWe've been waiting over a month for a new... procurer to be sent to us so we can get back to work on the Quantum Engineering project.\nNow then, are you ready to get to work?

We've exhausted our supplies of active legacy virus, so we need new viral samples. They are notoriously hard to acquire though, which is why they're so valuable to us.\nWe currently need 5 Viral Samples to conduct the next phase of testing.

We need research data from the other biolabs, but we work off-grid here with no connection to the outside except to SIGMA. This one will be difficult, since it involves illegally accessing a number of Scientific Satellites for the data.@p9 The data files that I need are titled Anomalous Data and Raw Scientific Data and I need both. You'll be paid for bringing these to me.

The Quantum Engineering Project will redefine the way we run everything from cities to planets. But it requires a great deal of infrastructure to get set up.\nWhat we need now is 12 Robotics and 70 Superconductors to complete the next section of the assembly. I trust that won't be too difficult for you.

We require a great deal of infrastructure to complete the current project. Most of these parts will go into the practical assembly. Once we've finished the construction, we'll be able to submit our research and initiate the second stage of research.@p9 For this one however, we need 30 Radiation Shielding to keep The Legacy's radioactivity confined, 40 Heat Exchangers to redistribute the heat away from the construction chamber, and 50 Large Optronic Bridges to form the basis of the unit housing itself. I leave their acquisition to you.

One of the important parts for the assembly part of the Quantum Engineering Project is the Particle Accelerator. we've completed most of it, but we still need to line the chamber and housing in a dense, durable material.@p9\nSo for this, I need you to supply enough Platinum to complete the current section of the accelerator.\nI would say 1000 Platinum Plates would be enough, but we may need you to bring an additional shipment.

We don't need any more supplies for the Quantum Assembly Project.\nWe're quite fortunate that things have been so easy.\nNow that the project is complete, we'll move onto the next stage of research. We won't need your help for that though.
You're not authorized to be in this lab.\nUnless you have a Science Keycard you're going to need to leave... now. Otherwise i'm calling security.

Yes, this Keycard appears to be valid.\nEven though you don't appear to be it's original owner, i'm giving you authorization because we need samples and if you can get one of these cards, then you can get what we need here in this lab.

This lab complex is the Lighthalzen Biolab, it's a special research blacksite operated by Polaris Megacorp. We're overseen by SIGMA, with knowledge limited to the highest levels of Polaris' Executives. As to what we research: We seek to better the quality of life across the galaxy.@p9 What better way to improve our understanding of advanced technology than by studying the most advanced beings in the galaxy: The Legacy. In this lab we conduct practical experiments on legacy creatures and technology.@p9 This double-edged sword, this poisoned chalice that is The Legacy is unique in that they ARE their technology. What we aim to do here is separate them from their technology, render it safe and inert for production and use.@p9 It's not the first time this has been done, either. The Perfect Cloning and Re-Life technology in use all across the galaxy today was derived from Legacy technology by the Tal'on Academy of Science some 250 cycles ago.@p9 It was fear over the implications of a functionally immortal Tal'on people and what that represented to their Zirax allies, and where that technology originated that unified the Zirax against them.@p9 Ultimately, it was all for nothing. The mind won't adhere to a cloned body if it doesn't match the mental preconceptions applied to the original. Immortality is still off the table and without the stabilizing influence of the Tal'on, the newly-established empire entered a downward spiral.@p9 That is why we operate out here, with oversight only through SIGMA. We aim to do more than the Tal'on and do it in a way that it'll be accepted by the rest of the galaxy, ignorant of the source of our developments.

We're ready to proceed with the Quantum Engineering Project. What we need now are just the quantum processors to complete the construction. We don't have the ability to construct them ourselves, which is what we'll work on once we've verified that we can in fact produce our own Quantum Extenders.@p9 Because you're the one who needs to supply these materials, we'll leave the decision as to what size of Quantum Extender we attempt to create. A larger extender will require significantly more parts than a small one.@p9 If you want to construct a Large Quantum Extender, it will require 4 Large Optronic Matrices and 24 Quantum Processors. If you want to construct a Small Quantum Extender, it will require 4 Small Optronic Matrices and 12 Quantum Processors.@p9 It's unfortunate, but with all the materials we've put into the Quantum Engineering Project, we will only be able to perform the procedure only once. Make sure you have enough space for the device in your inventory

The procedure is complete! We have succeeded! And it is thanks to your help!@p9 Since you contributed so much help in helping us here at Lighthalzen Labs confirm our theory and produce the first Legacy-derived Quantum Processing Core for organic use, it's only fair that you get to run the practical test on it's performance.@p9 We look forward to seeing how well it will perform compared to it's conventional CPU counterparts! It will surely redefine the limits of ships, cities, even whole planets once we've figured out how to mass-produce them!@p9 For now, we must focus our research on the Quantum Processors themselves. We've proven that it's possible to create safe legacy technology, now we need to devise a way of reproducing the processors used in it's construction instead of relying on salvage.@p9 You've done much! Share a drink with us before you leave! It's time to celebrate!

<color=#ffffff>We don't have a large community here, but we live comfortably enough. We also have a number of craftsmen in residence that produce a number of goods in their spare time.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Some of the youths are also looking for work if you know someone who's hiring.</color>
Thank you, for your help in this.\nHere's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits for all your help. You'll make many of the residents here very happy.

<color=#ffffff>We can always use a supply of foods and raw materials for regular maintenance. If you're looking for a paying job, I think we may have a few item requests that the freighters never bring.</color>\n<color=#66ccff>Does that sound like something you'd be interested in?</color>

As I may have mentioned, we have a number of residents that also craft goods in their spare time, either for entertainment or as an additional source of income.\nA few of them have asked me to put in a request for 50 Leather for a number of projects they're working on. But so far, no traders have brought any with them.\nCan you handle it?

We have a jeweller that lives here that's been bothering me for some time for a supply of gemstone-quality Diamonds for his personal projects.\nSo now I put the request to you for 75 Raw Diamonds. I had hoped at least one passing trader would have some, but so far none have.\nIs it something you're able to do?

A few of the residents are quite well-off and have asked me to procure a number of luxury items to improve their home life. None of the passing traders have been interested in fulfilling the requests, deeming them too high risk.@p9\nSo I bring the request to you for 40 Luxury Clothing. It shouldn't be any difficulty for one as equipped as you are.\nWill you do it?

We've plenty of parts for regular maintenance on the living quarters, but unfortunately the Solar Panels we use to suppliment our power supplies have been damaged by a week of poor conditions outside that mean we use the generators more often.@p9\nA full replacement isn't possible, so we need to repair each panel with some higher quality components. Specifically, we need 42 Solar Cells. But the company that produces them doesn't ship them to residential locations.\nSo now I ask you to collect the panels from the factory, if you can.
I've got the solar cells you wanted

Like most settlements in potentially hazardous locations, we use air filters to keep the air we breathe clean and clear. Though while we clean the filters regularly, we always need replacements once or twice a cycle.@p9\nOur usual supplier is a merchant that passes through a number of settlement frequently, but this time another station bought up his supply so we may be short this month.\nWhat I need from you is to purchase a set of 100 Filters for me, if you're able.
<color=#ffffff>I'm afraid I have no more jobs for you.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thank you for what you've done for us here in this remote location.</color>
Welcome to Pax Purgatory!\nThis is first and foremost a bar. We ain't the classiest joint in town, but we've got food n' drinks at a low price.\nSo what're you havin'?

We've got people here looking fer jobs all the time.\nIf you've got the creds, ya might consider hiring some of them to crew yer ships.\nWe 'ave a few regulars in here that I could recommend if ya do a little job for me.

You ever heard of the Kriel? We had some drunk in here whining about their current name 'Kriel Broodswarm', insisting they're an Empire like the zirax. An empire is ruled by an Emperor or Empress, the Kriel aren't ruled by anyone.@p9 The Kriel are an insect race with a hive mind. They don't have the concept of 'rulers', they have roles. The queen of a Kriel hive no more rules than the workers do. She has a role, a job, that will she will spend her life doing. Just as the workers and soldiers do. That's making broods of more kriel workers and soldiers.@p9 An important role in a hive, sure. But we gave her title of 'queen', because the hive centers around her. But she's more like a factory to a town, than a person. People just seem to have trouble understanding the concept of an alien 'mind' different to their own.

We get a lot of mining crews in 'ere in the slow months. If there's one thing that ya can sell to them for a good profit, it's Coffee.\nThose mining rigs all run on a steady diet of whiskey, coffee and burgers. Can't say I could stand it m'self.

Don't need no more lazy bums to skim a drink off me.\nIf you're interested, I can hook you a line with some... connected patrons looking for quality merchandise.\nThey won't pay top credit, but they'll pass the word on ta' their friends.
Alright, one of my regulars is lookin' to get into somewhere he's not meant to be, if ya get my meaning.\nHe's after a Zirax Security Keycard and he's willing to pay 48,000 credits for one.

I know a collector from outsystem lookin' fer a few 'Antiques' for his art collection. Think you can help 'im out by getting 6 Ancient Relics?\nHe's willing to pay top credit fer something a little more authentic.
I think I can help you there

It's hard to get good quality materials on the other side of Imperial Space and some of the customers that live out there are willing to pay for top-shelf Leather if you can get it out there.@p9\nThe problem is that the Tal'on are the experts at making REAL leather and them 'zax bastards charge huge tarrifs on Talon-made goods like Leather.\nYou get me 40 Leather and i'll pay you 25,000 credits for the shipment. I'll take it from there.
My guy's gonna be very happy with this.\nHe'll also pass on his recommendations to his business partners in The Syndicate.\nI hope ya like being listed as a stand-up guy in the books of lowlifes.
<color=#ffffff>Don't got no work for you now that the last bit of business is done.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Maybe something'll turn up again later.</color>

You wanna know about Chemical Waste Processing?@w2 Well, we do that here. But you need a permit for it, and you'll be in some serious trouble if you're ever caught dumping that stuff anywhere. It's gotten so bad that factories have to file transit orders on everyone that takes a load of the stuff.@p9 What that means is that you can take a shipment of chemical waste from a factory and bring it here and get paid for your trouble. But if you 'lose' a load of chemical waste, you'll find yourself on a blacklist with Polaris or the Trade Federation.@p9 If you do lose a load, to pirates, customs agents, engine trouble, whatever. You'll need to pay a hefty fine before you can do anymore business.@w5 You can only take one shipment at a time, as well. So don't try and load an entire planet's worth of waste on your ship because no self-respecting factory foreman will let you double-load.@p9 You can make a decent job out of shipping chemical waste to any processing plant if you keep at it, and you're helping keep the galaxy clean while you're at it. So yeah... That about covers it.
<color=#ffffff>You're here about Chemical Waste Processing?@w3</color>\n<color=#ffffff>What're you after? Information? Permits? Dropping a big load?@w2 heh.</color>
I have a shipment of chemical waste (NYI)

<color=#66ccff>I can't seem to access this computer terminal.</color>\n<color=#66ccff>It looks like it's designed to forcibly reopen doors and activate sensors in the event that they jam. Doesn't look like I can use this yet...</color>

<color=#66ccff>Looks like a computer console for manually opening doors and activating sensors that have been incorrectly tripped.</color>\n<color=#66ccff>I should be able to use it to reset my progress through the mainframe if I get stuck.</color>
Looks like the setting has been toggled.\nI hope I didn't break anything...\nThese settings are to debug the story mission in the event that the POI is reset.

Watch where you're goin!@w3\nWe've got live wires all over the place and gods know how much radiation where the shielding is thin in some places.\nIt's not just the environment outside you gotta worry about 'round here!

Watch where you're goin!@w3 We've got live wires all over the place and gods know how much radiation where the shielding is thin in some places. It's not just the environment outside you gotta worry about 'round here!@p9 Damn it all!@w2 We've got a coolant leak in Section-9 and i'm short on people to handle the patch job!@w4 You! Yes, you. Terran.@w3 I need you to do a job for me. Shouldn't be too hard and i'll pay you for it. Whaddaya say?

Damn glad to see that, I am!\nHere, this is out of the repair budget. It's not much, only {MoneyCounter} Credits but it's more than you'd get for that on the market.\nI'll throw in a couple of power cells, just to show you how much you've helped me out!

<color=#ffffff>You've helped us with the most dire of our problems, but we still have dozens more that we need to fix before we can get back to full operation.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>If you're still serious about offering a hand in getting this place operational again, I won't look a gift horse in the mouth.</color>

Alright then!\nThis bucket o' bolts is far from the latest model and I don't have any up-to-date schematics and work data on the damn thing.@w3 What I need from you is to go find me some Maintenance Data.\nYou can probably pull one of them out of one of 'em old FTL comm satellites around the sun.

Need boots on the ground to help me with this ol' tub.\nSo what I need from you is to find me some volunteers. They don't need to stay on permanantly, just for a few weeks.\nThat's 2 Crew. Terran or Alien, I don't care. But it's probably best if they're the same... species.

Losing charge on capacitor banks 4 through 7 again!\nI keep patching the cables, but there's too much energy loss.@w3 What I really need is a complete replacement with some Superconducting cables.\nThink you can get me 50 or so Superconductors? I'll wire you 200k for 'em.

I need a fresh set of capacitors to replace the Capacitor Banks 1 and 2, since they're the oldest. But getting the right parts ain't a walk in the park from those bum merchants.@w3\nWhat I need is 50 new Advanced Capacitors. Think you're up to it?

Still got that coolant leak to deal with, and not enough hands to go fetch more coolant and a patch to keep new stuff from going the same way as the ol' stuff.@w4\nWhat I need from you is 10 Coolant and 75 Aluminium Foil.\nIt ain't much, but it's honest work.
<color=#0088ff>I've brought the new coolant and patch materials</color>
<color=#ffffff>Nah. It's all good 'ere!</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Should be fine for a couple of weeks now, so I don't got much work worth you wastin' your time on.</color>

<color=#ff5c5c>To think this base would fall to you Terrans! Bah!@w4</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>Well, you've gotten your reward from me. I will only give it out once and only to the first one to have reached me. If that's not you, then that is between you and your allies.@p9</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>I have nothing more to give.@w2 Leave me be...</color>

<color=#ff5c5c>I know your face, Terran.@w4</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>You were responsible for the loss of another Sector Command.@w3 The base's commander has already given you a reward for your skill in combat. I will not do the same.@w5</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>Kill me if you wish, but I will never admit defeat like he did!</color>

<color=#ff5c5c>I don't know how you got down here, Terran. But you should not have been able to reach this room...@w5</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>I suspect an enemy let you in here, or else you cheated to reach this room.@w4</color>\n<color=#ff5c5c>In either case, you will receive no commendation from me.</color>

Greetings Terran.@w3 I am Fleet Admiral Kantor Al'Berich, the commander of this base.@w5 I have served the empire for most of my life, as did my father before me, and his before him.@w3 So know that on this day you have bested me and my men in combat, and that you are the first to reach this place in all the empire's history.@p9 This is both a terrible blow to the empire and a black mark on my family's illustrious and decorated history.@w6 I knew it would happen to one of the sector commands eventually, but it brings me much shame for it to be my own command that would be defeated.@p9 You see, I watched your progress from the Command Center and when it became clear that you would reach this place, I retired to my quarters to await your arrival.@w5 I am old, so I know that I cannot beat you in a fight so I surrender myself willingly.@p9 In recognition of your efforts, I would like to give you a ceremonial dagger that was bestown upon me by her Imperial Majesty Xanthia, Empress of the Zirax Empire, and with it the honorary rank that goes with it: Strategos

You obtained the Class rank of Strategos! Bonus: +10% damage with Minigun Turrets Bonus: +10% damage with Cannon Turrets Bonus: +10% damage with Gatling Guns - Only affects the ship you are piloting -
