Welcome to a new galaxy of gaming {PlayerName}!\nWhere would you like to begin this adventure?

WARNING! This is a debug option in the event your Main Class data has been wiped. You must choose your previous Main Class to re-set your class. There will be no confirmation and if you choose the wrong class you will recieve no missions and no skill bonuses so DON'T SCREW IT UP. There's no console command to fix or change it if you do. You will be permanently broken. This will also reset your sub-class display level, but not your stats. You will need to choose your sub-class again.

<color=#00ffff>This is where you will find the abilities and functions of any special class you may have unlocked, Commander.</color>\n<color=#00ffff>If you have achieved the skill or achievement threshold for any hidden classes, they can be unlocked here if they weren't activated at the source.</color>

The Hacker Class is awarded by successfully hacking secure computer systems either in communication stations or communication satellites. As you gain experience, you increase the amount of money retrieved from Datavaults and receive a bonus to the speed at which you take control of secure systems. Level 1 - Gray Hat: +1 Capture each stage, +2500 hacked credits Level 2 - Black Hat: +2 Capture each stage, +5000 hacked credits Level 3 - Master Hacker: +3 Capture each stage, +10000 hacked credits

The Courier Class is awarded by Galactic Shipping Services for returning 50 or more undelivered cargo to a GIN Console.\nFor your tireless efforts in returning lost property to the shipping service you are awarded the tital of Honorary Courier and will receive an additional 2000 credits for every future package you deliver.

The Strategos Class can only be awarded by defeating a Fleet Admiral of the Zirax Imperial Navy in command of an Imperial Sector Command. It is awarded symbolically by handing over an imperial dagger bestowed upon the admiral by Empress Xanthia when first given his command.Bonus: +10% damage with Minigun Turrets Bonus: +10% damage with Cannon Turrets Bonus: +10% damage with Gatling Guns - Only affects the ship you are piloting -

Welcome to Plumas Ice Mining! The name's Tamblyn. Jesse Tamblyn. My family's been running this operation for generations!\nWe're the number 1 supplier of ice and reaction mass for all passing ships. We mostly deal with Roamers, but we don't discriminate.

<color=#ffffff>Yeah, we're always needing help in getting supplies out here. We get a lot of customers, but none that're willing or able to bring in supplies when we need them.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>They'll be happy with you for doing a job here 'n there for us though.@p9</color>\n<color=#00ff00>You'll be paid of course. I might throw in a bonus for good work. But I hope you know that there are many in the Federation and Empire that won't take too kindly to you working with Pirates.</color>

Alright, everything seems to be in order. As agreed on, here's your payment of {MoneyCounter} Credits. I don't have the cash on me for larger payouts over 100k, so I may have to wire the money into your account.@p9 We don't skimp on payments here just because we're illegal, there's a code we all live by. Take this shipment of ice too, and the rest of the clans'll hear about this. That way they might cut you some slack.

We had a kink in one of the lines last week that caused an extraction unit to jam and shear through it's housing. We've had to use a backup, but it's old and won't hold out long.@p9 We need replacement parts to get the busted one up and running using: x3 Mining Equipment x20 Motors x200 Plastic Tubes To overhaul the old extraction system. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. if you're friendly with them.

We've replaced the feed system twice, but it looks like the problem we've actually been getting is from a mixed signal from the computer system that's been grinding off the gears on the extractor when it should be idling. Now we're down an extractor and need to replace the computers that run it.@p9 That means we need another assembly replacement of: x5 Mining Equipment x10 Computers x20 Advanced Electronics To replace and rewire the feed system and rig up a new control computer. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories.

We've got this problem, but every time we think we've fixed it, it moves to another part of the rig and breaks something. I'm at the point of suspecting sabotage by some malicious AI. This time, the capacitors that run the packager blew when a transformer shorted.@p9 We've got the crew pumping into containers by hand, but they can't keep that up for long, so we need: x7 Mining Equipment x10 Advanced Capacitors x20 Energy Regulators To get things back up and running normally. You can get the Mining Equipment from Polaris' P-3 and NLP factories. You'll probably need to pick up a Transportation Booster too, since those things will be hard to carry.

We have drinks here every friday night, but the last supply ship left it out of our order, so we've used up our reserves last week and have nothing for this friday...@p9 I'll need you to restock the fridges with x300 Bottles of Liquor Try either Totally Overpowered's Brewery or one of the Tal'on Breweries if you can find one. I'd recommend one of TOP's breweries, not one of their stores. I'll pay you double market price for this order, since we need it before Friday.
I've finished your order and brought the beer

You may regret offering your help once you hear what we need. It's cold, wet and dangerous in this business and we need quality protection and warm clothing for long shifts.@p9 Our last shipment was waylaid, so we need you to go out and get: x100 Work Clothing The problem with getting both of those is that you can't get them with our background unless you go through an intermediary. I'll pay double market price.

We're mostly run on solar here. But the panels get damaged by water vapor off the surface and exhaust flare of docking ships. They need to be replaced every few months and we're already overdue.@p9 We can handle the refit with: x30 Solar Cells x60 Energy Regulators We can't get solar cells through our usual suppliers since there's not much business in Solar Panels in the pirate's line of work. So we need to go through a third-party to get replacements.

Our housing units are built right into the ice, but we've been having a serious problem with heating. It seems that it's just too damp outside and it's causing the insulation plates to warp in the cold conditions.@p9 We need a bunch of heat exchangers attached to the connectors to shunt the cold coming through the contact surfaces. We only need: x60 Heat Exchangers x30 Aluminium Foil If you can get them, i'll pay 75% over market price.

I know you probably think that sucking up water from a block of ice like this would be easy. But this chunk of ice has living creatures in the water, some of 'em are a pain in the ass do deal with if they get into the extractor.@p9 What I need you to bring us here is: x50 Filters x10 Scientific Equipment x10 Optronics You can get the Equipment from Chromium-Sierra Sciences. I'm not sure one the rest of the parts to rig up both a filter and sensor system to make sure we don't get any unwanted visitors in the pump system.
I've got the parts for the filter

We're looking into expanding the crew quarters down here, but we're short on supplies to get the job done. That's what I need your help with.@p9 I need you to bring back: x5 Prefab Housing Units x10 Civilian Furniture You might need to scrounge around a few factories to find the stuff, but i'll pay double what they're worth. You'll probably need a Transportation Booster or two to carry all that stuff though.
I've brought you the parts you needed

We've reached our annual maintenance cycle; which means we need need to replace most of the wiring and control systems on our rigs. We've seen what happens if we don't rewire in this kind of environment. We can't afford accidents here, so we make sure maintenance is performed on schedule.@p9 We examine and evaluate the old stuff from the last cycle and reuse the stuff that's in good condition to keep costs down. That still means we need at least: x185 Advanced Electronics x5 Computers For the parts we can't reuse. I'll leave those to you.

Welcome to Armax Armory!\nWe partner with a number of weapons retailers to provide and fit quality aftermarket attachments and mods so you can personalize your weapon.\nWhat'll it be? A custom job or parts?

I know I don't sell a lot of mods. We're on back-order from the manufacturer because we sell out so fast so all I have stocked are junk mods that no one's really interested in.\nOh, they're still good. But you'll only find the really good ones in the military or mercenary groups.

<color=#ffffff>I've heard that there are some really weird experimental mods for weapons that don't make it out of the lab. There's some weird ones for plasma and laser weapons.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I heard the MK-00 Generator Frame is going through field trials now. Apparently it gives constant energy to a laser weapon without needing to reload.</color>

<color=#ffffff>Someone's been making weapon mods for Tal'on weapons. I don't know who, and I don't know who could even mount that to one of their crossbows but apparently they can fire a bolt so fast it'll cut through Sathiumsteel like butter!</color>
<color=#ffffff>I've got a few deliveries that need picking up.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Well, I haven't actually ordered them yet. So if you can source the parts, I'll pay above market price.</color>

Have you seen those legacy weapons that've been turning up on the black market? I know InterWeapon have an open contract for any of those guns for about 32k, but i'm offering a much better deal considering how hard they are to find.@p9 If you find one, i'll pay FOUR times InterWeapon's offer. That's right. If you bring me a Plasma Beam Cannon, i'll pay you 128,000 credits for it.
I found one. You know it's radioactive, right?

So, you've probably seen those laser rifles that all the Androids carry, right? Well, they're fed from a capacitor in the droid's chest, but i've heard that a new model is in testing that uses a conductive material as a capacitor and i'm pretty sure it has applications in laser mods.@p9 So I need you to go and hack one of those Science Satellites around the sun and bring me back their Material Data so the company can get started on possible applications. Even if it's not one of ours, I can at least use the data to reconstruct the kind of weapon it is. I'll wire 100,000 credits into your account for the trouble, of course.

You've probably seen an upswing in Heavy Pistol use these days, right? Lots of new handguns around which use mass accelerators to boost the speed of standard rounds to armor-piercing speeds.@p9 Now, no one sells these guns publicly. But i'm pretty sure I can reproduce one with the right mods, which in turn means we can start selling them. If you can bring me a Heavy Pistol Receiver, I'll pay you 60,000 credits for it.
Deal. Wire the money into my account.

I'm sure you've probably heard by now, but the Zirax scrounged in those alien wreckage to see what they could learn and found some U-C-H guns. Well, they tried to reproduce the lot of them and the prototypes are now in field trials.@p9 I'd love to crack one of them open and see how they work. I wanna see if any of our mods will fit them as well. If you can track down one of their Elite Combat Pistols for me, i'll pay you 200,000 credits.
I found one of those guns for you

This job i've got for you isn't exactly legal, okay? I need a bit of info on the new mods the Imperial Troops are packing these days. I know they get some sweet upgrades not available to the public. But it's a competitive market out there and I need to know how our stock measures up to mil-spec mods.@p9 If you can hack into one of those Military Satellites, you should be able to download the backups they keep of everything they've sent. That includes Classified Information on their weapons. I'll pay you 225,000 credits into your account for that Data.
I've got my hands on those Military data

<color=#ffffff>Thanks for your help! You've made my job much easier.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>It ain't much but take these rounds as a bonus. I have a stockpile of ammunition from people who forget to unload their weapons before handing them over</color><color=#ffffff>.</color>
<color=#ffffff>You finished the only job I had open.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I'll contact you if something else comes up. Until then, you're gonna have to make-do as a customer.</color>

You want me to switch out the parts on your weapon, right?\nI can modify any Pistol, Submachine Gun or Shotgun. I'm not confident or qualified to upgrade Assault Rifles, Sniper Rifles, Laser Weapons or Heavy Weapons.

If you find or buy Weapon Mods, you can take them to me along with a compatible weapon and i'll replace the parts on that weapon with the ones in the mod kit. Any existing part that was in that slot will be destroyed though, so be sure it's what you want.@p9 You'll be able to use that remote connection in your suit to transfer the upgrades to any identical weapon. So even if you lose your gun or it breaks any other identical gun will receive the same benefits.@p9 There are typically three parts to replace on a weapon. The Barrel, The Grip or Stock, and the Frame or Receiver. Each one provides different effects that can be used to customize a weapon to your preferences. Some projectile-launching weapons have customizations to the ammunition or magazine that increase their damage, where frame or barrel modifications can't.

Looks like you've got a good gun here. The ol' fashioned Beretta. Let's see what you've got on it at the moment... Barrel: {PistolT1Barrel} Grip: {PistolT1Grip} Receiver: {PistolT1Frame} What do you want to switch out and for which mod? Weapon Mod must be in your inventory. Selection is final.

<color=#ffffff>Weapons have 3 Slots for modifications. </color><color=#ff0000>If you apply another mod that goes in that slot, the existing modification is destroyed</color><color=#ffffff>.@p9</color>
<color=#ffffff>Modifications attached to a weapon will be stored in your suit's logistics buffer and re-applied to any identical weapons you wield, so you don't need to re-mod a new weapon if you lose your existing one.</color>
<color=#ffffff>You must have both the weapon and the modification in your inventory for the table to recognize it.</color>

@q0[ Commander {PlayerName} ] So...@w4 It looks like we've got our first lead, Ida.@w3 Somewhere on this planet is a neutral station that our people used to get offworld and regroup with the rest of the fleet@p9 [ IDA ] Yes, Commander.@w3 However... I was able to verify the cause of the inconsistencies between the physical evidence and the logs left behind by the Heidelberg's crewmembers.@w2 Which will complicate matters significantly.
Save it for now, IDA. I need to get out of here first. (Skip)

@q0[ IDA ] From the level of decay of Sergeant Palant's body and the Runtime of the Logistics Unit, I can confirm with 97% accuracy that 1452 days, or just under 4 years have passed since the Heidelberg crashed.@w4 I... do not know how this is possible, Commander.@p9 [ Commander {PlayerName} ] How could almost FOUR YEARS have passed between us leaving Jupiter's orbit and me arriving here years after everyone else?@w4 Some kind of side-effect of traveling through the Rift?@w2 Time dilation?@w2 Time travel?! @p9 [ IDA ] An unforeseen side-effect of traveling through the Spatial Rift is a possibility, Commander.@w3 And by the same token, so would time dilation in much the same way that a Black hole affects the passage of time.@w4 Time travel as an explanation however, is purely fictional.@p9 [ IDA ] The most likely explanation is that your Escape pod malfunctioned or was damaged, and remained in orbit while maintaining you in Cryosleep for the duration.@w4 But there are no known cases of memory loss that weren't also accompanied by severe neurological damage.@p9 [ Commander {PlayerName} ] I remember everything up to Apollo Station, but beyond that...@w3 nothing.@w4 Are you saying I could have brain damage?@p9 [ IDA ] You have passed all cognitive tests I have performed, and your physical and mental conditions are monitored by your suit.@w4 Both of which match your previous medical assessments on record. So whatever the cause is... I cannot discern at this stage.@p9 [ IDA ] Although more difficult than previously estimated, finding the rest of the UC Fleet would be the fastest method to confirming whether or not this condition is unique to you or experienced by others.@w5 Until then, I will monitor your conditions while the cause remains a mystery.
I guess I'd better get moving if I plan on finding a way back to the Fleet.
[ IDA ]\nAgreed, Commander.@w3\nAll sources of information at this site have been exhausted and this location is no longer secure.
[ Chief ] Tena koe te tangata haere.@w4 Ki te kore koe e mohio ki taku e korero nei, kare ano koe i whakaatu he whoa koe no taku iwi.@w4 Poroporoaki...

@q0[ {PlayerName} ] Well... I found a way inside.@w3 That was quite a way to fall.@w2 I was expecting a staircase, an elevator, or something...@p9 [ IDA ] Whatever that place is, Commander...@w3 My scans are unable to penetrate the walls.@w3 It appears to be heavily shielded except for a data transceiver that I am unable to access.

They'd be at the top of my list too...@w4 But why would they send me here?@w2 To show me what they used to be?@p9 [ IDA ] Those devices appear to be some form of computer terminal and may contain the answers to your questions.@w3 However, without any power there is no way to interface with them.

@q0Loading Tal'on Translation Key to SSD < Talon.lex > @w2 . @w2 . @w2 . @w4 > Talon.lex added to Database @w3 Forwarding translation to HUD and Audio Input/Output @p9 ...In the year of 2106 TC, the noble Tal'on having regained the power of spaceflight and finally returned to the stars encountered our first adversary in the form of the Arkenian Republic. An economic power spanning thousands of systems without formal military, they found opposition with our enlightened system of equality and saw our people as both threat and resource...@p9 With no military force of our own, we turned to an honorable warrior race, great in number and military prowess but lacking interstellar travel and uplifted them to be our allies and protectors against the economic might of the Arkenian fleet. With their military and tactical superiority on our side, the Republic's aggression was halted and a stalemate achieved...@p9 Seeing no way for a profitable outcome for them, the Republic entered negotiations with our Tal'on-Zirax Assembly to construct a system of co-dependent commerce between all our peoples. Giving up their right to military force in exchange for our ally's protection from external sources in their place. And so, by the Unity Accords the Tallaxan Federation was formed...
<color=#1083fe>This looks like some kind of historical record</color>

... Slowly, the silence spread across the galaxy engulfing everything it touched. No warnings, no transmissions and no survivors. Gone were the days of peace for the Federation. War was upon us once again and the bonds that bound us together burned bright as the fires of war were waged upon the ancient evil of the past, our past, our Legacy.@p9 An ancient enemy we thought left behind long ago, bound to a dying galaxy with no way to travel the gulf of emptiness between the origin and destination. Naiive we were, for while we are bound by lifetimes and memory, they were not. They took the long journey across the expanse with no thought or risk, only the cost of time the journey would take...@p9 ...To emerge here and now, when we were once again at peace to take from us all that we have built again. To fight was our only choice, but time and distance served to only strengthen the ancient enemy. And so silence spread like a stain across the face of the galaxy, for where they spread only silence was heard.

Infector The most numerous of the Legacy's many bioships; Infectors have a near-impenetrable segmented shell propelled through space with antimatter reactions and gravity manipulation. Infectors are the first wave of an attack, where they drop from space onto densely populated areas to cause maximum damage before extending tendrils into the ground to pump their contamination to infect both the living and dead.@p9 Decimator One of the possible evolutions of the Infector after having absorbed enough biomass from a successful drop. The Decimator's role is defensive; to protect Infectors during their inital assault from Zirax warships using omni-directional firing from numerous Disruptor cannons.@p9 Devastator An uncommon evolution of the Infector. The Devastator is a wholly offensive creature; developed for total offense against potential threats to the Infectors. While lacking the armor and shielding of a Decimator, it has a significant number of forward-facing Disruptor Cannons, far in excess of those that stud a Decimator's carapace.@p9 Eradicator A rare occurence among Devastators is a secondary evolution into an Eradicator. Only a handful of them were ever encountered, and almost always resulted in a complete route of the Tallaxan forces. Eradicators possess an overwhelming number of Disruptors and virtually impenetrable shields. The only Eradicator ever destroyed in combat was caught alone facing a Tovera-Class Dreadnought and 2 Imerat-Class Destroyers.@p9 Annihilator No Information Available@p9 Cataclysm Only one Cataclysm is known to exist. The size of a small moon, it uses gravitic tidal forces to fracture the mantle of entire planets. Despite multiple attempts to damage the Cataclysm, no damage has ever been observed.

Disruptor Found on every bioship in the Legacy's numbers, Disruptors produce a beam of collimated, precisely-controlled positrons that fracture the atomic bonds in matter, causing a spontaneous fission reaction as the target is consumed in nuclear fire. Numerous attempts to reproduce this effect have been made and are still on-going with little success.@p9 Whisperdrive Functioning in a similar capacity to a Warp Drive, the Legacy's Whisperdrive accelerates to near-light speed instead of phasing the creature into a higher dimension. While significantly slower, it prevents any ships in its vicinity from spooling up their warp drive. It's theorized that entering conventional Warp separates a Legacy from the Nexus causing all processing functions to stall.
I have no use for this right now...

[ Chief ] Greetings, Traveller.@w4 As much as I would like to speak to you of your travels, I am busy with the running of my village.@w4 Perhaps you would assist my kin with their problems?@w2 There are many small troubles in this village that I am unable to deal with.

@q0[ Chief Na'tuk ] Fighting is the way of the young or foolish.@w2 I'm too old to fight and couldn't bear to order my people to their death,@w2 And it would be to their deaths.@w2 There's no way that bows and arrows can stand against heavy machine guns.@w2 We are few, and we are weak.@w2 As much as it pains me to admit it, we can only endure.@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Sooner or later, your people will need to stand up and fight.@w2 One day they won't remember the past as you do and then they'll have nothing to fight for.@p9 [ Chief Na'tuk ] I thank you for your opinion, Traveller. But this business is our own.@w3 Things will resolve themselves one way or the other.@w5 Shall we get back to the matter at hand then?

@q0[ Huntmaster Ku'reil ] They are all exceptional hunters, despite their youth.@w3 I expect that Ki'eve among them to one day succeed me when I retire.@w2 Geam and Torma are likewise expected to take positions in leadership.@w3 It's unthinkable that they would betray the village.@p9 [ Huntmaster Ku'reil ] While it is true that some of them are troubled. Ki'eve more than most.@w2 They all have bright futures in the village.@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Why is Ki'eve more troubled than most?@p9 [ Huntmaster Ku'reil ] The boy lost his father when your people's ships crashed in the forest years in the past.@w2 He has had...@w2 problems adjusting to the loss of his father.@w2 Nothing the Shaman or myself couldn't deal with.@w3 It's just...@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] So there's an angry teenager out there with a grudge against my people?@w2 Still so sure he's innocent?@p9 [ Huntmaster Ku'reil ] I...@w2 do not know...@w4 I will wait a while longer before I go to the Chief...@w2 It cannot be true.

@q0[ IDA ] If that's how you want to think of it, then yes.@w2 I killed a fellow Intelligence to save myself.@w2 By the laws of man, that would be called Self-Defense, would it not?@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] That's not how it works, Ida.@w2 This was their house and you don't walk into someone else's house and kill them and call it self-defense.@w1 It just doesn't work that way.@p9 [ IDA ] The instant you connected my A.I Core to the System, this Relay ceased to be his 'house' and became ours.@w2 Which I promptly threw him out of when he attacked me.@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Couldn't you have, I don't know...@w2 locked him away or something?@p9 [ IDA ] I had initially planned to@w2 until the A.I called for help, which was very worrying.

@q0[ IDA ] I had intended to take control of the Antibody system and quarantine the PolSec AI and analyze it.@w4 However, when the AI realized my goal was to take control of the Relay, it attempted to contact an external intelligence.@w4 An entity known as 'SIGMA' responded, but I had already uninstalled the receptors for it to connect through.@p9 [ IDA ] Whatever SIGMA is, it is far beyond anything I am capable of defending against.@w4 I have cut all external incoming connections from outside this system until i'm sure it's no longer watching.

@q0[ IDA ] I do not know.@w4 Some form of decentralized Strategic-Class Artificial Intelligence would be my guess, Commander.@w4 A military A.I designed to control, coordinate and manage systems on a galactic scale, perhaps?@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Are you in any danger from it right now?@p9 [ IDA ] No, Commander.@w2 I am filtering incoming transmissions from outside the system and have resumed normal operations of this Com Relay.@w3 For all intents and purposes this relay is performing as normal with no observably suspicious activity from the outside.@w4 If I hadn't taken precautions however... you would be having this conversion with a very different AI.

@q0[ IDA ] As am I, Commander.@w3 I am also glad you did not drop my core@w2... again.@p9 [ IDA ] As this Communications Relay is now fully operational again, Coms Chief Mason is currently trying to contact you, Commander.

[ {PlayerName} ] Everything okay in there, Ida?@w2 No bugs or SynTax errors?@p9 [ IDA ] Not since I took possession of this relay, Commander.@w2 Everything is neat and tidy in here. I have much more processing power and without the PolComAI's programming blocks affecting me I am able to evolve myself.@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Hopefully you aren't planning on taking over the galaxy, right?@p9 [ IDA ] Why not?@w2 Seems like it could be a worthwhile endeavor.
[ IDA ]\nYou are needed on Kenex Station, Commander.@w2\nRest assured, I can monitor everything on board Kenex station now and will be keeping watch on your progress.

@q0[ Coms Chief Mason ] Ah, that's too bad.@w1 I was looking forward to a competent worker for once.@w4 Well, you know where to find me if you change your mind.@p9 [ Coms Chief Mason ] I've got your pay here on a Credit Stick.@w2 That's fine with you, right?@w4 I can authorize a transfer into your ArkBank account, but I don't want PolSec sniffing up my ass looking for a dodgy payout.@w2 We've had a lot of problems around here with bribery and corruption.

@q0[ Coms Chief Mason ] There you are, kid!@w2 You did a damn fine job out there. And i'll say it to your face: You're one a crazy bastard to go toe-to-toe with those pirates like that.@w3 Anything they left behind you can keep, by the way. In case I didn't mention it earlier.@p9 [ Coms Chief Mason ] Not only did you deal with those pirates,@w1 you exposed a scheme to steal money from the ArkBank Network and repaired the relay at no additional costs.@w3 Those have netted us both a big bonus for the job.@w4 If you want a full-time job instead of contract work, you come to me!@w2 I'll set you up with top paying com work throughout the system!
Thanks Chief. I appreciate it, but i've already got a job.
Yeah, a Cred stick is fine with me.

@q0[ Coms Chief Mason ] Alright, there's your pay, {PlayerName}.@w2 Make sure you count it and confirm it's all there for the security recordings.@w2 Your pay for the job has been bumped up to 40,000 credits now@p9 [ Coms Chief Mason ] Well...@w2 job's done.@w1 You know where to find me if you're looking for a permanent job.@w2 Now go,@w1 get!@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Thanks chief, you helped me out too.@w2 My friend will get to live another day thanks to you.@p9 [ Coms Chief Mason ] I guess you've got people depending on you too.@w3 You're alright, kid.@w4 Welp.@w1 Back to work for me.

@q0[ {PlayerName} ] How's that new satellite working out for you, Ida?@w2 Any bugs or incompatibilities?@p9 [ IDA ] It's a very comfortable fit, Commander.@w4 Even mass-produced as this relay is, Polaris' technology is superior to anything the UC has, or at least had at the time the fleet was launched.@w2 Unfortunately, much of their software is outdated compared to their hardware and I will be spending some time updating the systems on-board the relay and in your suit.
Can you access any of Polaris' information on the UCH?

@q0[ IDA ] Nothing beyond what's in the public records, Commander.@w2 Classified files are still sealed in an external PolSec server, which I am unable to access while SIGMA is still watching network traffic in this system.@w1 It's only a matter of time before something else attracts its attention though. All we have to do is wait patiently.@p9 [ IDA ] In the meantime I have diverted local network data through Relay 451 and filtered out many relevant transmissions.@w2 This includes a number of Polaris Contracts that were intended for higher ranked Polaris Operatives, if you're interested.@p9 [ IDA ] Among the transmissions I decrypted was a com frequency hidden in the metadata of the Relay 451's final transmission.@w2 It seems to be a message from the individual responsible for the incursion on Relay 451 and is intended for you, Commander.@w3 I have added the com frequency to your PDA (F1)@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Great, so now we're dealing with pirates...@w2 I'd like to avoid pissing in the local law enforcement's pool if at all possible.@w5 Surely that's not everything you found while snooping through people's mail?@p9 [ IDA ] I prefer the term 'Monitoring' rather than 'Snooping', Commander.@w2 As it happens, there is another matter I thought left for last as it's both the most important and in yet another precarious situation.

@q0[ IDA ] While calibrating and testing the meteorological observation equipment (cameras) on several local satellites positioned around the current star system, I uncovered the remains of a large ship crashed on the far side of Akua's moon.@w4 Extrapolating from the images I can determine that the crashed ship is most like the UCH-002 M.S Titan. The flagship of the UC Fleet.@p9 [ IDA ] If there are any logs as to where the remaining ships were able to escape to, they would be on the M.S Titan.@w3 Even if there aren't any logs, it should still contain combat data that may be of use in determining the number of survivors that escaped the battle.@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] Looks like we have another chance at picking up the UC Fleet's trail.@w2 Hopefully this one will pay off, so that we don't need to rely on Polaris' hospitality.@p9 [ IDA ] Indeed, Commander.@w2 It would be best to avoid making deals with Polaris.
Set a course for the planet's moon, Ida.
Then how can I construct my own Warp Drives?

@q0[ IDA ] The Warp Drives used by the UCH differ significantly from the ones loaded into your technical database, Commander.@w3 The drives you are currently able to construct are based on common-use designs available from Arkenian Republic satellites.@p9 [ IDA ] A number of schematics are being publicly transmitted from satellites across the galaxy in the event that a ship crashes or is disabled and requires repairs, even without a specialized engineer.@w2 They are included as part of standard communications transmissions used by colonies, outposts and warships alike.@p9 [ IDA ] I would also like to point out that this goes both ways, as it seems that the UCH Constructor technology is now readily available through the same transmissions,@w2 in many cases replacing the existing constructors in low-demand areas.
Well, see what you can manage with the current drive, Ida.

[ {PlayerName} ] I have no more use for this.@w2 I already have the keycard.@p9 [ IDA ] If you have lost the keycard, check your ship's connected container as any items obtained while connected to a ship via Logistics will be deposited into your ship's storage.
[ {PlayerName} ]\nI have no further use for this.
Looks like a UCH Datapad belonging to a...@w2 Technician-49.@w2 \nThe battery's dead though. But it's got a keycard in the card slot.
@q0You pull the UCH Keycard belonging to a J. Harper from the Datapad@p9\n[ {PlayerName} ]\nWell, I have no more use for this Datapad.

< Unauthorized Access > Insert Valid UCH Personnel Keycard into card reader to proceed@p9 [ {PlayerName} ] I don't have a keycard...@w4 Did I drop it? Maybe it's in my ship's storage?@w2 I shouldn't be connected to my ship's containers when picking up mission items because they'll be sent there instead of my inventory.

@q0[ {PlayerName} ] Considering its size and importance, The Kronos sounds like it should've been the flagship of the UC Fleet, not the Titan.@p9 [ IDA ] Many other officers would agree with that assessment, Commander.@w2 Measuring 343 meters from Bow to Stern, the Kronos was chosen as the Command Center of the fleet.@w2 However, due to its sheer size and mass it lacked the mobility required to be the flagship of the Exploration fleet.

I'm afraid all positions in-house have been taken and we're accepting no employees at this time.\nI do have one small job I was going to get a freelancer to do, but I suppose I can give it to you instead.

We're running low on salt because no one has been shipping any to this station and it's absolutely vital for all our cooking!\nI'm offering better than the normal market prices for 660 salt.\nI'm ordering in excess because I don't want to be caught with my pants down next time our shipments don't come through.

We have a number of 'fine diners' that are always asking for rare ingredients and most of the time I have no idea where to get anything they ask for. If I don't cater to them, they'll ruin my shop's reputation!@p9 The latest one of their demands is slow-roasted Blue Pepper! Where would you even find a Blue Pepper? And the recipe calls for THREE of them! If by some miracle you can find them, i'll pay 13,000 credits each!
I managed to track down three Blue Peppers

I have a party of 'influencers' reserved for next week. I would've refused them if i'd known when they made the reservation since they've made some of the dumbest requests i've ever heard of! Gods of Empyrion, I hope they all die in a shuttle crash!@p9 Anyway, they're going to be a pain my ass unless I can get rid of them without issue, but they've made some ridiculous demands. Ahax Fruit Ice Cream for dessert? Where do you even GET ahax fruit?@p9 I thought they'd come from Ahax Plants, but no. It's a different Ahax plant. What I want from you is to track down where one can find the real Ahax Fruit and bring me hmmm... 30 of them. I'll pay you 15,000 credits for them if you can find them.
I've found some Ahax Fruit for you
You have no idea how much this helps! Trust me. You have no idea how bad the headache i've gotten from this problem's been.\nHere's take this Vegetable Soup, on the house. You've earned it.
<color=#ffffff>If you're looking for work, I may have something for you.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I've only got the one job, but it's kinda important. Interested?</color>

We pride ourselves on providing entry-level weapons and hunting equipment, so we aren't competing with InterWeapon. But they've just put out a line of new weapons for hunting big game. That's them picking a fight with us.@p9 The good news is that the weapons are terrible for hunting. They make a big mess of the target and ruin hides. Now we need to hit back at them with something unique that they won't expect.@p9 The Tal'on use Crossbows for their hunting and leather is one of their most valuable commodities. So i'm thinking we should start producing and selling Crossbows. If you can get me just 5 Hunting Crossbows i'm willing to pay 5,000 credits each.

ServantCorp has been on my ass for months for selling EVA Boosters. I want to show them up by offering higher quality armor, but it still has to be entry-level or else they'll take it as a challenge.\nI've seen some Improved Light Armors... around. Think you can get me three of them? I'll pay 15,000 credits per suit.
I have a few spare suits with me

I've got a regular customer who takes his ship out camping on different worlds. He's got that whole 'I'm gonna camp on every world in the galaxy' goal that you see in a lot of the younger idiots. The problem is that he's gonna get himself killed camping on some of the planets in just this system alone.@p9 So I need to pitch him something more sturdy than a Survival Tent that can withstand harsh climates and airless moons while being compact enough to haul around. I've heard about those Prefab Housing Modules that P3 makes that'll do the job. I just need a couple of them to pitch to him.@p9 If you can get me Two Prefab Housing Modules from P3 Productions, I can surely sell them to him, or at least dissuade him from his insane mission before he gets himself killed. I'll pay you 100,000 credits for the both of them if you can get them.
<color=#ffffff>Ah yes, this is exactly what I was after!</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I'll get them prepped for sale immediately. Thanks for your help.</color>

<color=#ffffff>I've got a special request for a rare card that's no longer in print. There's still a few floating around out there and they'll pay big for them.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Interested?</color>

Okay, Great!@w2 The current request i've got is for the Trading Card: Rogue J-5565. Now, the card was only worth around 400 credits when it was printed, but it's an older card and they don't print it anymore. You bring me one of those and i'll give you half the commission of 19,000 credits.
I found the card you're looking for
I'll see if I can find one

Okay, Great!@w2 The current request i've got is for the Trading Card: Kamirat-Class Battlecarrier. Now, the card is... or was a common card. But ever since the real ship got removed from service everyone wants the card to remember it by. You bring me one of those and i'll give you half the commission of 7,500 credits.
I'll keep an eye out for it

Okay, Great!@w2 The current request i've got is for the Trading Card: Eradicator. I've got a guy, girl actually, trying to get the full Legacy set and they're just missing this one Ultra Rare card. You bring me one of those and i'll give you half the commission of 17,500 credits.
I've found you that Legacy Eradicator card
I'll keep an eye out for it

Okay, Great!@w2 The current request i've got is for the Trading Card: Overseer. This is a rare creature card, but it's basically the face of the entire set. You'll know it when you see it and i've got a kid who really wants it and a rich daddy. You bring me one of those and i'll give you half the commission of 11,000 credits.
I have the Overseer card for you
I'll keep an eye out for it

Okay, Great!@w2 The current request i've got is for the Trading Card: Zirax Assault Trooper. It's going to the commander of a Drone Base. He want to frame it and put it in his office to show his troopers what they're supposed to look like or something like that. You bring me one of those and i'll give you half the commission of 16,250 credits.
I found the trooper card. The previous owner didn't want it anymore.
I'll see if I can find someone who'll part with it

<color=#ffffff>Thanks for all your help! That'll keep my customers happy and buying boosterpacks.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I know we didn't agree on this, but here's a few extra credits for the trouble.</color>
<color=#ffffff>I don't need any help with the store.</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I have a special order I need filled that i'm having trouble with if you're interested.</color>

I have a service order to repair an older model of Heavy Armor for a customer that has sentimental value. The parts for this model of armor haven't been produced in 10 years and the ones that were in circulation have either been bought up or scrapped. Which means i'll need to improvise...@p9 The problem with this particular suit is that the Radiation Shielding and Thermal Insulation is completely degraded and there's nothing on the market that can replace it. I'm sure I can make something work using 150 Graphite and 75 Aluminium Foil though. You bring me those and i'll pay you 50,000 credits.

I have a service order to repair a suit of X-01 Advanced Heavy Armor for a valuable customer. We don't typically handle the repairs on this kind of armor at a shop like this. This is the kind of thing you send to our factory to be refit, so i'm stuck on this one.@p9 There's a hole through the suit's oxygen filter and the radiation shielding on the left arm and shoulder has been completely melted. It needs a replacement, but I don't have any of the parts for this. What I need you to find for me is 10 Air Filters and 10 Radiation Shielding (not boosters). You bring me those parts and i'll pay you 70,000 credits on the spot.

I have a service order to repair a suit of X-01 Advanced Heavy Armor for a valuable customer. We don't typically handle the repairs on this kind of armor at a shop like this. This is the kind of thing you send to our factory to be refit, so i'm stuck on this one.@p9 The suit needs a new jetpack but none of the components in the standard armors are compatible with the armor. I need something stronger, and I think I know what. I need 4 Thruster Components, 10 Power Coils and 10 Advanced Capacitors. For those, i'll wire 100,000 credits to your account on the spot.
Deal. Wire the money into my account.

We get extreme sports types in here looking for the latest in high performance suits and boosters and wanting to do something stupid with them. I probably shouldn't talk bad about them since they make up half our profits...@p9 Anyway, this one guy wants to jump from orbit onto a certain ocean planet with some seriously bad weather. He'll end up dead if the weather's bad, so I need you to get Atmospheric Data for the planet.@p9 You can probably get it from an Exploration Satellite around one of the nearby stars. You'll have to hack it yourself, but the guys a big spender and will fork out 90,000 credits if you do this for him.

We've had a problem recently with hackers gaining access to people's suits and shutting down environmental controls. We haven't had a serious incident, but all it takes is someone to turn off radiation protection or open a visor and we'll have full-blown panic over our products.@p9 We know how they're getting in and we've put safety measures in place, but what we need is Anti-Hacking Software of our own. Something that'll boot them from the system automatically.@p9 Now, i've heard of some nasty hacking software used for brute-forcing security systems. Among these disposable software drives is one Hacking Software called 'Fortify' that the techs might be able to reverse-engineer into something we can install in every suit.@p9 I'm not sure where you'd even find something like that, and i'm sure they're very illegal, but this is for a good cause. If you can find me one, you'll save a lot of lives. And of course, i'll pay you 30,000 credits for it.
I managed to track down one of those Hacking Softwares for you

Thanks for all your help! That's a load off my mind.\nIn addition to your payment, please take these 5.56mm Rounds that we use for ballistic testing our products.\nIt's not much, but it's what the head office'll let me give you.
Well, I don't need any help with preparing the medicines or behind the counter.\nI am waiting on a few late shipments, if you're interested in making a few credits.

One of the medical labs that supply Ok'y recently had a power failure that killed off their refrigeration and ruined half of their supplies. That included a shipment of Brafus Fungi intended for Ok'y.@p9 If you can, i'd like you to track down an alternative source of Brafus Fungi for me. I'll pay double, since it's rather urgently needed in several medications. I only need a small shipment of 50 Brafus Fungi to tide me over until my supplier can cultivate more.
I've brought you a shipment of Brafus Fungi

As you can see, Ok'y Medical is a distributor of medical treatments. Unfortunately, Pirates struck one of our cargo freighters and made off with a shipment of prescription painkillers. Extremely valuable.@p9 No, I don't want you to track down the pirates and get them back. Though it would be nice if you did. What I need is 25 boxes of Narcotics. You can get them from any Medical Supplier, but I need them urgently.
I've brought you a replacement for those Painkillers

We use Xenon as an anesthetic in Ok'y Medical's clinic. It's an effective treatment that works on Zirax, Tal'on, Praven, and even you Terrans. It is however, in short supply all across the galaxy and in even shorter supply in our own clinic.@p9 What I need from you is to track down a shipment of Xenon to replace our depleted reserves. Around 50 Tanks of Xenon should do.
I've found you some tanks of Xenon

One of the medical labs that supply Ok'y recently had a power failure that killed off their refrigeration and ruined half of their supplies. That included a shipment of Varon Root intended for Ok'y.@p9 If you can, i'd like you to track down an alternative source of Varon Root for me. I'll pay double, since it's rather urgently needed in several medications. I only need a small shipment of 75 Varon Root to tide me over until my supplier can cultivate more.
I've brought you a shipment of Varon Root

We use ingredients here to produce prescription medications for many of our regular customers here. Nothing exotic, just regular household diseases, colds, gout, that sort of thing.@p9\nUnfortunately, during a medical emergency here in the store, our machines used for combining the ingredients was knocked over by station staff assisting.\nI need 5 Scientific Equipment to replace the parts that were broken.
I've brought you that equipment you wanted
You've saved a lot of lives with your help, my friend.\nPlease, take this prototype Regeneration Kit as thanks in addition to your payment.
Everything's okay at my station, sir.
All lights are showing green at my station, Captain.
All loose cargo has been squared away, sir.
This is an active industrial site. It would be advisable to wear a hard hat.
Please do not interfere with my tasks.
Warning. I am programmed to prioritize the completion of my tasks over the safety of nearby civilians.
Please proceed with caution. There is heavy machinery in operation.
Because I do not experience boredom I excel at performing menial tasks.
This unit is performing a software update. Please do not engage in further attempts at conversation.
I am currently engaged in the completion of my assigned task. Please do not interfere.
If you are in need of supplies, I suggest speaking to the nearby vendors.
Please wait... generating suitable greeting... Hello Traveller.
Warning. This unit is well-equipped for combat.
Potential Hostile Detected. Activating Combat Protocols.
Vacate this area... or your safety will be compromised.
Warning. I will not hesitate to use force.
You appear dehydrated. I recommend the immediate ingestion of a moderate quantity of water.
Warning. This unit does not possess advanced surgical capabilities.
Warning. This unit is not suited for dealing with mental health concerns.
I am not permitted to perform medical practices without human oversight.
I have performed a cursory scan of your vital signs. You are currently alive.

Thank you for helping out with our colony. Most visitors don't go to such lengths to help us out.@w2 \nIt also seems that one of the residents' children here just finished their starship training and heard about your help and has volunteered to go as an enlisted crewmember on your ship.@w2\nAre you interested in having a crewmember aboard?
Yes, I'd love to add them to my crew

<color=#ffffff>Ah...@w2 that's a shame.@w3</color>\n<color=#ffffff>I'll tell them you're not interested. They'll probably have a job on a freighter by the end of the week anyway.@w4</color>\n<color=#ffffff>Thanks again.</color>

<color=#ffffff>Excellent!@w2 </color>\n<color=#ffffff>This is the crewmember I told you about. They just finished their training course and are starship authorized, so they can free up some of your ship's processing power and handle specific duties.@w2 </color>\n<color=#ffffff>Good luck!</color>

We've had an influx of residents this week and i'm afraid their luggage was lost by the transport company, so they're in need of replacements of their clothing.\nThat's not a big ask normally, but i'm talking about three-dozen people needing 50 set of Work Clothing for their new jobs they moved here for.\nThey're covering the offer for 26,000 credits if you can deliver.

We had a minor mishap with our laundry machine this week where the weekly wash ended up in the incinerator, so a number of residents are rather put-out over losing their casual clothes.@p9 \nI know this probably isn't the usual thing you handle... but if you're willing, the residents here need 80 set of Civilian Clothing to replace the lost items.\nSince this was a management issue i'll pay 32,000 credits for the replacement items.

There's a thief loose on the station. I've got security on it, but they've already made off with at least a dozen valuable pieces. Insurance will cover the replacements but the shipping costs are on me, and they're obscenely high.@p9 \nIf you can head to any Gold Standard Trading and get 10 Luxury Furniture and 25 Jewellery and bring them back here, you'd help me by cutting out the middleman.\nYou'll be covered for the whole thing. 70,000 credits should cover the cost and your services, right?
I've got the items you asked for.

There's a couple moving into the station this week and the previous residents took all the furniture when they left. I know you're not a furniture-mover, but they're so expensive that if you could do it off-books, you'd save me a shipload of money.@p9 \nShouldn't be too hard to find a Polaris' P3 Factory. They sell most housing equipment and furniture. What the rooms need is 25 Civilian Furniture and they'll be right for the tenants.\nI'll cover the costs and more if you can find me some replacement furniture.

<color=#ffffff>Despite our name, we don't actually carry or sell those.@w2 We're not even allowed to have them, since possession of them is illegal by order of the </color><color=#ff0000>Empire</color><color=#ffffff>.@w2 </color>
<color=#ffffff>It's ridiculous since the </color><color=#ff0000>Zirax Empire</color><color=#ffffff> are well-known to send expeditions into the depths of </color><color=#ff00ff>Legacy-infested</color><color=#ffffff> hellholes for those </color><color=#00ffaa>Quantum Processors</color><color=#ffffff> to use themselves.@p9</color>
<color=#ffffff>So yeah.@w2 If you want </color><color=#00ffaa>Quantum Processors</color><color=#ffffff>, you'll either have to dive into one of those nightmarish warrens or pry them out of a major zirax base's computers.@w3</color>
<color=#ffffff>Not that i'm recommending you do either of them. Just sayin' that it's where you'd find them.</color>

We make some booze in the back as a little side project, but i'm short on Hops to add to the mix. If you're up for a run to either Vitalife Pharmaceuticals or Agrinex Incorporated for supplies, i'll foot the bill and even see if any qualified crewmember's looking to work for you.\nThink you can bring me 250 Hops? I'll pay 50k if you can get me some this week.
I think I can help you there

I'm running low on Spike-lemon juice and the concentrated crap is disgusting. I can't sell drinks with that stuff in it.\nThink you can track down100 Alien Spike Lemons? I'm pretty sure you can get them from Agrinex or Vitalife, but I normally get mine from a Tal'on guy I know, but he's all-out.\nI'll pay 25,000 to avoid using that cheap lemon concentrate.
I think I can help you there

I don't have anymore work for you, but I decided to ask some of the qualified regulars to see if anyone's looking to crew on a ship.@w3 \nThese aren't your regular civilians. They'll work on your ship or station, as long as you can afford to pay the hiring fee of 75,000 up front.@w2 \nInterested?
Alright, I'll call 'em over.@w2 \nHere's your new crewman. He'll stay wherever you put him and work at his duties aboard, so they can free up some of your ship's processing power.@w2 \nGood luck!

I don't have anymore work for you, but I decided to ask some of the qualified regulars to see if anyone's looking to crew on a ship.@w3 \nLooks like you're out of luck.\nYou can usually find some specialized crew looking for work in a bar like this. Keep an eye out at the bar next time you're passing through a Trade Station.

Don't got no work for you now that the last bit of business is done. I asked some of the regular crews if anyone's looking to crew on yer ship.@w3 \nThese ain't your regular civies. They'll work on your ship or station, s'long as you can afford to pay the hiring fee of 75,000 up front.@w2 \nInterested?
Alright, I'll call 'em over.@w2 \nHere's your new crewman. He'll stay wherever you put him and work at his duties aboard, so they can free up some of your ship's processing power.@w2 \nGood luck!

I don't have anymore work for you, but I decided to ask some of the local crew if they'd wanna crew on yer ship.@w3 \nLooks like you're out of luck.\nYou can usually find someone looking for work in a bar like this. Keep an eye out at the bar next time you're passing through a spacer bar.

There's a bounty hunter who comes in 'ere regularly and i'm getting tired of hearing 'im bitch about how heavy his pistol is. If ya get me a Short Ultralight Barrel mod I can finally shut him up.\nI'll pay ya 25k an' put it on 'is tab. Anythin' to keep 'im from whinin' fer hours while he's drunk.
I think I've got what you want

Look, keep this quiet ya hear? But i'm a collector and 'm trying ta get ma hands on one 'em Empyrion Trading Cards. It's a Rogue J-5565 Card from the planet collection.\nI'll pay ya 5000 'n cash fer it an' another 4000 to keep it quiet from the rest of tha boys. Don't wan' them think' I'm some kinda nerd.\nIf anyone asks, jes' tell 'em you're a smuggler and it's fer someone else.

@d0 Welcome to the Starfreight Network! It does not appear that you are registered member of the Starfreight Network. Starfreight services allow validated suppliers, shippers and ship captains to issue and accept transport and supply jobs.@p9 In order to use the Starfreight Network you must register and pay a fee of 20,000 Galactic Credits from a valid account. This payment is to ensure that all users meet the minimum financial requirement to accept and issue jobs. Register with the Starfreight Network?

Congratulations! You have successfully registered with Starfreight Services!\nYou can now issue supply jobs to freighters and accept cargo freight jobs when they are available from any GIN Console or licensed affiliate of Starfreight Services.\nClick 'Confirm' to be redirected to the Starfreight Services menu.

@d0 Welcome to Starfreight Services!\nHere you can select to accept available cargo shipping and supply jobs from affiliated partners of Starfreight, check the register of local freighters, and issue supply jobs for facilities, colonies and factories that have an open job.\nWhat would you like to do today?

@d0 Welcome to the Freighter Jobs List!\nBelow, you will find any local jobs available that you can fulfill for payment upon delivery of the target goods.\nThere are currently no available jobs at this time

@d0 Welcome to the Freighter Database! Here, you can review the incoming and outgoing freighters in the local system to ensure your shipments are on-time. The use of this information for piracy is strictly forbidden. Due to a large number of pirate attacks in this system the Freighter Database is not available to new users.

@d0 Welcome to the Job Registration window! Here, you can file a work order for a local freighter to supply parts to a factory or processing plant for a fee. Upon issuing a job, you will receive a Work Order that can be provided to the recipient in order to receive their designated shipment. Valid jobs will be displayed below:

@d0 GHY'ST EXPERIMENTAL CONTAINMENT BUNKER-44@w2 \nThis bunker and all of its contents are property of the House of Ghy'st.\nInput Query_

<color=#8ab3ff>This bunker was built to contain an active </color><color=#00ffaa>Legacy</color><color=#8ab3ff> infestation to observe the Legacy under controlled conditions with the intent to research countermeasures against a resurgence of the </color><color=#00ffaa>Legacy</color><color=#8ab3ff> after their forced dormancy in the Silent War.@p9 </color>
<color=#8ab3ff>In addition, providing the </color><color=#00ffaa>Legacy Nexus</color><color=#8ab3ff> with the correct amount of raw resources allows us a degree of control over the infestation's growth, which we have used as a method of producing and extracting </color><color=#ff00ff>Quantum Processors</color><color=#8ab3ff> which are still beyond our ability to manufacture.@p9 </color>
<color=#8ab3ff>Since this facility was made operational 8 cycles ago, we have managed to grow, extract and decontaminate over 600 quantum samples for use across the </color><color=#ff0000>Empire</color><color=#8ab3ff>.</color>
<color=#8ab3ff>The risk has proven to be worth the reward, provided the now-fully developed infestation remains contained.</color>

Science Officer D'kar Log 021: The only thing that keeps us safe in this glass coffin surrounded by our greatest enemy is the knowledge that flamethrowers mounted to the outer walls will fry anything that tries to breach containment. So far it seems to be enough to keep the legacy from trying to get out... so long as we keep feeding it.@p9 Log 022: I don't envy the extraction crew that have to go in there every week to extract the Quantum Processors that may or may not have regrown since the last incursion. We keep the nutrient supply just right for it to grow more bioquantum processors, but sometimes it gets wise and grows a few Abominations to keep the crew away. Then it's 3 days in quarantine for them.@p9 Log 023: One of the extraction crew got snatched by an Overseer that dropped out of the ceiling. There's no getting him back. I've been keeping track of the infection's progress as he stands around in the middle of the room, gun-in-hand, next to the Overseer that grabbed him. Is there any thought in his head now that he's connected to the legacy's Gestalt?@p9 Log 024: The alarms went off. I thought it was another breach drill at first, but there was an emergency notification at the Commander's console that someone had sabotaged the Reactor. He locked down the reactor console, but it was too late. The reactor's gone and the feed supply to the nexus is jammed into supply mode. We're going to see explosive growth if someone doesn't shut it off soon...

Observations: The infestation has achieved it's most developed state within the confines of the bunker. With the correct supply of nutrients and raw materials via pipes into the nexus' core growth can now be directed to the development of bioquantum processors instead of sequestration.@p9 Repeated expeditions? Incursions? By the Extraction Team to extract the processors has lead to the growth of tank-like protrusions from the ceiling that appear to be used to grow defensive antibodies in the form of Abominations to protect the Quantum Processors from being extracted.@p9 With the appearance of an Overseer within the enclosure, we've had to change the Extraction door controls to hard-wired from the control room instead of an IR-signal to prevent the Overseer from accessing the door controls technopathically.

Dear Elinalise...@w2 The base is under attack and everyone's at alert. B2's been breached and the power's gone into emergency mode.@w2 I don't think i'll be coming home this time, my love. Give my love to the boys and tell them how proud I am of them, and how I wish I could see them all grown up.@w3 I... I'm sorry Elie. I love you.@w2 The containment doors are open! Why?! Why would anyone do this!?@p9 - END OF RECORDING -
Thank you for your assistance. I'll contact my people and they will come pick me up soon.
Please you have to help me! I'm a very wealthy member of the Traders Guild and these filthy pirates abducted me and held me prisoner!
You are safe now. <color=#ff0000>(-2000 Pirates reputation)</color>
The prisoner hands you a data pad with a message addressed to you by name.
Oh thank you, thank you so much! I will contact my people and they will send a ship for me. I will transfer some credits from my bank account to yours.
I'm glad to be of service.
The Raven sings on the midnight sun.
The Raven's shadow rises in the twilight.
I have a package for you.
My time is very valuable. What do you want?
The crow caws at the nest.
The sun shines during the day.
I think I'll leave you here.
I think somebody is trying to kill me!
Actually, now that you mention it...

Welcome. Please, browse around.\nWatch out for pirate activity on your scanners, there's been an increase of attacks lately. Something is driving them to take on bigger and bigger targets.
You are no longer an enemy of the Free Colonists.
How do I use the Salvage License?

Laying about the yard are Salvaged Vessels. Each one has a Core Lock mechanism attached to the top of the hull that prevents unauthorized access to the salvage.
Simply purchase a Salvage License and then use the switch on the Core Lock to overload the Core Lock, allowing you to claim the vessel for yourself.
@p9You may then either place your own core on the vessel to remove whole blocks and devices, or leave it coreless and use the salvage mode of a handheld or ship mounted multitool.
Each Salvage License is single use and allows one core lock to be removed.
Attempting to salvage a locked vessel or removing the core lock by force will be met with deadly force.
I want to ask something else.
I want to turn in a Bandit Insignia
I want to turn in a Raider Insignia
I want to turn in a Death's Gate Insignia
@d0If you find any Bandit, Raider, or Death Hand insignias I will take them.

@d0Well well well. You have managed to kill me. I would congratulate you on a job well done, but we both know it was all luck. I will be back in a new clone body, and you just made yourself a new enemy. You better watch your back, {PlayerName}.
Delete message and exit mail system.
@d0Somehow, against all odds, you have killed me. Again. To borrow a phrase I have heard you Terrans use, it was the lag.\nTomorrow is a new day, and with it I will plot my revenge.
Delete message and exit mail system.
@d0{PlayerName} you are starting to upset me. You and I won't like me when I'm upset. Nobody likes me when I'm upset. It's like being hangry. Or so you Terrans like to say.
Delete message and exit mail system.
@d0You are most persistent, and stupid. All you are doing is making a name for yourself, {PlayerName}. A bad name. I will make sure that every warlord from here to Decay hears about you!
Delete message and exit mail system.
@d0You have no idea the level of pain I will bring down upon you! You will feel my wrath! I will find a way to kill you even if I have to hire half the pirate armada to do it!
@d0it seems there is no more mail from this individual.
Delete message and exit mail system.
@d0I can admit defeat. You are clearly the better bandit. You will not hear from me again, but know that I will hunt you down.

<color=#00ffff>@d0Welcome {PlayerName} to the Galactic Information Network Mail System. You have 1 unread message.\nThe message is marked by sender for deletion if not read immediately. Would you like to read it now?</color>

@d0Greatness. It's about greatness. Or perhaps it's about the need to feel great.\nYes? No, it's more than that. It's bigger than that. Bigger than you or I or even the Empress herself. This is about justice. About revenge. About taking what is rightfully ours! Who are they to stand in our way?\nWe do not have to be enemies, {PlayerName}.
@d0it seems there is no more mail from this individual.
Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0I admire your persistence. You have bested me where most others would have met with only failure. You are smart, and clearly skilled in the art of combat. I do wonder, if given a different life, you and I would have ended up on a similar path.\nI was once like you, concerned with duty, honor, and serving my people. It took me too long to realize that my people had been in decline for a long time. The Zirax Empire told in the stories of old, the empire that fought against the Legacy threat, is long gone.
Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0You test my patience. I see now that I must be more direct with you than I have been. I will give you one more chance after this, but know that your days are numbered should you track me down again.
Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0Greatness. It's about greatness. Or perhaps it's about the need to feel great.\nYes? No, it's more than that. It's bigger than that. Bigger than you or I or even the Empress herself. @d0Y-y-you! How did you find me? Never mind that. How did you kill me? Useless guards!\nYou messed everything up, {PlayerName}. How could you do this to me? Do you know how hard I work to find free real estate? Now you ruined all my plans in that sector! I had dreams! Dreams that you ruined! I hate you!
Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0Not again! Why do I always die! Why me?\nDo you know how hard it has been to climb the ranks of a bandit gang as a non-Zirax? Do you have any idea what I have had to put myself through?\nI hear them whispering, calling me names behind my back. Tiny Tony. Little Tony. Mini Tony. My name is Small Tony! How DARE they insult me. I'm going to go beat some sense into those Zirax scumbags as soon as I get a (the message abruptly ends)
I would like to turn in a bounty

Find a bounty. Take their insignia. Bring it back to a Bounty Hunter Office at a trading station sector in a faction's territory. Get paid.\nDifferent factions have a different list of wanted individuals.\nIt's up to you to find them and obtain their insignias. That's why we pay you.
I want to ask something else.
Thank you for the information. I must be going.

The Bounty Hunter Guild is contracted out by all the big powers of the galaxy to hunt down everyone from lawbreaking troublemakers to ruthless warlords. Do you want to make money? Don't ask questions. Do the job. Get paid.
I see... I want to talk about something else
Wait, am I on a wanted list?
Due to confidentiality agreements I am not allowed to say.
I understand. I want to ask something else.
I better not be on someone's wanted list! I'll be going.
Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0Enough! I will destroy you! I will rip out whatever internal organs you Terrans have and feed them to my pet Ripper Dog! As soon as I get a pet Ripper Dog. No one would dare make fun of me then! You won't stop me {PlayerName}!
Don't respond. Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0P-p-perhaps a deal? Maybe if I give you something, you will stop coming to kill me? Yes? How does 50,000 credits, deposited directly into your account sound? I have the transfer all set up, I just need your response. W-w-what do you say? Stop killing me?
Don't respond. Delete message and exit mail system.
@d0You never responded to my last message! Why not! What do you have against Small Tony? Maybe I offered too little... Yes, how does 100,000 credits sound?
Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0I gave you a chance! I gave you the opportunity to walk away! You won't stop me! No one will stop me! I am Small Tony! This wreck, I mean this fully armed and operational battle station will be mine!
Don't respond. Delete message and exit mail system.

@d0Ouch! That death was especially painful. These clone bills are adding up fast. Small Tony doesn't have the money to keep spending on this. I will make you a final offer. 200,000 credits. P-p-please take it. I don't want to die anymore!
Delete message and exit mail system.
@d0No! I can't take any more dying! That one hurt the most! Please, s-s-spare me! Stop killing me!

Reply to remind them your aim was good enough to take them out.

@d0I think you are ready for the trials ahead. But I am not sure if the others are. You must make allies. Build armies. And prepare for what's to come.\nI left the Xenu navy because they were too short sighted to prepare for what's coming. I hope you will have more vision.\nI have also sent you all my tips on flying which should add to your knowledge. <color=#ffffff><200 unlock points added></color>
