@d0You have used up <color=#00ffff>{Eden_UCHResearchCost}</color> Terabytes of Progenitor Research to create a Progenitor Translation Matrix.\nThe Translation Matrix grants access to Ancient Progenitor computer systems.\nProgenitor subspace signals have been detected near the edges of the galaxy.
I don't have any Data Chips. Back to Main Menu.
@d0<color=#ff0000>The frequency is lower than your chosen frequency of {CodeGuess}.</color>
@d0<color=#ff0000>The frequency is higher than your chosen frequency of {CodeGuess}.</color>
@d0<color=#00ff00>Hack successful. You have matched the frequency and gained access to the system.</color>
@d0<color=#ff0000>Hack unsuccessful. You have failed to match the frequency. Lockdown in effect.</color>
Thanks to you I will meet my deadline. Once I finish repairs I will be on my way.

Please help me! My ship was attacked by bandits. Before I could do anything they destroyed my mining turrets. I took a time sensitive mining contract for some Hematite and if I don't deliver in time I will lose the contract and my reputation will be ruined!\n@p9I would be in your debt if you were to mine up some Hematite Ore for me from the nearby Hematite asteroid. I need 1 Hematite Ore Shipment to fulfill my contract. You can package Hematite in the Decoration tab of a constructor, then place the shipment in your personal inventory and speak to me again.\nYou are also welcome to help yourself to any other asteroids in the area, I just need the Hematite.
I will get the 2000 Hematite Ore for you.
Here is your Hematite Ore Shipment. Where's my payment? (100,000 credits)
Here is your Hematite Ore Shipment. I don't need any payment. I'm happy to help a friend in need. (750-1250 reputation)
Thank you. Yes, I suppose it's only fair you are compensated for your time. I have transferred some credits to your bank account.
You do this for free? Thank you! I will tell others of your generosity. You have earned my respect and the respect of Free Colonists everywhere.
It is my pleasure to help.
Here is your Hematite Ore Shipment. Do you have any spare ore to trade for it? <color=#ffff00>(Connect to a cargo container first)</color>
Thank you. I do have some spare ore in my cargo that I don't need. I have transferred it to you, it may be in your ship's connected inventory, or floating in a cargo box next to you.

Welcome to our mining operation. I am from Polaris Mining Company, a subsidiary of Polaris Megacorp. The mining vessels in my fleet are contracted through the Union of Independent Miners, or U. I. M.\nYou have perfect timing. One of our mining ships had to head to a repair dock for some maintenance leaving us down a ship. Don't suppose you're looking for work?
You have already completed your mining contract in this sector.

I am glad you asked!\nSince we are down a mining ship we could use some help mining Ilmenite from this asteroid field. You can find several Ilmenite asteroids scattered throughout the area. You will have to use your ship's detector to find them.
Sounds simple, but how do I transfer the ore to you and get paid?

Once you have obtained 6,000 Ilmenite Ore, turn it into a Ilmenite Ore Shipment under the Decoration tab of a constructor, place the shipment in your personal inventory, then speak to me again.\nFor contractual reasons, we cannot accept partial transfers. You must turn in an entire shipment of Ilmenite Ore.\nPayment will be 200,000 credits deposited directly to your bank account, as well as an increase in reputation with Polaris.
I accept your terms. I will come back with a Ilmenite Ore Shipment.
I don't have time right now. Goodbye.
I want to ask something else.
Thank you for your assistance! We have transferred credits to your bank account.\nThis concludes your contract. Polaris Mining Company wishes you a pleasant day!
<color=#00ffff>Here is the Ilmenite Ore Shipment (200,000 credits)</color>
Our records indicate you are not fit for employment. Good day, good sir and/or madam.
Whatever. I didn't want the job anyway.
According to my records, you are on a do not hire list. Get off my ship!
Thank you for your assistance. You have saved my job and my ship!

How do they expect us to mine all this Pyrolusite with one mining ship? I don't even know where to begin! I should have joined the union instead of working for Polaris directly. They are going to scrap my ship for sure for this.
I have the Pyrolusite Ore Shipment
I don't have time to listen to your whining.

I was offered a job with Polaris Mining Company. Normally miners are contracted out with the Union of Independent Miners which offers them some autonomy, but this offer direct from Polaris was too good and I couldn't pass it up.\nIt was the worst decision of my life! They send us out into dangerous systems with no backup and give us impossible tasks. But if we don't do what they say they have the right to seize our ships and fire us!\n@p9I was given the job of mining 15,000 Pyrolusite from this mining site. I don't even know where to begin! I have a single low yield civilian mining turret and I'm already late. I've been sitting here overwhelmed by the stress.
I'm sorry about that. I have to go. Goodluck!
Oh thank you, thank you so much! You have saved my job.\nPlease, how can I repay you for this?
I'll just take the credits. (+350,000 credits)
I'll take any ore that you have. (Random assortment of ore. Connect to a container first)
You could put in a good word for me with your boss. (+1,500-2,000 reputation with Polaris)
I need more time to think about it.
More than happy to pay! You saved my job and I will be able to feed my crew for once!
I will let my boss know how you assisted us.
Thank you. I do have some spare ore in my cargo that I don't need. I have transferred it to you, it may be in your ship's connected inventory, or floating in a cargo box next to you.

Yes. Yes you can! I'll make you a deal. Mine up 15,000 Pyrolusite from the nearby Pyrolusite asteroids, package them up in your constructor's decoration tab, and give me a Pyrolusite Ore Shipment and I'll pay you!\nThat way we both win. You get a reward, and I get to keep my job and my ship. Oh, I guess I get to feed my crew as well.
Never mind. You're on your own.
<color=#00ffff>I have a special delivery of fuel cells.</color>
Took long enough. Wait, let me inspect them... @w4Good, freshly crafted. I suppose you want payment. Here is what you were promised.
I want to ask something else.
I didn't want to listen to your bad music anyway!

@q0 I have set out among the cosmic shores in search of a new home for my people. Our world is no longer safe for us.\nI was one of the first volunteers to delve into the great beyond. I hope I find what I seek.
The search for a suitable planet has been difficult. Many are inhospitable or already inhabited. This planet does not have the correct oxygen levels or sunlight. I must move on.

My ship was hit by an ion storm and I had to make an emergency landing here. I expect to have repairs complete in 2 to 3 suns.\nThere are locals here who speak Tal'on. They tell me of a strange black sphere with green glowing bands that appeared in the sky one day blocking out the sun, only to disappear a few minutes earlier. This is troubling.

Another planet unsuitable for habitation. Though my species is naturally long lived, I miss home. I do this for them.\nI may have to change my search parameters if I am to find a home before the war reaches my homeworld.

I now believe that we cannot afford to search for temperate worlds. I am going to expand my search to include Arid worlds. While not like the pristine woodlands of my home world, I know our species can survive there. If the Sun and Moon clans can do it, so can we.\nI heard about an arid planet called Parthix from a fellow traveler with rings of gold. That is where I will go next. Perhaps with luck it will be uninhabited.
Scan statue and import data into PDA.
You can't be here! Guards! Guards!
<color=#ff0000>If you see this dialogue please report this to the Reforged Eden 2 developers following the directions found on the workshop.</color>\n<color=#ff0000>Thank you!</color>
Welcome. Do you have Bandit, Raider, or Death's Hand Insignias to turn in?
Where do I find Bandit, Raider, or Death's Hand Insignias?
You can find Bandit, Raider, and Death's Hand Insignias from certain patrol vessels belonging to those Warlord factions. Most often found in neutral space in combat sites.
I want to ask something else.

I get to meet all kinds of interesting people in my line of work! Like the captain who had just returned from a system near the edge of the galaxy. He couldn't stop talking about the strange alien drones he found there.
Do you know about the Ancient Warp Gate that lies on the edge of the galaxy? No one has been able to figure out how to power it. Maybe you'd have better luck.
I have a hypothesis that The Progenitors we study now actually came from a far older civilization in a dwarf galaxy. Perhaps fragments of their technology remain, if only we can find them.
There have been reports of increased Bandit and Raider activity in neutral space. Be careful.
Have you heard of Pantheis? He helped design the Project Eden research vessels. I hope to be half as good as he is one day.
Have you heard of the Brotherhood of Farr? My sister just got back from visiting their homeworld of Parthix. She said its golden rings are beautiful.
Stay away from black holes and rogue planets. Heard many ships have been lost in those systems.
I'm tired of being hunted by the Zirax empire. We should strike back at their homeworld! The Throneworld? Hah!
No time to chat. I have a lot of work to do.
Have you seen how much Magmacite weighs? That stuff is almost impossible to mine! First you have to find a molten planet around a M1Ia star and then... Well, you get the idea.
I've thought about becoming a bounty hunter. You can make great money selling insignias to the other factions.
Had a Trading Guild representative visit us who gave us the best hamburgers I've ever had. Said he grew the wheat for them himself outdoors on a tropical planet.
I heard there are dead worlds out there full of salvage. I wonder what happened to the civilizations that lived there.
Be careful flying through gas clouds. Bandits love to set up traps for the unwary.
Hello there. Welcome to the Archives. May I interest you in some ancient cookbooks? Perhaps a text on our mythology or an old hunter's guide on how to skin a Farrbear?
<color=#00ffff>I am looking for information on any travelers who had visited Parthix in the past.</color>
I wish to learn more about the Brotherhood of Farr
I don't need any assistance, goodbye.
You can find much of our story here in the Archives or in the nearby Farr's Arrival which is the original ship Farr crashed in.

Travelers to Parthix in the past? You mean besides Farr? Hmm... There is a tale of an ancient traveler who came here on an airship, but it is considered myth and not a historical fact.\nIt will take me some time to find the text in the Archive, come back later. In the meantime please consider exploring the rest of the Archives or Temple Prime and Farr's Arrival to learn more of our history.\nI will send a message to your PDA when I have located the text.
<color=#00ffff>Thank you. I will wait for your message.</color>
@q0 @d0 I have found the text you're looking for {PlayerName}. Return to me in the Archives.

I don't believe so, though you do seem familiar... Wait, you... No, you can't be him! You're the one who....\nI have something for you. <color=#ffff00>Make sure you got some room in your inventory.</color>
Shhh. Don't say anything. I think I'm being watched.
Nope, must be a funny coincidence. I've never been here before. Who? Me? Never! Honest!

I completely understand. I don't know you and I never met you. It is a complete coincidence that I happen to have limited edition posters with your name on it then. Here, have them, as a token of appreciation for uhh, visiting our world for the first time. Yeah, we like to give out posters here on Parthix. The Archivist's expression suddenly changes... @p9My apologies, but I just remembered that our supply of posters were taken in the night by someone calling themselves Ravien. He promised to give us new ones later though I don't know if I can trust him.
You have worn out our generosity!
He wandered Parthix seeking audiences with leaders. Before he left he built a stone statue. The statue has long since been destroyed but the inscription was recorded in the book.

The people of Parthix are divided but have much potential. Primitive, but resourceful. They cannot aid me, however, and I have received word that I am being given a new task. I am to travel to a moon where crystal meets the sky and keep watch there, waiting for the day the relic of the stars is found.
I see. Thank you for this history lesson.

No please, it is I who should be thanking you! You have solved the mystery of who this traveler was and confirmed the myth was real. We have encountered several crystalline moons that fit the description in the inscription. Perhaps you can continue your search there.\nYou have added to our history today, and for that I am thankful. Please, have this gift, may it serve you well.
An ancient book of fables that speaks of a green skinned traveler who came from the sky in a ship of wood and metal.
Your Golden Rule has been recharged. I hope it continues to serve you well.
Hello, how may I assist you?
You do not have enough reputation with the Zirax Empire to have dealings with me.
My records indicate you do not have the required reputation with Polaris to trade with me.
You do not have the required reputation with the Trader Guild to access my trades.
You don't have enough reputation with the Free Colonists to trade with me.
The Pirates do not know you well enough to access my trades.
You do not have enough reputation with my faction to access my trades.
@d0On behalf of the Trader Guild, welcome!\nI am a Personal Assistant Mechanoid model T-799. How may I assist you?
I don't need any help. Thank you.

@d0Very simple. As a neutral party, the Trader Guild is often contracted out by the other factions to transfer cargo.\nIn turn, we contract out some of the deliveries to third parties such as you. Of course you probably want to know how you can make money from this.
What do I need to do?
I want to ask something else.
Do you have any personal delivery contracts available?
At this time personal delivery contracts are not available.\nThe Trader Guild hopes to make them available in the future.
I want to ask something else.

@d0Once you have a schematic in your <color=#00ff00>personal inventory</color>, meet the <color=#00ff00>requirements</color> listed on the schematic, and <color=#00ff00>do not already have it unlocked</color>, you may turn them in here to unlock the crafting recipe.\n<color=#ffff00>Schematics may require a certain number of unlock points to be able to turn them in. You must have the unlock points available to use or you won't see the option to turn in the schematic.</color>\nYou can sell unneeded schematics to UCH Quartermasters on board the ship.

@d0You can only see options to turn in schematics when you meet the requirements to use them and have not unlocked the item already.
Schematics will be listed under the category listed in their tooltip.
You can obtain schematics through missions, trading, or loot.

<color=#ffff00>Schematics may also require a certain number of unlock points to be able to turn them in. You must have the unlock points available to use or you won't see the option to turn in the schematic.</color>

@q0@d0You find yourself stranded on an alien world. Find a way to survive and eventually travel to space. Default story missions are not available to complete on this starting planet but can be started by traveling to some of the other starting planets. You may also start the Project Eden story by activating the mission Make Contact with Terran Forces in your PDA (F1). This starting planet may be intended for experienced players and may have more difficult POIs and other challenges not found on a typical starting planet and may require unconventional tactics. Play on this starting planet at your own risk. Valuable tips and useful information can be found in the Empyriopedia section of the PDA (F1).
How do I start the default story missions?

@q0@d0The default story missions (Vanilla missions if playing Project Eden or Reforged Galaxy missions if playing Reforged Eden) are currently available to complete by traveling to the following starting planets in the Alpha and Beta starting solar systems: Haven/Persephone/Gaia, Akua, Omicron, Roggery, Ningues. Other planets may have their own unique starting missions or no starting missions at all. They will say in the description of the planet. After landing on one of those planets activate the introduction or first chapter of the story mission in the PDA (F1). You can also start the Project Eden story missions at any time under the Project Eden section in the PDA.
@q0@d0Still confused? Please see the <color=#00ffff>Empyriopedia</color> section of the PDA <color=#ffff00>(F1)</color> or post on the Workshop page for the scenario for assistance.

@d0Greetings commander. I have scanned the locking mechanism and computer and have determined how the mechanism works.
Each time you access the terminal a new security code is generated between two random values. I can detect those values but cannot see what the code is.
You must guess the code until you input the correct code. If you input an incorrect code I can determine whether the code is higher or lower than your guess and adjust the code range accordingly.
Each time you guess the code correctly a firewall will be breached and a vault door may open. Successfully hacking all firewalls will give the best rewards.
<color=#ff0000>Failing too many times may lock you out of the system permanently and closing the hacking window may cause you to lose all hacking progress.</color>
@d0Are you sure you want to exit the system? Make sure you are done with your hacking attempt first.\nExiting the system will cause you to lose all progress and lose a hacking attempt.
Have you seen those strange statues on Earth-like planets? They look like they could be of Talon origin.
I hope to be on an expedition to the Dronelands! It's rumored to be dangerous but I don't believe the stories.
Watch out for The Syndicate. My brother got involved with them and now he's deep in debt.
We really should have stayed longer at that Abandoned Tomb on the last Desert Oasis planet we visited. I know there was a way inside!
We really should have stayed longer at that Abandoned Tomb on the last Desert Oasis planet we visited. I know there was a way inside!
Hello and welcome to our research vessel. She might not be much to look at but she's a tough ship.\nI'm the quartermaster of this ship. How may I help you?

Yes I do have some supplies I can spare. I'm sure you will put them to good use.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.

Yes I do have some supplies I can spare. This fuel should help you on your journey.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.
We have some spare cash you can have.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.
We have a spare autominer core you can have.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.

One of our expeditions recorded data that should help you plot longer warp jumps.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.
We found some more navigational data you can have.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.
We found these valuables while scavenging.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.
Some more valuables you can have.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.

@d0Turn in research reports to obtain unlock points. The report must be in your personal inventory.
You can create research reports in the Decoration tab of a Small, Large, or Advanced Constructor.
The amount of unlock points you gain is based on which report you turn in.

<color=#ffff00>You may perform research every 3 hours but you cannot turn in research reports to the same research vessel.</color>

@q0 @d0Select Complete below to receive your {Eden_ResearchUPCount} Unlock Points.\n\n<color=#ffff00>IMPORTANT: You must press Complete below otherwise you will not receive your unlock points and your report will be wasted.</color>
Alien Tech Research Report (250 Unlock Points)
Where did you get this music?

I got them off a Terran awhile ago. They said it's something called copyright free music from the early 2020's by a group known as Aim to Head.\nSaid it used to be played on something called a u tube. Maybe you can look them up in your historical database.\nYou Terrans are a strange bunch but you have good taste in music!
I want to ask something else.

When will you get more free supplies?

I can't offer any more free supplies to you, however we can discuss trading and my stock is replenished regularly.

If you visit other UCH Research Vessels they may be able to offer you more supplies and different ones than I could.
As you explore more you may start finding ships that even have more valuable supplies.
Thank you. I want to ask something else.
All I needed to know. Goodbye.
Yes I can spare some supplies.\nPlease make sure that you use the logistics system to connect to a cargo container with at least 8,000 free space otherwise your items may be dropped nearby or lost.
I will take the supplies now.
I'm not ready for the supplies.
Here are some spare supplies we recently obtained.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.
Here are some valuable supplies we can spare.\nYou will find them either in your personal inventory, or your connected container, or floating next to you if you did not have enough room.
I want to ask something else.
Hello sir and or madam. Welcome to one of Polaris Megacorp's premiere distribution centers! How may I assist you?
<color=#00ff00>I was told to meet you here on behalf of the UCH.</color>
You are not the alien I'm looking for.
Ah yes, so you are {PlayerName}, I assume? It is good to meet you!\nI understand that you are interested in purchasing the schematics to one of our newest inventions?
That is correct. I am authorized to purchase the schematic on behalf of the UCH for 3 million credits.
Ah yes, yes yes I see. Well, I would love to sell you the schematic but you see, I seem to have misplaced it.
Not my problem. You don't get a single credit until I see the schematic.

Well, more like had it stolen from me. Some filthy pirate thieves stole the schematic right off this station and took off in a corvette!\nIf you return the schematic to us, you can have it. Free of charge.

Look, you came all the way out here from who knows where for this schematic. That tells me that you want it. Frankly if you won't help me then I'll just find someone else who will.\nSome pirates stole it from me. If you get it back I'll give you the schematic free of charge, even if it is against my better judgment with how rude you are.
Do you know where it is?
Do you know where it is?

Luckily I had placed a tracker on the case holding the schematic. You will find them in orbit of a planet in a nearby K2-7 class star system in Polaris territory, though you will have to warp to that system to narrow down their location. I will give you the tracking frequency.
Get my schematic back and you can have it. Free of charge. Honest.

To find the system, search your galaxy map for star type K2-7. There should be one nearby in Polaris territory.
<color=#00ff00>I will get it back and you better not be lying about it being free!</color>
@d0There is power running to this console.

@d0There is various navigational and sensor logs on this console. From what you can tell they were simple rum smugglers that were ambushed by a Zirax patrol vessel.\nYou find no mention of stealing a schematic.\nThe logs show the Zirax patrol vessel landed on the nearby moon for 34 minutes and then departed the system. Perhaps you can continue your search there.
@d0The console stands ready. A zirax hack was partially successful.

The schematic? Oh yes, about that. You see, I am afraid I may have... Exaggerated slightly as to the whereabouts of the schematic.

We've been having a problem with Zirax infiltrators sabotaging our prototype mining rigs. But we could not risk open warfare by dealing with them ourselves. That's where you came in.
@p9I knew that you would be willing to pay for the schematic, but I could not be sure whether you would be willing to risk killing members of the Zirax empire for it.
But if I told you that it had been stolen by a ruthless band of pirate scum? Well then that would give you a clear conscious to do what was needed.

Lying is such a strong word. I see it more as keeping out some unnecessary details.\nAt the end of the day, our Zirax problem has been dealt with and you are now free to purchase the schematic you seek.
Purchase? You said it would be free.

Free? Oh yes, I did say that, didn't I?\nWell then I will transfer a payment of 500,000 credits to your bank account for services rendered. Wait, did I say 500,000? I meant 10,000 credits. That's all you get. If you can cough up 3,000,000 credits then you are free to speak to me again to purchase the schematic.\nOr not. It's your choice.

@d0<color=#ff0000>You tried to turn in more data pads than you have or you entered an invalid quantity.</color>\n<color=#ff0000>You cannot turn in more data pads than you have in your personal inventory.</color>
@d0If you find a Data Pad you can turn it in here to obtain additional unlock points. Each pad is worth {Eden_Global_DataPad} unlock points.
I don't have any Data Pads. Back to Main Menu.
Hey there, glad you found my little boat. My village needs quite a lot of fish and I don't have much time left anymore.\nCan you please help me with fishing?\nIt won't be for nothing!
@q0 It looks like the school of fish is gone here. Maybe you have somewhere else more luck.
How is it going? Did you catch any fish yet?
@q0 Success, but you scared away the school of fish! You got {0} Fish!
@q0 You failed and scared away the school of fish! Try next time. Hint: Your current Fish skill is {0}. Try to reach a higher skill for better fishing chances!
@q0 You failed and scared away the school of fish! You have no Fish Bait or no Fish Rod with you. Go and get them before you can fish.
@q0 It looks like this Fish of School is gone. Try somewhere else or next time.
@q0 Hey, if you are looking for Fish, they are all gone already. Come back later.

Do you see the school of fish around the boat? It looks easy but they are fast and require some skill to catch. If you don't have fish equipment with you, I can sell you my spare one. Don't go near the school of fish without equipment! And don't forget: fishing is all about patience and the more often you fish, the better you get.
Sure, I'll be back with some Fish! (Accept Quest. End)
Oh, you need more Fishing equipment? I don't have much left anymore. I can only sell you the remaining things, so I can rebuy it tomorrow.
Buy 1 Fish Rod for {QuestFishRodPrice + 1000} credits (+1 Fish rod. -{1000 + QuestFishRodPrice} credits)
Buy 1 Fish bait for {QuestFishBaitPrice + 10} credits (+1 Fish bait. -{10 + QuestFishBaitPrice} credits)
Buy 1 Fish Rod for {QuestFishRodPrice + 1000} credits (Not enough credits)
Buy 1 Fish bait for {QuestFishBaitPrice + 10} credits (Not enough credits)
Awesome! I don't have much credits I can give you but I'll tell my people about your help and maybe I can teach you a few things about fishing.\nYour current fish skill is: {QuestFishChance}
Here is 1 Fish (-1 Fish. +100 Talon Reputation.)
Here is 1 Fish (-1 Fish. Improve fishing skill by +5%.)
@d0<color=#ffff00>You have already performed research at this lab.</color>\n<color=#ffff00>You must find a different research vessel to turn in your research reports.</color>

@q0@d0The POIs found on this planet may be <color=#ffff00>normal POIs</color> instead of the easier <color=#00ff00>starting POIs</color>. This gives an experience closer to the alpha versions of the game where you could find full abandoned POIs and Zirax bases to fight.
This means they may be much harder, and more rewarding, than your typical starting planet POI.

<color=#ffff00>These POIs may be challenging for a starting planet. It is highly recommended that you do not attempt to attack these POIs unless you are prepared for them.</color>
<color=#ffff00>You can easily lose your ship or find yourself in a bad spot. Play on this planet at your own risk.</color>

<color=#00ff00>I understand and will check the PDA.</color>
How do I start the story missions?

Delete message and exit mail system.
I changed my mind. Take me back to the main menu.

Use a science station to continue the expedition.

Hello! I don't currently do much around here. I am waiting for my orders and for that engineer Ravien to finish our scanning system.\nIn the future I may buy and sell various exploration supplies, but for now my stock is somewhat limited while we wait for him to stop slacking off.
Do you have anything to trade?
Mission complete.\nUse a science station to complete the expedition and collect your report.
Your final expedition report has been added to your inventory or connected container.
@d0All mission progress has been cleared.\nYou are now free to start another expedition.
@d0<color=#00ff00>Expedition final report added to your inventory or connected container.</color>
@d0This strange flower has grown considerably larger than the others.
How may this humble guardian aid you?
I found this strange flower. Are you able to make use of it?
Ah you have found a rare Solarium flower! These are quite useful. Please take this payment as gratitude.
You have already taken a sample.
You are an enemy of our people and I will not speak with you.
Greetings, traveler. How may this humble brewmaster serve you on this fine day?
@d0A hive of flying insects. They look like they can sting. Probably not a good idea to mess with it unless you know what you're doing. Or go ahead and mess with them. It's a free galaxy, after all.
Attempt to capture some of the stinging insects. <color=#ff0000>(Bad choice)</color>
Leave the stinging alien bugs alone. (Safe choice)
@d0Sticking your untrained hands into the hive was not a good idea. <color=#ff0000>You suffered several stings due to your incompetence.</color>
Slowly back away from the hive. (safe choice)
Attempt to capture some of the insects. <color=#ff0000>(Don't you learn?)</color>
I gathered some insects for you.
If you have any more insects I will take them off your hands.
Here. Take them, they look mean!
Never mind. I want to ask something else.

Yes, friend, I could use your help.
As part of the fermentation process we rely on a species of insects native only to this planet. Recently we have lost most of our current stock from an unknown illness and could use replacements.
You can find them in caves scattered across this planet. Search the cave until you come across a small hive.
Be warned, friend, I will need to show you how to safely capture them.
Please show me how to capture them safely.
I already know how to capture them.
No thank you. I prefer not to get stung to death today.
Watch carefully as I demonstrate.\n\nThe brewmaster demonstrates how to capture the insects from a hive without suffering stings.
Thank you. I want to ask something else.
Thank you for showing me. I will bring you back some insects.
Use your training to safely capture some of the insects.
Don't shoot! I'm friendly! Please, I'm not with the XCorp anymore. We got a new director and he stole credit for my ideas and tried to have me killed!

When I learned that the director put me on a hit list I fled to this secret lab.
I want revenge. Perhaps we can help each other? I have developed a nasty computer virus that will rapidly spread among the XCorp subspace network and scramble their computer systems for weeks, but I do not dare show my face to install it myself.
If you were to take this virus and install it into a console on a XCorp Mainframe or XCorp Lab on this moon and return to me, I will reward you for your time.
What do you say, Terran?
I thought Zirax were supposed to be loyal?
Loyalty is to the empire. XCorp is ran by outsiders and deserve no respect!
Here is a data chip with the computer virus. Install it and then get back to me. Kill anyone who gets in your way.\nOh and if you happen to run into the director, feel free to kill him too.
Thank you for your help. I have been monitoring their communications and the panic and chaos is glorious! This will set back their research efforts for weeks.
Ah, you survived. Good. I believe this reward will be appropriate.
This is all? Fine, goodbye then.
I see. I will help you.
Traitors deserve no help. You're on your own.
You have no idea what the passcode is.

Oh that's one nasty computer virus.

@d0<color=#00ffff>Message to U.C.H. High Command:</color>

Dear Mom and Pa, I'm loving it here. It's a bit boring at times but we don't have to worry about Zirax attacks or Polaris politics.
I've been reading some science books
Doctor Chan let me borrow to pass the time. I hope once I'm done with this assignment I could train to become a science officer. And after I get over this cold. With love, Avy

@d0<size=150%><color=#00ffff>Log 13:</color></size>
'See new worlds' they said.
'Discover ancient secrets' they said.
Now I'm stuck on some backwater ice dwarf, locked in my quarters for 'our safety'.
When U.C.H. said we'd be colonizing new planets, I expected some nice tropical paradise, not a frozen wasteland.
Project Eden? More like Project Freezin'!
@p9 @d0<size=150%><color=#00ffff>Log 14:</color></size>
Feel really sick. Like, really bad. I've called Dr. Chan but he hasn't answered. Been locked in my quarters for 8 hours now. Wait.
I just heard a scream outside my door. It sounded like Avi. What is going on?
I told them we should have left those alien ruins alone.

@d0<color=#00ffff>Commander Strickland's Log:</color>
I have confined the rest of the crew to their quarters both for their own safety and mine. They have begun acting irrational and violent ever since the 'incident' in the lab. One of our researchers fell ill and was transported via shuttle to the colony ship. We lost communication with the ship 2 days later. That was 5 days ago.

<color=#ff0000>Unable to establish communications link with ship. Please try again later...</color>
